loans.name: Tram

texts.en: Mrs. Tram is 37 years old and her husband is 38 years old.  They have three children. Only the youngest child still attends school.  They have no land apart from their hut.  Everyday Mrs. Tram sells rice cake from door-to-door.  The family income is $7 per person/month. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to support her in her business. She will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to sell rice cakes from door-to-door

loans.name: Le

texts.en: Mrs. Le was born in 1977.  She lives with her mother-in-law, husband, and son. Everyday she sells vegetables at the local market while her mother-in-law sells pork.  When she finishes selling the vegetables, she stays to help her mother-in-law.  The family income is $13 per person/month.  She needs a loan of $75 to support her business.  Mrs. Le will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to sell vegetables and pork

loans.name: Nuong

texts.en: Mrs. Nuong was born in 1976 and her husband was born 1973.  They have two children who are students in primary school.  Her husband drives a motor taxi everyday while Mrs. Nuong sells soft drinks at the gate of the local school. Their income is about $10 per person/month. They need to receive a loan of $75 to support their activity.  They will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to sell soft drinks at the gate of the local school.

loans.name: Aziz

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 26 years old. He is married and has 3 children. He has a hairdresser shop in the middle of Kirkuk. He has applied to get $1200 to purchase new furniture and a mirror, hire one unemployed person, and do some advertising for the shop in order to increase his income and make a better life for his family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new furniture and mirror

loans.name: Abdul Hamid

texts.en: Abdul Hamid lives in District 17 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He is a young and talented man.  He had left Afghanistan for six years but has now returned and opened a dress shop.  He wants to take out an individual loan to buy new kinds of clothing, especially for women, to attract more clients and make more income to expand his business.  He is happy that he can improve his business.

loans.use: to buy new kinds of clothing

loans.name: Frideen

texts.en: Frideen lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He is single and lives with his family.  He started his own business selling DVDs and cassettes.  He wants to improve his business so that he can make a good income and be successful in the future.

loans.use: to improve his business

loans.name: Mohammad Anowar

texts.en: M. Anowar lives in District 6 of Kabul, Afghanistan.  He is married and has four children, two sons and two daughters.  He is a shopkeeper, he  sells glasses and plates and some other goods.  He wants to expand his business, therefore he wants to take out an individual loan to improve his shop.  He hopes to make a good monthly income and support his family.  He wants his childen to have a better education.  He is happy that he can improve his business.

loans.use: to improve his store

loans.name: Sadyar

texts.ru:
Sadyar K. was born in 1976 in Aksu. He now lives and has a business in the same town. Sadyar is married and has one child. Sadyar has a small grocery store on the central market. Sadyar used his first Normicro credit to expand his business. Now, he asks for another loan to continue the expansion.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Кулиев Садяр. Родилсья 1976 году в городе Аксу. Данный момент проживает и занимаеться бизнесом в этом жэ городе.Женат ,имеет одного ребенка. Центральном рынке держить небольшой маркет.Первый раз взял кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала и активно стал работат. Садяру нужен еще кредит.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Mamishov

texts.ru:
A. Mamishov was born in 1965. He is married and has 2 children. He lives in Aksu. A.’s former job did not provide enough income to sustain his family, so A. decided to start a business. In 2005, he turned to Normicro for help and received $300. The money helped A. to establish an active sales business. Now, A. wants to obtain a $500 to purchase more goods.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Мемишов Алаббас, 1965 года рождения. Семейный, имеет двоих детей. Родилсья и проживает в городе Аксу. Со старой работой тяжело было прокормить семью.Алаббас хотел заниматься бизнесом. Он обратилься за помощью в Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. 2005 году взял кредит на сумму 300$ и активно стал заниматсья торговли . 2006 еще раз взял кредит на 500$.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Zahir

texts.ru:
Zahir N. lives in Aksu. He was born in 1975. Zahir is married and has 2 children. For more than 2 years, he has been selling fruits and vegetables on the central market. In 2006, Zahir took a $500 loan to finance business expansion. Now he wishes to take another Normicro loan to continue growing his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Нагиев Захир проживает в городе Аксу. Он родилься 1975 году. Женат. Имеет двоих детей. В центральном рынке более двух лет торгует фруктами и овощами. 2006 году взял кредит на сумму 500$. Этот кредит помогло ему расширять свой бизнес.Захир очередной раз хочеть взять кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Agil

texts.ru:
Agil E. was born in 1972 in Aksu. He is married and has no children. Five years ago, Agil actively engaged in business. To finance business expansion, he took a loan from Aksu branch of Normicro. The first loan served its purpose very well. Now, Agil asks Normicro for another loan to purchase additional inventory.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Еюбов Агил.Родилься 1972 году в городе Аксу.Женат, детей нет. Пять лет назад начал активный бизнес.Чтобы расширяться он взял кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала .Кредит на самом деле для него был удачным . Тепер он повторно обратилься в Нормикро Аксуниского филиала за помощью.

loans.use: To purchase more goods

loans.name: Azada

texts.ru:
Azada D. was born in 1968 in Aksu where she lives today. She is married and has 2 children. Azada owns a small store at the central market. She sells clothing for women. Azada applied for a Normicro loan to repair her store.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Джафарова Азаде.1968 года рождения.Родилась и проживает в городе Аксу. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Она центральном рынке в Аксу держить маленький маркет. Торгует женскими одеждами. Азада хочеть взять кредит чтобы, отремонтировать свой маркет. По этому она обратилась в Нормикро Аксуниского филиала.

loans.use: For store repair

loans.name: Mardan

texts.ru:
Mardan M. was born in 1960. He lives in Aksu. Mardan is married and has 2 children. For more than 10 years, he works as a builder. This hardworking man turned to Normicro for a loan to finance purchase of new tools for his business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Магеррамов Мардан. 1960 года рождения. Проживает в городе Аксу. Семейный. Имеет двоих детей. Более десяти лет работает мастером. Этот трудолюбивый человек обратилься в Нормикро Аксуниского филиала, чтобы взять кредит . В этом ему помогли. Этот хороший мастер хочеть купить новые инструменты для своего бизнеса.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Sevil

texts.ru:
Sevil Q. was born in 1955. She lives in Aksu. She is married and has 2 children. She sells clothing on the central market. In 2005, Sevil took her first Normicro credit. This is her third loan application. Sevil plans to use the money to expand her business.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Курбанова Севиль.Родилась 1955 году.Проживает в городе Аксу. Семейная, имеет двоих детей. В центральном рынке торгует одеждами. 2005 году она взяла первый кредит из Нормикро Аксуниского филиала. Уже третий раз она обращаеться в Нормикро. Севиль хочеть расширять свой бизнес

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Durasan

texts.ru:
Durasan Q. was born in 1961. He is married and has 4 children. He has been a builder for 20 years. His tools are too old to produce quality job. Durasan applied for this Normicro loan to finance the purchase of new tools.

Translated from Russian by Aleksandr Zhuk, Kiva Volunteer.

Касумов Дурасан.1961 года рождения. Женат, имеет четверо детей. Двадцать лет подряд работает мастером. Со старым инструментом работа не дают хорошего результата. Дурасан по этому обратилься вНормикро Аксуниского филиала. Взяв кредит он поменяеть свой инструмент.

loans.use: To purchase new tools

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 30 years old. She is married and has 3 children, two of them in school. She has a small sewing shop in her house. She has applied to get $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some new fabric in order to expand her business, develop herself and increase her income.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.

Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Anver

texts.en: Anver is a 32-year-old resident of Khachmaz town, which is located in northeastern Azerbaijan. For the last 10 years, he has rented a stall in a local market where he has sold various food products to his customers. He would like to expand the size of his business and attract more clients by increasing the number and variety of items he sells in his shop. To do this, he has applied to Normicro Khachmaz for a loan of $400, which he will use to increase his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham is a 41-year-old resident of Khachmaz town, where he lives with his wife and two children. He rents a small shop in a local market where he sells crystal and glass products that he buys from wholesalers in Baku. He has been in this business for more than 10 years. Demand is high, but he does not have enough goods to sell. In the past, he has expanded his inventory with two loans from Normicro Khachmaz that he repaid promptly and fully. Now he has applied for a loan of $1,000 to buy more goods and expand the variety of items available for purchase in his shop.

loans.use: To increase the number and variety of goods for sale in his shop

loans.name: Jamshid

texts.en: Jamshid is 40 years old and lives in Khachmaz town in northeastern Azerbaijan with his wife and two children. He rents a booth in the local market where he sells clothes and shoes that he buys in Baku's famous airport market. He has been in this business for nine years, and in that time has successfully repaid two prior loans from Normicro Khachmaz that allowed him to expand his business. Now he has applied for a loan of $1,500 to buy new goods to sell in his shop. Our goal is to secure $1,200 of that amount from Kiva; the balance of $300 will be funded by Normicro Khachmaz.

loans.use: To increase the size of his shop's inventory

loans.name: Aslan

texts.en: Aslan H. is 51 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz with his wife and three children. He rents a small booth in the local market where he sells mostly women's clothing that he buys from wholesalers in Baku and at Azerbaijan's famous airport market. He has been in this  business for 12 years, and has taken out two loans from Normicro Khachmaz. He repaid both promptly, proving himself to be one of our best clients. Now he has come to us for a loan of $2,000 to buy seasonal goods. Of that sum, we hope that $1,200 will come from Kiva; the balance of $800 will be funded by Normicro Khachmaz.

loans.use: To buy new goods to sell

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en: Zahida is 48 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz in northeastern Azerbaijan with her husband and four children. She rents a small booth in the local market where she sells women's clothing that she buys from wholesale shops in Baku and her country's well-known airport market. She has been in this business for the last four years, and in that time has received a $300 loan from Normicro Khachmaz which she repaid fully and on time. Now she has come to us for a new loan of $500 to increase her stock of goods, especially seasonal clothing which she believes her customers will be eager to purchase.

loans.use: To increase the size of her shop's inventory

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en: Haydar M. is 40 years old and lives in the town of Khachmaz in northeastern Azerbaijan  with his wife and two children. For the last 14 years he has sold hardware in a booth he rents in a local market. In the past, Haydar successfully expanded his business with a loan of $350 from Normicro Khachmaz. Now he would like to expand his business -- and his income -- again, with a loan of $500 which he will use to increase the stock of goods he can sell to his customers.

loans.use: To increase the number and variety of goods for sale

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en: Yashar is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in the town of Khachmaz. He rents a booth in a local market, where he sells hardware and other items he makes out of sheet metal. He also produces items for clients who place special orders with him. He makes these items in a small workshop in his house, where he has run his business for the last 15 years. He would like to expand this business, and has applied for a loan of $800 from Normicro Khachmaz to the buy tools and sheet metal he needs to make that happen.

loans.use: To buy tools and sheet metal

loans.name: Nabi

texts.en: Yashar N. is 54 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Khachmaz region of northeastern Azerbaijan. He has a small workshop where he repairs cars, sells spare parts and does simple welding jobs. Yashar has worked in this field for more than six years, and would like to increase his income by expanding his business. To do this, he has come to Normicro Khachmaz  for a loan of $1,000 to buy tools and spare parts. This is his second loan from Normicro.

loans.use: To buy tools and spare parts

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 30 years old and lives in the northeastern Azerbaijan region known as Khachmaz. He works as a taxi driver, using his own car to transport people around town and to distant places such as Baku. His income is not what it could be because his car is old and prone to break down, especially if he drives long distances. He has applied for a loan of $300 to repair his car so that he can provide better service to his customers and increase his income.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Rovshan

texts.en: Samir is a 30-year-old internally displaced person from the Aghdam region of Azerbaijan. He now lives in the town of Khachmaz, where he  works as a taxi driver using his own car. He drives both within the town and longer distances to places such as Baku. To continue to support himself and his family, he needs to get the engine of his car rebuilt, buy spare parts and pay for repairs. Because he does not have the funds to do this, he has come to Normicro Khachmaz for a loan of $1,200.

loans.use: To repair his car

loans.name: Achmad Hambali

texts.id:
As head of household Achmad Hambali is responsible for his wife and his very beloved daughter - Putri Novita - who is 5 years old and just started Grade school. To financed his daily needs Hambali has a Fried Food sales business. With the help of his wife he prepared the push cart used for sales. He started sales at 6:00PM until all his items were sold late in the night. So far for his sales he needs per sales a capital of about Rp60,000 (about US$7) with a nett profit of Rp20,000 (about $2.20). Besides this fried food sales during the day Hambali helped his brother in motor sales. From this he got extra income. Hambali expects to get a loan from DINARI for Rp2,500,000 (about$275) to expand his fried food business. This capital will be used to add more variation of his fried food, so that the consumers would be more attracted to stop by and buy his items. He hoped to profit about Rp50,000(about $5.50)/day. Hambali's main business is fried food sales. He hoped the best for his business. He hoped that as long as his daughter is still small he could expand his business to be a bigger one.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sebagai kepala rumah tangga Achmad Hambali bertanggung jawab atas istri dan satu putri semata wayangnya – Putri Novita – yang berumur 5 tahun dan duduk di bangku TK. Untuk memenuhi kebutuhan hidupnya sehari – hari Hambali memiliki usaha jual gorengan. Dibantu oleh istrinya dia menyiapkan rombong yang dia gunakan untuk jualan. Dia mulai jualan pukul 6 sore sampai dagangannya habis terjual. Selama ini - apabila dia berjualan - modal yang diperlukan untuk sekali jualan ± Rp 60.000,00 dengan keuntungan bersih Rp 20.000,00. Selain usaha jual gorengan ini, pada siang hari Hambali ikut dengan saudaranya untuk usaha jual beli motor. Dari usaha ini dia memperoleh uang tambahan yang masuk tiap bulan. Hambali mendapat pinjaman Rp 2.500.000,00 dari DINARI untuk mengembangkan usaha gorengannya. Modal ini akan dia gunakan untuk menambah variasi gorengan yang dia jual, agar konsumen lebih tertarik untuk singgah dan membeli dagangannya. Harapannya keuntungan menjadi ± Rp 50.000,00/hari. Usaha utama Hambali adalah usaha gorengan. Dia berharap banyak dengan usahanya ini. Dia berharap selama anaknya masih kecil dia bisa mengembangkan usahanya ini menjadi semakin besar.

loans.use:
To buy ingredients for fried food, like bananas, tempeh, tofu

Membeli bahan baku gorengan seperti pisang, tempe, tahu,

loans.name: Suis Muryaning

texts.id:
Suis Muryaning is blessed with 2 daughters and one son. The first daughter is in 5th Grade, while his son the third child is still 3 years old. Therefore this housewife is very busy. Her second daughter is in 1st Grade. Daily expenses are quite high. For food each day about Rp20,000 (about US$2.20). Education expenses for the children averaged Rp200,000 ($22)/month. This electrical sales is done by Suis and her husband. They propose to use glass racks. These racks would be used for sales items display. Everyday they work from her rented place from 08:00 to 20:00. The capital they hope to obtain will be used to add the number of items to be sold. There are items they bought for weekly inventory, there are also items for monthly inventory. Each month they hope to profit Rp1,500,000 (about $165). Suis and husband hope that their 3 children will have enough food, and that they could go for higher education.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Suis Muryaning dikaruniai dua orang putri dan satu orang putra. Putrinya yang pertama duduk di kelas 5 SD, sedangkan putranya yang ketiga baru berumur tiga tahun. Tentunya - di rumah - ibu rumah tangga ini sangat repot. Putrinya yang kedua masih kelas 1 SD. Biaya hidup sehari hari yang dikeluarkannya pasti cukup besar. Biaya hidup mereka untuk makan saja perhari sekitar Rp 20.000,00. Biaya pendidikan anak - anaknya perbulan rata - rata Rp 200.000,00. Usaha jual alat - alat listrik ini ditekuni oleh Suis bersama dengan suami. Sarana yang mereka gunakan adalah rak – rak kaca. Rak – rak ini digunakan untuk tempat memajang barang – barang yang dijual. Setiap harinya mereka memulai usaha – di rumah kontrakannya – dari pukul 08.00 wita sampai dengan pukul 20.00 wita. Modal yang mereka peroleh digunakan untuk menambah jumlah barang dagangan mereka. Ada barang – barang yang mereka beli untuk stok mingguan, ada juga yang mereka beli untuk stok bulanan. Peluang usaha mereka cukup bagus. Hal ini bisa dilihat dari keuntungan yang mereka dapatkan. Setiap bulannya keuntungan yang diperoleh mencapai Rp 1.500.000,00. Suis dan suaminya berharap bahwa tiga orang anak mereka tidak akan kekurangan makanan dan dapat tetap melanjutkan sekolah mereka ke jenjang yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use:
To buy sales items like cables, lamps, etc

Membeli barang - barang dagangan seperti kabel, lampu, dll.

loans.name: Muhamad Fadly

texts.id:
Muhamad Fadly has a business to sell toys/candies with gifts since 2002, with 3 helpers. The calculation was for each candy package with gifts he needed a capital of Rp70,000 (about US$7.70), and a profit could reach up to Rp70,000 too. Given that the whole candy package was sold clear. Now fadly has 3 helpers that make a round to sell these sales items to food stall customers, to be picked up at an agreed time, about 1-2 weeks. Also to deliver new sales items. The places they deliver are larger cities like Denpasar, Tabanan, Giayanar and Singaraja. Each person including Fadly will bring 10 package of candies using motorbikes. Gasoline expense was about Rp25,000 (about US3)/person/day. Since he sees an opportunity Fadly wishes to increase the number of helpers. Therefore he needed more capital.He also expect increase the number of package of these candies with gifts. The Rp5,500,000 (about $625) he expects to get from DINARI will be used to increase 2 additional helper.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Muhamad Fadly mempunyai usaha jual mainan/permen berhadiah yang sudah ditekuninya sejak tahun 2002. Dengan jumlah anak buah 3 orang. Perhitungannya, untuk 1 pak permen berhadiah modal yang diperlukan Rp 70.000,00 dan keuntungannya yang akan dicapai sebesar Rp 70.000,00. Hal ini tentunya dengan catatan satu pak permen tersebut terjual habis. Sekarang ini Fadly memiliki 3 anak buah yang berkeliling menjajakan barang dagangan tersebut. Mereka menitipkan di warung – warung langganan mereka untuk diambil pada waktu yang terlah disepakati, 1 – 2 minggu. Sekaligus menitipkan lagi barang – barang dagangan yang baru. Tempat yang mereka singgahi mulai dari Denpasar, Tabanan, Giayanar dan Singaraja. Masing masing orang – termasuk Fadly - membawa 10 pak permen dengan mengendarai sepeda motor. Biaya bensin Rp 25.000,00/orang untuk perhari. Karena melihat peluang usaha ini bagus, Fadly ingin menambah jumlah anak buah. Hal itu berarti dibutuhkan modal yang lebih banyak. Selain itu jumlah pak permen berhadiah yang dibawa oleh masing – masing karyawannya akan bertambah. Modal Rp 5.500.000,00 yang diperoleh dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah 2 orang anak buah lagi.

loans.use:
To add two helpers

Menambah 2 anak buah lagi.

loans.name: Vidadi

texts.en:
S. Vidadi is a low-income inhabitant of Beylagan district, Azerbaijan.
He is 49, married, and has 5 children. Vidadi used to work as a foreman in this mill. He has got 11 years of experience in this business. Recently he started to rent this mill from the owner and continue the business himself. He has 4 employees. They buy wheat from Beylagan farmers and produce flour as raw material for bread production. S. is applying for the first time to Normicro for a loan of US$ 1200 to buy wheat to increase flour production.

loans.use: to buy wheat to increase production of flour

loans.name: Mohammad Kabir

texts.en: Mohammad Kabir lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married and educated, but he has always liked to have his own business. He sells building supplies. He has a small shop, so he wants to enlarge his business. He wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials for his shop and build a close relationship with the construction companies. He wants to make a good income for his family. He is happy with this loan.

loans.use: To buy extra materials

loans.name: Yagut

texts.en: Yagut is a low-income person of Beylagan, married, with 3 children. She has been in this business for 5 years. She runs this fruit stand as a family business together with her husband and son. Her husband brings the fruit from Ganja City's wholesale market in his car and she sells it together with her son. Yagut is applying for a loan of US$ 900 to increase their capital and thus the volume of business.

loans.use: to increase volume of working capital

loans.name: Zaur

texts.en:
Zaur is an internally displaced person from the Armenian-Azeri conflict zone who has been in Fizuli district since 1993. He is married and has 1 child. He is 26. Despite his having only 1 year experience in this business, he is accepted as a good master. He has many clients.

Zaur receives orders from clients to go to their home to do furniture repair. Recently he rented a place to start his own furniture shop. He mainly makes sofas and armchairs, sewing the upholstery himself. He wants to borrow US$ 300 to buy materials to develop his business.

loans.use: to buy materials for furniture production

loans.name: Salman

texts.en: Salman is a Beylagan district inhabitant. He is married and has 4 children. He has been selling men's clothing in the market for 10 years. He is also supported by his wife. He wants to receive a loan of US$ 1000 to buy seasonal clothing appropriate for the new school year.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing for resale

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar is a Beylagan district inhabitant. He is married and has 3 children. He sells men's and women's shoes in the market. He works without family support, but he owns his place of business. He buys his inventory at Baku Airport wholesale market, making purchasing trips 2-3 times a month.

Ilgar is requesting a loan of US$ 700 to expand his inventory and thus increase his shoe sales.

loans.use: to increase volume of shoe sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Apriandi

texts.id:
Apriandi is an energic young man. He works hard. Apriandi is still single so he does not have any additional burden yet. Since he lives in a rented room, and did not cook himself, his daily living expense is Rp35,000 (about $3.80). So far Apriandi sells Kebaya (local fashion) shirts in the New Market, Kebo Iwa street in Denpasar, Bali. His motor cycle is essential to run his business, distributing his sales goods. With a capital of $10,000,000.00 (about US$1100), he could profit about Rp50,000-100,000 ($5.50-$11)/night. Capital from DINARI will be used to increase the number of his sales items. Apriandi also got an opportunity to open a place in a new location, Darmasaba market. Distance between Darmasaba market and Kebo Iwa New Market is 10km (about 6.5 miles). He sells in Darmasaba market in the morning, and at night at Kebo Iwa new market. He started work at 6:00 AM till 6:00 PM. The rest of time he used to find items for sales, and opportunities at other promising markets. His hope by adding new sales area is to increase daily profit to Rp100,000.00-Rp200,000.00 (about $11-$22).

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Apriandi anak muda yang enerjik. Dia sangat rajin bekerja. Apriandi belum berkeluarga, jadi dia masih belum memiliki tanggungan. Karena dia tinggal di kos – kosan dan tidak masak makanannya sendiri, biaya hidup per harinya mencapai Rp 35.000,00. Apriandi selama ini berjualan baju kebaya di pasar baru Jl. Kebo Iwa, Denpasar, Bali. Sepeda motor miliknya adalah sarana yang sangat dia butuhkan untuk kelangsungan usahanya ini dalam mendistribusikan barang – barang dagangannya. Dengan modal Rp 10.000.000,00 keuntungan yang diperoleh mencapai Rp 50.000,00 – Rp 100.000,00/malam. Modal dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah jumlah barang – barang dagangan. Sekarang Apriandi mendapat peluang usaha yang sama di tempat yang baru, yaitu di pasar Darmasaba. Jarak antara Pasar Darmasaba dengan Pasar Baru Kebo Iwa adalah 10 km. Dia berjualan pada pagi hari di pasar Darmasaba dan berjualan pada malam harinya di Pasar Baru Kebo Iwa. Waktunya di pasar mulai dari pukul 6 pagi sampai dengan 6 sore. Waktu sisanya digunakan untuk mencari barang – barang dagangan yang dia jual dan juga mencari kemungkinan pasar lain yang peluangnya menjanjikan baginya. Harapannya - dengan menambah tempat usaha berdagang - dia memperoleh keuntungan per hari ± Rp 100.000,00 – Rp 200.000,00.

loans.use:
To add number of sales items

Menambah jumlah barang – barang dagangan

loans.name: Tahir

texts.en: Tahir Z. is an internally displaced person from the Armenian-Azerbaijanian conflict district, Jabrail of Azerbaijan. He fled to Beylagan in 1993. He is married, 43 years old, and has 3 children. He has been running his private business for 13 years and already owns his place of business. He has 1 shop assistant and is doing well. He buys goods from Baku City, the capital. Tahir would like to borrow US$ 1200 to expand his inventory and thus increase his volume of sales.

loans.use: to expand his inventory and thus increase volume of sales

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nor Khoda

texts.en: Nor Khoda lives in district 15 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married, and he has one small son. He has a metal shop. He was small boy when he started working, so he has a lot of experience in his job. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy new machines for his shop and also increase his stock to attract more clients. He is happy that he can expand his business with this loan.

loans.use: To buy new machines

loans.name: Homida

texts.en:
T. Homida has been trading toys and childrens' clothes from Somon (Atushbazaar) in Khujand for six years. She loves children and prides herself on meeting the individual needs of each individual child.
In the beginning she sold only children clothes, but gradually she began to include toys into her range. Presently she has a lot of clients and her turnover of her working capital is good. In the future she wants to expand her range by including automatic toys. She also plans to purchase warm clothes with her requested loan. For these purposes she is requesting a loan of $1000.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Sugeng Hariyadi

texts.id:
Sugeng Hariyadi lives in a rented place, 5 Pulau Pinang Street with is wife and 2 sons, Arief Rahman and Zacky. His place is clean, one bathroom, a living room, a bedroom, and a small kitchen. Nicknamed Pak (Mr.) Arief, like his older son sales location is in front of the alley about 50 meters (55 yards) from where he lives. He started sales at 5:00PM. He uses a cart. To buy ingredients in the market he uses his motor cycle. His wife is helping him running the business. Before Rp50,000 (about US$5.50)was sufficient to buy oil, flour and bananas. However, now everything has increased. He needs Rp80,000 (about $8.80)/day to buy ingredients. Monthly profit is Rp650,000.00(about US$70). However daily expense is Rp30,000.00 ($3.30). In the morning he works as advertising billboard installer on the streets. His wife sews. She often receive orders from the garment manufacturer for a monthly income of Rp500,000.00(about $55). Their first son is in 9th grade (3rd class middle school), while the second is in first grade. They have high hopes for their 2 sons. The capital he will receive will be used to buy more ingredients. Prospects for business is good. Pak Arief hopes to expand this fried food business from volume as well as variation of fried items he will add.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Sugeng Hariyadi tinggal di kos – kosan Jl. Pulau Pinang 5X bersama seorang isteri dan dua putranya – Arief Rahman dan Zacky. Tempatnya bersih, kamar mandi di dalam, satu ruang tamu, satu kamar tidur dan dapur yang sempit. Tempat Pak Arief - begitu dia biasa dipanggil, sesuai dengan nama putra pertamanya - berjualan, di depan gang tempat tinggalnya kira – kira 50 m dari rumahnya. Dia mulai berjualan pukul 5 sore. Sarana yang digunakan adalah sebuah rombong. Untuk membeli bahan – bahan baku di pasar dia menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya. Dalam menjalankan usahanya ini Pak Arief dibantu oleh isterinya. Kalau dulu dia membeli bahan minyak, tepung dan pisang seharga Rp 50.000,00. Namun, sekarang semua harga barang meningkat. Pak Arief memerlukan dana sekitar Rp 80.000,00 per harinya untuk membeli bahan baku. Keuntungan per bulannya Rp 650.000,00. Sedangkan biaya hidup per harinya Rp 30.000,00. Pada pagi hari dia bekerja sebagai tukang pasang reklame/baliho di jalan – jalan. Isterinya memiliki ketrampilan menjahit. Dia sering menerima order dari garment dengan penghasilan per bulannya mencapai Rp 500.000,00. Putranya yang pertama kelas 3 SMP, sedangkan yang kedua kelas 1 SD. Dia berharap banyak pada kedua putranya. Modal yang dia dapatkan akan dia pakai untuk membeli lebih banyak bahan baku. Usaha ini prospeknya bagus. Usaha jual gorengan ini ingin Pak Arief kembangkan, baik dari segi jumlah gorengan maupun variasi gorengan yang dijual.

loans.use:
To buy more ingredients, like oil, bananas, tofu, tempeh, etc

Membeli lebih banyak bahan baku seperti minyak goreng, pisang, tahu, tempe, dll

loans.name: Tursunoy

texts.en:
Temurova Tursunoy is a dynamic businesswoman and owns her own wedding salon, renting out wedding dresses. She is married with three children and is a highly experienced designer. 
She buys her goods from Russia through an online catalogue. One batch of her dresses consists of 10-20 items, with all necessary accessories such as veil, gloves and so on. She wants to expand her business by including decorated wedding cars, wedding halls and clothes for the groom as well as the bride and is requesting a loan of $800, payable over 8 months.

loans.use: Business expansion

loans.name: Supriadi

texts.id:
Supriadi lives in a rented place. There are about 50 rooms, very crowded. There is an inside bathroom, kitchen, a bedroom and a living room. The living room is also his place of business. Usually the customers come to Pak (Mr.) Supri (nickname) asking for jacket to be sewn. The cost to sew a jacket is between Rp50,000.00-70,000.00 (US$ 5.50-7.70) depending on difficulty. if orders are slow, Pak Supri would also takes orders from an artshop in Ktua. For transportation Pak Supri uses his motor cycle to pick up and delivers the orders. Supriadi lives with his wife and two son and daughter. His son is in 9th grade (3rd class middle school), and his daughter in 1st grade. His wife used to work in a Taylor shop, but has to give up to bring and pick up the children to school. However she is helping him with sewing too. The capital that would be received would be used to buy another sewing machine, so that the sewing process could be done faster, also completing more orders. So far Pak Supri only receive orders, with raw materials brought by the customers. However, he plans to make shirts from his own raw materials and sell it in the artshop. This will increase his business and creativity.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Supriadi tinggal di sebuah rumah kos. Ada sekitar 50 kamar, sangat padat. Ada kamar mandi dalam, dapur, satu kamar tidur dan satu ruang tamu. Ruang tamu inilah tempat usahanya. Biasanya pelanggan sendiri yang datang ke rumah Pak Supri, minta dijahitkan jaket. Ongkos jahit satu jaket antara Rp 50.000,00 – Rp 70.000,00, tergantung tingkat kesulitannya. Kalau sepi pesanan. Pak Supri mengambil pesanan dari artshop di Kuta. Sebagai alat transportasi, Pak Supri menggunakan sepeda motor untuk mengambil dan mengantar pesanan. Supriyadi tinggal bersama isteri dan kedua putra putrinya. Putranya kelas 3 SMP dan Putrinya kelas 1 SD. Isterinya pernah kerja di Taylor, tetapi karena anaknya sekolah, dia harus mengantar dan menjemput anaknya di sekolah. Isterinya sendiri ikut membantu suaminya menjahit. Modal yang didapat akan dibelikan mesin jahit lagi. Supaya proses menjahitnya lebih cepat, pesanan yang bisa diselesaikan juga semakin banyak. Mengenai bahan baku, untuk saat ini Pak Supri hanya menerima pesanan. Jadi bahannya dibawa oleh yang memesan. Namun, dia berencana untuk bisa membuat baju dari bahan yang dia punyai sendiri untuk dijual di artshop. Hal ini tentu akan lebih membuka peluang baginya untuk lebih mengembangkan usaha dan kreatifitasnya.

loans.use:
To buy a sewing machine

Membeli mesin jahit.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: M. lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is educated. He is responsible for his family as he is the only worker in his family, and he supports his father and mother. He has a painting shop where he paints cars. He wants to enlarge his shop, so he wants to take an individual loan to completely stock his shop and expand his business to attract more clients. He wants to make a good income to help his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To stock his shop

loans.name: Titik Harwati

texts.id:
With her husband and two sons Titik Harwati live in a rented house. That house consist of a bedroom, a living roo, a bathroom and a small kitchen. Although busy raising her second son aged 9 month, Titik still work on her cake sales business. She is doing this business to help her husband increase family income. Several assortment of cakes she made herself, others also from customers. Titik rented a small shop on a street side about 2 km (1.3 miles) from her rented home. She used her bicycle as mode of transportation. Her first son is in 8th grade (2nd class of middle school), and her second son is still 9 month old. Daily living expenses is Rp30,000.00 (about US$3.30), while schooling expenses for first son is Rp120,000.00 (about $13)/month. Additional capital from DINARI will be used to increase cake inventory, and its variataion. This would answer her wish to expand her business. Daily expenses and children's education could also be fulfilled.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Bersama dengan suami dan kedua putranya Titik Harwati tinggal di sebuah rumah kos. Rumahnya terdiri dari satu kamar tidur, satu ruang tamu, satu kamar mandi dalam dan dapur kecil. Walaupun merasa repot mengurus anaknya yang kedua –berumur 9 bulan – Titik tetap mengelola usaha dagang kue miliknya. Titik menekuni usaha ini untuk membantu suaminya menambah penghasilan keluarga. Beberapa macam kue yang dijual dibuatnya sendiri, namun ada juga yang berasal dari langganannya. Titik menyewa sebuah toko kecil di pinggir jalan. Jarak tempuh usaha dengan kos - kosannya ± 2 km. Dia menggunakan sepeda motor sebagai alat transportasi. Putranya yang pertama kelas 2 SMP, sedangkan putranya yang kedua masih 9 bulan. Biaya hidup perhari mereka Rp 30.000,00 dengan biaya pendidikan putra pertama mereka Rp 120.000,00 per bulannya. Tambahan modal yang dia peroleh dari DINARI akan dia pakai untuk menambah persediaan jumlah kuenya, terlebih variasinya. Tentunya ini akan menjawab keinginannya untuk semakin mengembangkan usahanya. Kebutuhan sehari - hari dan pendidikan anaknya tentu akan terpenuhi.

loans.use:
To add inventory of her cake to be sold

Menambah persediaan kue dagangannya.

loans.name: Majeedan

texts.en: I am a poor woman with six children; we have a family business making paper envelopes.  We get the raw material (paper) from the nearby paper market and sell the finished goods to various other markets. All my children assist me in this business except the youngest one and my husband. My husband works as a salesman at a spare parts shop with a very little pay. I never had enough resources to educate my kids, and so they were deprived of their basic human right, but now I wish to educate my youngest one. I would like to borrow $425 so that we can purchase more raw materials to produce more envelopes.

loans.use: Want to purchase sufficient quantity of raw materials

loans.name: Balqees

texts.en:
My name is Balqees S.. I have six children, all of whom are enrolled in school. My husband and I make paper envelopes. We both have been working very hard throughout our lives to realize our dream of educating all our children. Now we are in a position where we do not now how we will manage to send our children to university, as it is very expensive. Before this time comes, we want to make our business generate a better income and are seeking a loan $400 to purchase more materials to sell in  the market. 
Balqees S.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials

loans.name: Zahida

texts.en:
I have been embroidering for the last ten years, and am very good at my work. I have four children, two of which study at a local school and two who are not of school going age yet. My husband’s eyesight was lost in an accident and he is unable to work. I am the only breadwinner for my family. Eid (Muslim religious festival) is approaching and there is a high demand for embroidered clothes during the season so I wish to manufacture a large quantity. I need to buy raw materials in sufficient quantity. Please lend me $300 so that I can put food on my table and send all of my children to school.
Zahida P.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery materials

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Trần Thị C., 32 years old, lives with her husband and their 2 young children. They are a little happy family. They run a catering business making "bánh quẩy", kind of finger - shaped soufle' batter, to accompany soup or porridge. They supply "bánh quẩy" to the restaurants in the region. They live in the village of Trung giã, Sóc Sơn, Hà Nội. They had built a 2 storey house in 2006 after 10 years of hard work and saving. Their revenue is about 125 USD a month. They have 1 employee who gets paid 40 USD a month. Ms C. is requesting a loan of 950 USD to buy more stock (rice flour), expand her facility and to buy machinery.

Translater from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Trần Thị C. năm nay 32 tuổi đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ, cuộc sống gia đình họ rất hạnh phúc. Công việc chính của gia đình là chế biến bánh quẩy, một loại thực phẩm thường ăn kèm với phở cháo, phục vụ cho các quán ăn. Họ sống và làm ăn tại xã Trung giã, Sóc Sơn, Hà Nội trong căn nhà 2 tầng mới được xây năm 2006. Đây là thành quả tích lũy được sau 10 năm lao động của 2 anh chị. Thu nhập bình quân của 2 anh chị hiện nay khoảng 125USD/tháng. Ngoài ra 2 chị còn thuê thêm 1 nhân công và trả công 40USD/tháng. Chị đang làm hồ sơ xin vay 950USD để mua thêm nguyên liệu (bột mì) làm quẩy. Trong thời gian tới chị dự định sẽ mở rộng địa điểm sản xuất và mua máy làm quẩy thay cho sản xuất thủ công.

loans.use: buy rice flour to make finger-shaped soufflé

loans.name: Nasir

texts.en:
Nasir is 26 years old and a resident of Aghsu region, located in the central part of Azerbaijan. He works as a taxi driver in Aghsu Town, using his own car. He works inside the town but also sometimes goes long distances such as to Baku and other regions.

Nasir needs to buy new tyres for his taxi. As he has little money of his own, he has applied to Normicro's Khachmaz branch to borrow US$ 500 to purchase new tyres and to make some repairs on the taxi as well.

loans.use: To buy new tyres

loans.name: Parveen

texts.en: Parveen A. and her husband make paper envelopes. They have nine children and  were unable to send their elder children to school since they did not have enough resources at the time.  Today, their eldest son brings to the family an additional income of $50 per month working in a car workshop, which allows Parveen and her husband to send their two youngest sons to a neighborhood school. The eldest son has now attained a suitable level of expertise as a mechanic and now plans to rent a shop and open his own workshop. Parveen is requesting a loan of $325 to enable him to fund this plan and to improve the financial condition of the whole family.

loans.use: To enable her son to open his own car workshop

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
After all the hard labor invested in their rice field for which does not yield enough revenue, the family of Ms Nguyễn Thị Thành cannot escape poverty. So when "Quỹ TYM" fund program got implanted in Quảng Hùng, Ms Thành jumped at the chance and had applied for a loan to help her start a business in a small butcher shop. It wasn't easy at first but with determination, hard work and honesty, her shop had gained a lot of thrust from the customers. The quality of the meat, the cleanness of the shop keep the customers happy. Ms Thành's wish is to expand her butcher shop and to attract more customers. She is requesting a loan of 400 USD to buy more products and a few more pigs to raise in time for the new year sales

Translater from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Quanh năm với đồng ruộng, thu nhập chỉ trông vào cây lúa, gia đình chị Nguyễn Thị Thành không thoát khỏi cái nghèo túng. Từ khi Quỹ TYM về với xã Quảng Hùng, chị đã mạnh dạn vay vốn làm ăn chuyển sang kinh doanh buôn bán thịt chó, thịt lợn. Bước đầu gặp không ít khó khăn nhưng với sự chịu khó, đức tính thật thà, hàng của chị đã lấy được lòng người mua với chất lượng thịt bán ra đảm bảo, hợp vệ sinh. Mong muốn của chị là hàng thịt chó, thịt lợn của gia đình mình ngày càng được nhiều ngưòi biết đến. Vòng vốn này chị đăng ký vay 400 USD về để lấy thêm hàng đồng thời mua thêm vài con lợn dự trữ hàng cho dịp Tết.

loans.use: buy pigs and repair pigpen

loans.name: Fezahir

texts.en:
Fezahir is 49 years old and a resident of Aghsu region, located in the central part of Azerbaijan. He lives in Aghsu Town with his family and four childen. He works as a taxi driver using his own car in Aghsu Town.

Fazahir's car is an old model and breaks down when he goes longer distances. He wants to repair his car. As he has little money of his own for that purpose, he has applied to Normicro's Aghsu branch for a loan of US$ 800 to reassemble the engine of his car.

loans.use: To repair the private car he uses as a taxi

loans.name: Tran Thi

texts.vi:
Ms Trần Thị Thủy, 38 years old, lives in Quảng Đức with her husband. They have 2 children, 1 boy and 1 girl who are currently in school. Married sine 1996, their main occupation is rice wine brewing. Their rice wine is of high quality so it gets sold very quickly. Each week, they make 5 batches, each batch is made with 10 kg of rice. Their daily revenue is about 5 USD. Their family financial has been solidified ever since they joined the fund program. Apart from making rice wine, the couple also works for others in their free time to earn more money. Ms Thủy is requesting a loan of 450 USD to buy more rice to augment their rice wine production.

Translater from Vietnamese by Khang Ho-Si, Kiva volunteer

Chị Trần Thị Thủy, 38 tuổi, hiện đang sinh sống tại xã Quảng Đức, có hai người con 1 trai 1gái đang trong độ tuổi ăn học. Cưới nhau từ năm 1996, nghề nghiệp chính của hai vợ chồng chị Thủy là nấu rượu. Rượu của gia đình đảm bảo chất lượng nên nấu được bao nhiêu tiêu thụ hết bấy nhiêu. Mỗi tuần chị nấu 5 nồi rượu, mỗi nồi 10kg gạo. Thu nhập mỗi ngày của chị là 5 USD. Kinh tế gia đình được nâng lên đáng kể từ ngày chị tham gia Quỹ. Ngoài việc nấu rượu tranh thủ lúc nhàn rỗi anh Cấn chồng chị còn đi làm thuê để có thêm thu nhập. Vòng vốn này chị xin vay 450 USD để mua lúa nhằm tăng thêm lượng rượu nấu ra hàng ngày.

loans.use: buy rice to brew rice wine

loans.name: Fozia

texts.en: Fozia P. makes woolen caps and her husband works at a spectacles shop as a sales person. Together they make around $80 a month. Their  income is not enough to support themselves and their four children. Winter is right around the corner, and the demand in woolen caps is set to rise. She is requesting a loan of $425 to buy and stock a large quantity of wool as it is cheaper this season and will allow her to make good profits when winter comes.

loans.use: To purchase wool

loans.name: Yashar

texts.en:
Yashar is 40 years old and a resident of Aghsu region, located in the central part of Azerbaijan. He has a shop where he sells fabric, textiles, curtains, etc. He has been in this business since 1994.

Yashar's business is going well but he wants to increase the variety of goods he sells. He has already taken out and repaid two loans from Normicro's Aghsu branch for his business needs. Now he is applying for a third loan, this time in the amount of US$ 1000, to expand the variety of inventory for his shop.

loans.use: To diversify his inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Gunesh

texts.en:
Gunesh is 30 years old and a resident of Aghsu region, located in the central part of Azerbaijan. He is married and has two children; he and his family live in Aghsu town. He has a small shop where he has been selling groceries since 1993.

Gunesh wants to increase the volume of his business. He needs to buy more goods from wholesale shops with a wide variety to expand his inventory. Having little of his own capital to invest in his business, he has applied to Normicro's Aghsu branch for a loan in the amount of US$ 500.

loans.use: To diversify his inventory for his little grocery store

loans.name: Luísa Pedro

texts.pt:
Luísa Pedro S. is 39 years old and is the single mother of 3 children. She lives in the Khongolote district in Maputo. She started FDM's program in April 2007 and took a first loan of 6000 meticiais. She sells duvets and blankets, as well as clothes which she buys in South Africa. She has moved from her home to Xai-Xai and her 1st loan cycle went well. She will borrow 7000 meticais to pay back in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Luísa Pedro S. tem 39 anos de idade e é mãe solteira de 3 filhos. Vive no bairro Khongolote em Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Abril deste ano e tomu 6.000MT como primeiro empréstimo. Vende duvês e mantas, e ainda roupa que compra na Àfrica do Sul.Vem transferida de Xai- Xai uma vez que mudou de residência e comportou- se bem no 1º ciclo de empréstimo. Vai tomar 7.000MT para pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise

loans.name: Argentina Víctor

texts.pt:
Arrgentina Víctor Z. if 42 years old, and a single mother of two children. She lives in the Magoanine district in Maputo. She sells used clothes at her home. She started this businesses two hyears ago. She entered the program in March 2007 with a loan of 6000 meticais that was repaid punctually. She will start her 2nd loan cycle and will take out 8000 meticais to pay in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by a Kiva volunteer.

Arrgentina Víctor Z. tem 42 anos de idade, é mãe solteira de dois filhos. Vive no bairro Magoanine em Maputo. Vende roupa usada na sua residência, negócio que começou já a dois anos. Entrou para o programa em Março de 2007 com um empréstimo de 6.000MT que foi pontualmente reembolsado. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai tomar 8.000MT para pagar em 6 Meses.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali I. is 23 years old. He was born in Sumqayıt City in Azerbaijan. Sumqayıt is situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. Right now Ali is living in Sumgayit City, with his family. A dentist, Ali is the only breadwinner for his family. He began his profession 5 years ago.

Ali is a good dentist, but this job is very hard. He would like to purchase new equipment for his dental office. He had already managed to save some money but it is not enough. So, he needs to borrow money. He wants to improve his business by increasing the number of his clients so as to increase the income from his practice.

Now, Ali needs $500 to buy the necessary equipment. He thinks that this expansion of his dental clinic will improve living conditions for his family. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment for his dental practice

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.en:
Saturnina, 36, is married with three children. The boys, 14 and 12, are attending the public school in Santo Domingo, the capital. The girl, 6, is studying in the same township. Saturnina’s husband, a vehicle driver, is paid on an hourly basis when he gets the opportunity to be hired on occasion for a company. Thus far, he can’t afford a truck so that he can work full-time.

Saturnina applied to borrow US $375.00 in order to move forward her business, a little shop she started 5 years ago in her house. In fact, she sells a lot of things like toilet articles, shaving cream, antiperspirant, clothes for women and girls and so on. Now she wants to purchase more products and a showcase to put the new goods so that the customers can easily view and appreciate the products.

Saturnina thinks that’s a safe investment and is sure that her business will improve. This way, she’ll have sufficient money to help her husband cope with their family issues.

loans.use: To purchase more products and a showcase for the new goods acquired.  Extra money would help the entrepreneur assist her husband in facing their family needs.

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en:
Ramin F. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. He is 26 and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli in the south-central plains area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ramin has a small flock of sheep. He buys lambs and raises them, then in a half year, he sells the sheep in the local market, buys other lambs, and spends the rest of his profit to provide all the necessities of life for his family. The business is very interesting but sometimes demands more funding than he has. Timely investments are important for Ramin. This summer he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of US$ 400. He hopes eventually to be able to expand his business.

loans.use: To buy lambs to raise for sale

loans.name: Ilgar

texts.en:
Ilgar K. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. He is 38, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central plains area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ilgar is a farmer. He started his business in 1990, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The business is very interesting but from time to time requires money input. Ilgar needs capital to buy additional animals to develop his business, increase turnover and profit. For this purpose he has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a US$ 400 loan, which is enough to buy two calves. He hopes eventually to further expand his business.

loans.use: To buy calves to raise

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam A. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. He is 43, married with three children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Islam is a farmer. He started his business in 1989, when he purchased one cow with money he had saved up. The work is interesting, but it is time-consuming and it takes a lot of money and effort. Islam's family is big and his earnings are not enough to cover all of the family's expenses. He needs to invest some capital to increase the number of animals in his herd and improve his profits. This summer Islam has applied for a US$ 500 loan from Normicro's Saatli branch. With this input of capital, he hopes to make his profit sufficient to cover all his family's expenditures.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Dona Marcelina is mother to four children, but only her 13 year old daughter remains her dependent. Some time ago, when her children were still of school age, she opened her small store selling staples and sundries in her community. For a long time, her business was not very successful, but now, thanks to her young daughter's assistance, her business is one of the most frequented in the area. Her daughter's contribution has been efficient, sensible and right on target. Response from her clients has been so great that it has been hard to keep up with demand, requiring that they both work the store together at times in order to be able to serve all customers.

To take advantage of this phenomenal opportunity, Marcelina would like to expand her inventory so that each of her clients is able to find everything he needs in her store. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $325, to be repaid over 4 months. Let's help Marcelina make her dream a reality so that in turn, she can help her young daughter realize her own dream of studying fashion design and haute couture.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Marcelina es madre de 4 hijos y actualmente sólo está a cargo del cuidado de la más pequeña que tiene 13 años, hace tiempo cuando la mayoría de sus hijos se encontraban en etapa escolar, decidió aperturar una tienda para ofrecer artículos de primera necesidad a su comunidad. Durante mucho tiempo este negocio no fue uno de los más satisfactorios pero ahora gracias a la contribución de su hija menor este pequeño espacio de servicios se ha convertido en una de las tiendas más visitadas de la zona.La contribución de su hija a sido muy eficiente y atinada y aún más la percepción de sus clientes; ahora casi es imposible darse abasto y hasta necesitan en determinado horario estar juntas para satisfacer todos los pedidos.A consecuencia de este fenómeno es que Marcelina desea ampliar su stock de productos a fin de que cada uno de sus clientes pueda encontrar en este lugar todas las cosas que requieran y para cumplir este objetivo ella solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 4 meses. Hagamos que el sueño de Marcelina se convierta en realidad en poco tiempo para que a su vez ella pueda cumplirle el sueño de estudiar alta costura a su pequeña hija.

loans.use: To purchase more and better quality products to meet high demand

loans.name: Jose Jorge

texts.es:
Hello, my name is Jose and I sell ice cream for a living. This product is in high demand due to the hot climate in Honduras. My business is mobile; I visit various suburbs of Tegucigalpa to maximize my sales. My wife and children help out by selling ice cream from our home, as there is a school nearby and students buy our ice cream after class.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Hola me llamo Jose y me dedico a la venta de helados, este productos es comprado en grandes cantidades ya que el clima en Honduras es caliente. Mi negocio es ambulante, visito varias colonias de Tegucigalpa para poder obtener mejores ventas. Mis hijos y esposa ayudan a vender en mi casa, ya que cerca hay una escuela y los niños compran despues de salir de sus clases.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of ice cream products

loans.name: Maria De Los Santos

texts.en:
My name is Maria and I make my living by making and selling minutas, a type of iced beverage made of shaved ice, fruits and artificial flavors. My business is located on a main street in my suburb, right across the street from a school. I also do washing and ironing for neighbors; this generates additional income that allows me to help my children stay in school. My intention is to buy sweets and other products that I can sell at the school. This loan will be used as working capital to help me stock my business and increase my income.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Me llamo Maria y me dedico a vender minutas, es un helado a base de hielo raspado y se decora con frutas y sabores artificiales, mi negocio lo tengo ubicado en la calle principal de mi colonia, ya que en esta se encuentra una escuela y vendo frente a ella. Mis ingresos tambien los obtengo de lavar y aplanchar ropa de vecinos, de esta manera ayudo a mis hijos con sus estudios. Pienso comprar dulces y otros productos para vender en la escuela, es por eso que necesito capital de trabajo para surtir y acrecentar mis ingresos.

loans.use: To purchase ice, flavored syrups, fruits, honey and condensed milk

loans.name: Imila Mamerta

texts.en:
Dona Imila always had an innate talent for sewing and making clothes. This ability resulted in her opening her small artisanal workshop, which initially served only a small circle of friends. However, her unique designs and excellent finishing touches have caused her work to be in the highest demand. She has two children; the oldest girl attends elementary school and, as a good mother and excellent seamstress, Imila has taught her to love her mother's line of work. This has resulted in her girl becoming her best assistant.

Imila's small shop and services are more sought after each day, in large measure because of her philosophy of continuous self improvement. Now, thanks to numerous recommendations, she has been asked to design and manufacture a line of uniforms for a local school. She is requesting a loan of $175 to buy raw materials and tools. Together we can make Imila's talent and initiative result in a better life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Imila siempre tuvo un talento innato para la confección de prendas de vestir y a consecuencia de este don ella tomó la decisión de abrir su pequeño taller de confección artesanal y sólo para un grupo de amigos; sus diseños únicos y sus excelentes acabados han hecho de sus confecciones las más requeridas ella tiene dos hijos, la mayor estudia en la escuela primaria, y como buena madre y excelente costurera cada día le inculca el amor por este digno oficio y en poco tiempo se ha convertido en su mejor ayudante;su pequeño taller y sus servicios son cada día más cotizados y esto se debe a su mentalidad de mejoramiento continuo. Ahora y gracias al sin número de recomendaciones le han encomendado la fabricación y deseño de uniformes de una escuela primaria de su localidad y para implementar su taller ella solicita un préstamo de 175 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 4 meses para poder adquirir más insumos y herramientas. Juntos podremos hacer que esta iniciativa y talento puedan contribuir a incrementar la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: Imila will use this loan to equip her workshop with the necessary raw materials and tools to provide her clients with better service.

loans.name: Natividad Dominga

texts.en:
Natividad is a single mother who, since she took sole responsibility for raising her young son, has labored tirelessly to provide for all his needs. It was because of her strong work ethic that she found stable employment for 24 long years in a cattle ranch. During this time things at home went very well, but then she suffered a serious accident and had to leave her job. She never anticipated being literally left in the streets with her young child when her years of dedication went unrecognized.

Being faced with such dire circumstances and having to care for her elderly mother and uncle, she made the decision to utilize her work experience to start a home-based business raising and selling guinea pigs. Things have slowly improved, but she would like to make further progress. She is requesting a loan of $150, to be repaid over 6 months, to improve the installations used to raise her guinea pigs and provide an environment where she can increase their numbers and improve their living conditions. Let's help make Natividad's hard work pay off so that her family can enjoy a better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Natividad es una madre que desde que decidió hacerse cargo sola de la crianza de su pequeño hijo ha trabajado incansablemente con el deseo de satisfacer todas y cada una de las necesidades que le acarreaba esta responsabilidad. Fue gracias a su laboriosidad que encontró un trabajo estable por 24 largos años en una hacienda ganadera durante este tiempo las cosas en casa iban muy bien sin embargo al sufrir un penoso accidente se vió en la necesidad de abandonar este duro trabajo porque se encontraba muy mal y jamás pensó quedarse literalmente en la calle y con un pequeño niño a cuestas cuando su abnegada labor no fue reconocida.Ante situación y con una madre y un tío ancianos, por los cuales tenía que velar, decidió poner en práctica todo lo aprendido en aquel trabajo y poner en marcha su pequeño negocio de crianza y venta de cuyes en un pequeño espacio que acondicionó en su humilde vivienda. Las cosas poco a poco han ido mejorando pero aún no están del todo bien por esta razón ella hace una solicitud de 150 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses con el propósito de mejorar las instalaciones de crianza para acogerlos en mayor cantidad y mejores condiciones.Hagamos que el trabajo de Natividad genere frutos para ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

loans.use: To improve the installations used for raising guinea pigs so that she can offer them year round.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Djamila B. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. She is 29, married with two children, and lives in the village of Saatli in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Djamila owns and operates a small beauty salon. She has in her employ one woman (pictured here), who is the only breadwinner for her family.

There are quite a lot of beauty salons around and competition is fierce. Most importantly, Djamila tries not to lose her customers, who, she fears, might leave her to look for more attractive shops. To cope with this, Djamila needs to renovate her salon and to make it more attractive. For this purpose, she has applied to Normicro's Saatli branch for a loan of US$ 500. She hopes eventually to develop her business further.

loans.use: To renovate her beauty shop

loans.name: Seymur

texts.en:
Seymur I. is a low-income person who is very vulnerable to shifts in the local economy. He is 25 and lives with his parents in Saatli town located in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Seymur rents a barber shop and has one employee. They serve clients and at the end of each month they have to pay the rent to the shop owner. The school term is beginning and as a rule all school children get their hair cut before going to school. Seymur's barber shop isn't in good condition and needs to be renovated immediately. Seymur applied for a $500 loan from Normicro's Saatli branch. After getting the loan and renovating the shop, he hopes to attract more customers and increase his daily income.

loans.use: To renovate his barber shop

loans.name: Maria Gloria

texts.en:
Dona Maria works hard next to her husband to improve their family's life and secure a brighter future. She is the mother of 3 children raised with discipline and taught to love hard work. it's been 20 years since she and her husband started their small furniture workshop, where they sell handmade chairs and sofas. Their team approach, which incorporates their children's help, has resulted in their business flourishing in the local market. This in turn has allowed their children to attend school so that they have become independent. Today, only the youngest daughter remains at home.

Lately, demand for their goods has decreased, which precipitated an economic crisis and forced Dona Maria and her family to become more innovative in their approach. To offer more creative, quality chair designs, the family has made the commitment to invest in additional raw materials, which is the reason they are requesting this loan of $525, to be repaid over 6 months. Let's support Dona Maria's family business as they strive to move forward.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Maria, se esfuerza al lado de su esposo por mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y lograr un futuro mejor, es madre de tres hijos que formó con disciplina y amor al trabajo.Ella y su esposo hace más de 20 años que formaron este pequeño taller de confección de muebles en los que ofrecen sillas y sillones confeccionados a mano e hicieron juntos y con la ayuda de sus hijos un trabajo en equipo que permitió que este pequeño taller salga a flote y destaque en las inmediaciones del mercado local, además ha permitido durante mucho tiempo que sus hijos estudien cómodamente para que cada uno de ellos independientemente pueda forjar su futuro; ahora sólo la menor sigue a cargo de ellos. Actualmente la demanda ha ido decayendo por lo que Doña Maria y su familia pasaron por una crisis económica que los obligó a ser aún más creativos para ofrecer a todos los visitantes del mercado sillas más vistosas y de calidad, ahora, como parte de este proyecto familiar, Doña Maria y su familia han decidido invertir en insumos de trabajo para producir más con el deseo de conseguir satisfactoriamente el sustento diario para su familia.Por ello su solicitud haciende a 525 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses.No permitamos que Doña Maria y su familia estanquen su desarrollo apoyemos su esfuerzo.

loans.use: The Canchari family wishes to purchase raw materials for their furniture-making business

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.en:
Maria is 37 years old, married and has 5 children. Her husband was forced to seek employment out of the country and sends money every month to help with the family's most urgent needs. Maria was always involved in agriculture and is now working to prepare her land to plant citrus trees. She works from early in the morning with her children, and her main concern is the transport of water for irrigation purposes.

Maria's most urgent need is to have an irrigation well to water her crops and for this purpose she's requesting a loan in the amount of $875, to be repaid over a 6-month period. Her hopes are pinned on our help to secure this most vital element of this year's crops.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una señora de 37 años, está casada y tiene 5 hijos; por motivos de trabajo su esposo tuvo que viajar y establecerse fuera de su país y desde su lugar de residencia envía dinero para los gastos más urgentes de su familia mes a mes, María siempre estuvo ligado a la actividad agrícola, es por eso que ahora está llevando a cabo la preparación del terreno que utilizará para la siembra de diversos productos cítricos, ella trabaja desde muy temprano con sus hijos y su preocupación latente es por el traslado de agua para el riego de los cultivos; por ello su necesidad más urgente es contar con un pozo tubular que instalará bajo tierra a fin de otorgarle a su siembra el agua necesaria y para llevar a cabo este proyecto María solicita 875 dólares que devolverá en un lapso de 6 meses.Tiene depositada sus esperanzas en nosotros para poder contar con el vital elemento para la siembra de este año.

loans.use: To build a well for irrigation of her crops

loans.name: Anwari

texts.en:
I have lived in Vehari all my life, a small town about three hours away from Lahore, the second largest city of Pakistan. I am married with seven children. My husband suffers from paralysis so I am the breadwinner of the family. Since I know how to sew, I took a loan last year and bought myself a sewing machine, but made little money from that venture as people were only willing to pay very little for my work. However, I still managed to repay my old loan.

Now, I am planning to purchase cloth from Vehari’s city market to sell at a higher price in nearby villages. A loan of $100 will help me start my new business. This might help us to cope with our daily expenses and help me put food on the table.

loans.use: Purchase cloth from the city to sell in villages at a profit

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
My name is Naib Sayid and I was born in Vehari, a small town in Pakistan. I am married and have one son who is too young to go to school but I want to ensure that he has access to an education when he is older. My husband sells women’s clothes but the income from his business is not enough to meet our family's living expenses.

Before getting married, I worked as a beautician for seven years. First, I obtained professional saloon skills from working in several saloons and then opened my own saloon in my house in Lahore, a large city. However, after I got married I stopped working for a while and my husband and I moved to Vehari.

Now I want to re-start my business for which I need a loan to buy cosmetics and other accessories for the parlor. I am hopeful that my prior experience will enable my business to be successful.

loans.use: Buy equipment to start a  beauty saloon

loans.name: Naima

texts.en:
I am a mother of five and I have been living in Vehari for the last four years, in the heart of Punjab, Pakistan's most populated province. My eldest daughter is a teacher and one of my sons works in the local market --- the others are in school. I would like them to complete their education and have promising careers.

My husband runs a canteen in a local hospital in Vehari. He has been in this business for the past four years. He pays a lot of money to rent the canteen and purchase the stock on credit. Both expenses have reduced our profits. My husband wants to expand his business and requires cash to purchase more stock for his canteen store. For this purpose, we need a loan. I would be extremely grateful if you could help us out.

loans.use: To purchase stock for a school canteen

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
I am a housewife and have lived in Vehari, a small town in Pakistan my whole life. I have one son and one daughter. They do not go to school yet but I would like them to eventually receive an education and help support us in our future. My husband owns a bicycle spare parts shop in Vehari and earns almost $4 a day. However, this income is not sufficient to fulfill our needs.

Hence, he plans to expand his existing business and wants to buy more stock for his shop. My husband has three years of experience in this business and he thinks that with the loan of $328, he can do quite well. This loan would help my husband’s enterprise to grow and will enable my children to obtain an education in the coming years.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for a bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Rehanna

texts.en:
I am Rehanna K. and I have been married for the past seventeen years. I have three boys and four girls. Four of my children attend school while the others are too young to attend yet. I am a housewife and I can’t go out for work as I have to take care of the children at home.

Therefore, in order to help add to the household income, I raise livestock such as such as cows, buffaloes or sheep and sell them at a profit. I have been doing this for the last fifteen years.

Now, I also want to buy an additional animal, for which I require a loan. I think I have sufficient experience in this business and I can do quite well. This way I can share some of the burden of supporting our family with of my husband.

loans.use: To purchase livestock

loans.name: Eudelio

texts.en:
Eudelio is synonymous with young, successful entrepreneur, because at age 27, he has been able to establish himself financially. He's married to 23 year old Alba Mabel Estigarribia and they have a 2 year old son.

Before getting married, he worked for five years at a shop in Asuncion that was run by Korean immigrants. Later he decided to set off on his own, selling pants and other clothing items on credit in the Carapegua area.

Four years ago, a relative invited him to travel to the city of Posadas, on the border with Argentina, to sell the artisanal products of Carapegua, blankets and hammocks, as well as other products like shoes and embroidered Ao Poi shirts (Ao Poi is a traditional textile that can be attached to other products and simulates a spider web). He currently has an established clientele.

Because of his hard work, he now owns a lovely house and is able to give his wife and son a more dignified life. He is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise such as shoes, shirts, pants hammocks, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Eudelio un sinónimo de joven emprendedor y triunfador ya que con su 27 años ha logrado formarse económicamente, está casado con la señora Alba Mabel Estigarribia, de 23 años, tienen un hijo de 2 años. Antes de casarse estuvo trabajando en una casa comercial en Asunción con unos inmigrantes coreanos por más de cinco años, luego se decidió a trabajar por cuenta propia, empezando a vender pantalones y otros productos a cuota por la zona de Carapeguá. Hace 4 años, un familiar le invitó a ir a la ciudad de Posadas de Argentina (país que limita con Paraguay) para la venta ambulante de los productos artesanales de Carapeguá que son las frazadas y hamacas, así como otros productos como ser zapatos, camisas bordadas de Aó Poí (tejido típico del país que sirve como aplique para diferentes tipos de prendas, es una imitación de la telaraña). Actualmente ya tiene clientela formada, gracias a ese duro trabajo hoy está terminada una linda vivienda propia y así puede brindar a su esposa y a su hijo una vida más digna. El crédito ha solicitado para la compra de mercaderías como zapatos, camisas, pantalones, hamacas, etc.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as shoes, pants, shirts, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Sarwari

texts.en: I am from a small town in Pakistan and have been living here for many years. I am a housewife and have eight children, three girls and five boys. Three of my children have completed their education and are currently working, but the other five are still in school. Three years back, my eldest sons started his own book binding business with another partner and he is doing quite well. Now, my son is planning to diversify his business and wants to include copies and pencils in his small store. Therefore, he needs a loan to purchase stock of copies and pencils.

loans.use: diversify the book binding business to include stationary

loans.name: Amado

texts.en:
Amado is 54 years old, is married and has 5 children, 3 of whom live with him. All of his children are either studying or working in various jobs. The youngest is still in high school, another studying accounting in university, and the other three work as an accountant, a dressmaker, and in sales. 
He owns his own contracting business and has been working in construction his whole life, learning everything he knows from working with his father. He has been working hard his whole life to make sure that all of his children would have the opportunity to get an education and become professionals.
He is a very active member of the community as well, acting as the president of a cooperative, and a secretary on two parents school boards. He is very happy that through his business, and through the loans that he receives, he is able to employ people in the community who might not otherwise have work. He realizes that opportunities in his country is limited and is thankful that this foundation has helped give opportunities to many people in his community. He will use this loan as operative capital and purchase of cement, sand and bricks. 
His dream for the future is to leave his contracting business and open a dressmaking business with his daughter as it is currently a very lucrative industry in Paraguay.
