loans.use: Purchase of cement, sand and bricks

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 27 and is married with 2 children who are 9 and 4 years old and both studying in elementary school. 
She and her husband own 2 stands from which they sell various items such as DVDs, sunglasses, jewerry, etc.  While she manages their stand in their hometown of Luque, her husband runs another stand in the main market of the capital city of Asunción. 
Her business goals for the future are to expand her business and begin selling electronics, it is for this reason that she is requesting a loan. For her family, her hope is that her children will be able to study in university and one day open their own business.

loans.use: Purchase electronics.

loans.name: Nilza

texts.en:
Nilza, 30, and her husband Geronimo, 35, have a business together making and selling wooden furniture. He makes the furniture in a shop out of their home, and she sells it from their store which they opened 4 years ago. 
They have 2 children who are 3 and 12 years old and the eldest is studying in the 6th grade of elementary school. Her dream for the future is that they go to university and become professionals. She says that this is why she and her husband struggle to make a good living. 
Nilza and her husband are requesting this loan to purchase a truck so that they are able to expand their business and begin delivering their furniture to be sold at additional locations.

loans.use: To purchase a delivery truck

loans.name: María Margarita

texts.en:
Maria is a 57 year old single mother. She supports her son with her small restaurant while he attends university studying engineering. 
She started her business 8 years ago, but hasn´t always worked in food industry. She used to work in high fashion as a seamstress for 30 years. However, the long history of wars, dictators (particularly that of Alfredo Stroessner which lasted 30 years), and corruption left the Paraguayan economy in shambles, and for lack of work Maria was forced to give up her passion to support her family. 
	Maria dreams of one day returning to the fashion industry. For now she is trying to be as successful as possible with her restaurant so that she can save to buy sewing machines to begin working in her field once again. She is requesting this loan to purchase more food for the restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more food

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has a successful business selling personal care products at the busy central market in Kharkiv, Ukraine. She has been self-employed for over 14 years. Anna decided to concentrate on higher-end products which has been a good strategy for her. Her sales kiosk is in an excellent location at the market with great exposure to passing customers. She is a very sharp business woman who loves what she does and wants to see her venture be as successful possible.

Anna has requested a loan to purchase some additional inventory. Previous loans received from Nadiya Ukraine have helped her business grow. We are happy for another opportunity to assist Anna as she continues to develop her enterprise.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.en:
Svetlana started her business selling bedding supplies after a relative shared an opportunity with her. She is able to buy inventory directly from a manufacturer and resell it in her store which is located in a mall facility. Svetlana has a reputation as a hard-working, honest entrepreneur. Her business helps support her family of four. She and her husband, Sergei, have two children who are in their 20’s.

Svetlana’s goal is to continue developing her business and increase her sales. She has requested a loan of $1000 to expand significantly by opening a new sales location. This is Svetlana’s fourth loan from Nadiya Ukraine. It will be exciting to see where Svetlana’s business will go in the future.

loans.use: Open new sales facility

loans.name: Diego

texts.es:
Diego is 51 years old and is married to Leandra, who emigrated to Spain a few months ago in search of better employment opportunities. She is now working as a domestic maid and is sending money to her husband to help him financially. They have no children.

Diego opened his shop seventeen years ago. He himself works from his home in a well-known company in the town of Luque. From here he provides his neighbours and occasional clients with products like rice, noodles, sugar, bread, meat, milk and other staples.

He tell us that thanks to his shop’s early opening hours and the good service he offers his customers, he has been able to move forward with the business. He wants the loan to invest in the purchase of more merchandise, such as tinned products, noodles, snacks, sweets, drinks etc.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

Diego tiene 51 años está casado con Leandra, quien emigró hace unos meses a España en busca de mejores oportunidades laborales, ella está trabajando actualmente como empleada doméstica y envía dinero a su marido para ayudarlo económicamente. No tienen hijos.

Diego abrió su despensa hace 17 años. El mismo funciona en su domicilio en una compañía muy conocida de la ciudad de Luque. De él se surten sus vecinos y ocasionales clientes de productos como arroz, fideo, azúcar, panificados, carne, leche y otros víveres.

Nos cuenta que gracias a que abre su negocio desde tempranas horas, la buena atención que el brinda a sus clientes, ha podido salir adelante. Desea el crédito para invertirlos en la compra de más mercaderías como productos enlatados, fideos, golosinas, gaseosas, etc.

loans.use: to purchase more merchandise like tinned products, noodles, snacks, soft drinks etc.

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena has a little business selling a variety of items. She sells beautiful pictures, clocks, batteries and small gadgets. She is an experienced entrepreneur, having been in business for ten years. Elena originally started her business at a market right by the apartment where she lived. She now has a sales location at the large central market in Melitopol. Elena is married with two daughters and is a dedicated mother. One of the goals she has for her business is to make enough so that she can help her children.

Elena has requested a loan of $800 so that she can purchase new inventory to sell. She has been a great client with Nadiya Ukraine in the past. All of her loans have been repaid with no delays. We are happy for this new opportunity to assist Elena as she continues to develop her business.

loans.use: Purchase inventory

loans.name: Peregrina

texts.es:
Peregrina is a hard-working and affectionate mother who with help of her husband does different activities at home to be able to support her family. She has 4 children and two of them are still in school. Every day they take the sheep to pasture in her grounds so they can have their daily sustenance that nature offers them; in addition to this activity they grow some vegetables for her family consumption. They start these activities quite early; meanwhile her husband is getting the sheep ready, Peregrina prepares the meal for her dear children so each one can do their assign task. The cattle profits for many families have diminished due the climate because the temperature in the Peruvian valleys has descended in an alarming way and has affected directly the cattle activity generating millionaire losses. Peregrina’s family also suffered the loss of a considerable number of sheep that they had so their family revenue diminished. For this reason Peregrina is requesting for a loan of 425 dollars in order to increase and improve the area where the sheep pasture and the sheep’s food. She promises to repay over a period of 6 months. Let's help Peregrina and her family!.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Peregrina es una trabajadora y amorosa madre que con ayuda de su esposo realiza distintas actividades en el seno de su hogar para otorgarle bienestar a su familia, tiene 4 hijos y dos de ellos aún en etapa escolar. A diario recorren sus tierras para que las ovejitas que crían puedan tener el sustento diario que la naturaleza les ofrece; además de dedicarse a esta actividad siembran algunos vegetales para su consumo familiar. Las actividades las inician muy temprano y mientras su esposo va alistando a sus ovejitas Peregrina elabora la comida para sus queridos hijos a fin de que cada uno desarrolle la tarea acostumbrada, el clima ha sido un factor que ha hecho que las ganancias ganaderas en muchas familias disminuyan porque la temperatura en los valles peruanos ha descendido de manera alarmante y ha afectado directamente la actividad ganadera generando pérdidas millonarias y la familia de Peregrina también sufrió la muerte de un considerable número de ovejitas que tenía en casa y por ende también el ingreso familiar debido a que el único sustento con el que cuentan se los otorga la venta de estos animalitos. Por esta razón y con el deseo de incrementar y mejorar el espacio y la comida que ingieren las ovejas hace ella hace una petición de 425 dólares con el propósito de llevar a cabo este proyecto y se compromete a retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses. Hagamos que Peregrina y su familia puedan hacer realidad este anhelo.

loans.use: Buy more sheep, improve the sheep's food and their barn.

loans.name: Irina

texts.en: Irina has requested a loan to help purchase new inventory and increase the variety of items she has available for her little candy sales business. Irina’s business is in a great location at a market store near the bus station in Melitopol. It is convenient for customers and receives a good amount passing traffic. Irina started her business twelve years ago. She currently has about $5000 worth of inventory on hand and makes around $1400 per month in sales. This short term loan of $500 will give her extra working capital so that she can continue to develop her business and earn a good income.

loans.use: Purchase new inventory

loans.name: Luis

texts.es:
Luis has been married to Lina for ten years: they have two children who are still in Primary school. He devotes his time to making and selling various sorts of shoes such as sandals, sports shoes, ballerina-pump shoes, dress shoes for women and men etc.

Luis sells his shoes from home, and also as a walking salesman, covering all of the town of Luque and nearby towns. His sales are cash, but also some are on credit. Thanks to the good quality of his shoes, his sales are very good. Luis would like a loan to invest in the purchase of leather, soles and other materials to use in making his products.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El señor Luis está casado con la señora Lina hace 10 años, tienen 2 hijos que cursan aún la primaria. El mismo se dedica a la fabricación y venta de varios tipos de calzados tales como sandalias, zapatillas deportivas, chatitas, zapatos de vestir para damas y caballeros, etc.

Vende sus zapatos en su casa, y también de forma ambulante, recorriendo toda la ciudad de Luque y las ciudades aledañas. Sus ventas las realiza al contado y así como también a crédito. Gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos, sus ventas son muy buenas. Luis desea un crédito para invertirlo en la compra de cueros, suelas y otros materiales para la fabricación de sus mercaderías.

loans.use: Purcahse of leather, soles glue and other materials for shoe manufacture.

loans.name: Ruth Esther

texts.es:
Ruth is a young woman who got married recently and dreams along with her husband to have a solid marriage and be able to support the children that they are planning to have. She is a native of Huayucachi and she has decided to remain and grow professionally there, for this reason she decided to open this small grocery store a few months ago. Thanks to her perseverance and although she still is not earning a big revenue, she keeps on working with the hope to see soon the fruits of her work. In addition to this job, she supports her parents with the breeding of animals. She is getting an income from this work to support her home as well, but since the money is not completely sufficient she has decided to improve the small grocery store with more services and have a larger variety of products, for this reason is requesting for a loan of for 225 dollars. Let's help Ruth make her dreams come true.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Ruth es una joven que hace poco tiempo ha contraído matrimonio y sueña junto a su esposo formar un hogar sólido que pueda sostener a los hijos que han proyectado traer al mundo, ella es natural de Huayucachi y ha decidido quedarse en su propia tierra y desarrollarse en ella es por ello que decide abrir hace pocos meses esta pequeña bodega.Gracias a su constancia y a pesar de que todavía no percibe ganancias significativas sigue perseverando con la esperanza de ver pronto los frutos de su trabajo. Además de esta labor apoya a sus padres con la crianza de animales y también de este trabajo percibe algunas ganancias para el sustento de su hogar debido a que el dinero no es del todo suficiente ha decidido acondicionar la pequeña bodega con más servicios y variedad de productos y para este propósito solicita un préstamo de 225 dólares.Hagamos que Ruth lleve a cabo sus sueños.

loans.use: Buy more merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
Vicente is 34 years old: he has a partner and a 5 year-old son. Vicente began as an employee of a bodywork and paint-shop workshop where he learnt the techniques necessary for vehicle repair. Following years of apprenticeship and saving, Vicente managed to get together enough money to establish his own workshop. Now it is one of the best-reputed workshops in the area.

He would like in the future to be able to have his own business site, as at the moment his business operates from a rented site. His son is his main inspiration, as he wants his son to succeed in his studies, and Vicente wasn’t able to finish school.

Vicente wants the loan in order to be able to buy car-paint at wholesale prices, as the place where he buys his raw materials has put all its products on offer and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Vicente posee 34años, está en pareja y tiene un hijo pequeño de 5 años. El Sr. Vicente empezó como empleado de un taller de chapería y pintura donde fue aprendiendo las técnicas necesarias para la reparación de vehículos. Luego de años de aprendizaje y ahorro, Vicente logro juntar lo suficiente para montar su propio taller. Actualmente es uno de los talleres con mayor prestigio de la zona.

Desea más adelante poder tener su local propio, ya que por el momento está en un lugar alquilado. Su hijo es su mayor motivo, cuenta que desea que su niño pueda acceder a los estudios, ya que Vicente no pudo culminar el colegio.

Vicente desea el crédito para comprar pinturas para vehículos al por mayor, ya que el lugar de donde se provee de estos insumos ha puesto en oferta todos sus productos y el desea aprovechar la ocasión.

loans.use: to buy paints wholesale

loans.name: Noemi Teodosia

texts.es:
Noemí is a 19-year-old young woman, and she has a big wish of facing the life with optimism. People say that experience is necessary to start a new business but with her effort and dedication she has been able to achieve more than she ever thought and planned. Because the openings on the labor market for young people are scarce , she decided to open a small grocery store at home. Since she lives in a rural zone, she has had good results and also it has given her the possibility of paying her studies in Pharmacy. She is the youngest of three daughters and that's why she still lives with her parents and since they are seniors she is in charge of their care. Noemí is requesting for loan of 100 dollars to buy more and better merchandise for her small grocery store and obtain a bigger profit that will allow her to carry on with her studies. She promises to repay over a period of 6 months. Let's help to this young and enterprising woman to prosper!

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Noemí es una jovencita de 19 años y tiene muchos anhelos de enfrentar la vida con optimismo, se dice que la experiencia es necesaria para iniciar algún negocio pero en su esfuerzo y dedicación han hecho que logre aún más de lo pensado y proyectado, a pesar de que las vacantes en el mercado laboral son escasas y con menos oportunidad para los jóvenes. Ella avizoró más allá de las posibilidades y es así que decidió abrir una pequeña bodega en su hogar de origen y como es una zona rural la que habita ha tenido buenos resultados y además le ha otorgado la posibilidad de solventar económicamente sus estudios superiores de Farmacia. Es la menor de tres hijas y es por eso que aún vive con sus padres y por ser ellos de edad muy avanzada están a su cargo y cuidado. Para abastecer de más y mejores productos su pequeña bodega y obtener mayores ganancias que posibilitarán el sustento de su carrera hace una solicitud de 100 dólares con el compromiso de retornarlos en un lapso de 6 meses.Ayudemos a este joven y emprendedor talento a seguir adelante.

loans.use: Buy more and better merchandise for her small grocery store

loans.name: María

texts.es:
Maria V. is 22 years old: she has a partner and one two-year old son. She owns a hairdresser’s shop that has a well-established clientele, as it’s located in a very commercial zone which a lot of people pass through. Maria also sells clothes that she buys abroad, travelling to Argentina to purchase them. Her boyfriend is 24 years old and helps with the clothes sales as a travelling salesperson. They live in a rented house, and are a hard-working and respectable family. The loan will be used to buy merchandise in order to increase the clothes-shop’s stock: blouses, jeans, t-shirts, belts and other accessories. They hope that in the future they will be able to own their own house, and for this they are saving the profits that both businesses are generating.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

La Sra. María V. tiene 22 años, esta concubinada, tiene 1 hijo de dos años de edad. Posee una peluquería en la cual cuenta con una clientela bien formada, pues se encuentra en una zona muy comercial donde transita mucha gente. María también se dedica a la venta de ropas que compra del exteriror, viajando a la Argentina para adquirirlos. Su pareja tiene 24 años y le ayuda con las ventas de las ropas en forma ambulante. Viven en una casa alquilada. Es una familia muy trabajadora y honrada. El Crédito destinará para la compra de mercaderías para así poder ampliar el stock de su ropería; tales como blusas, jeans, remeras, cintos y otros artículos de bijouterie. Desean en el futuro poder adquirir una casa propia, para ello ya están ahorrando de las ganancias que genera ambos negocios.

loans.use: Buying spring-summer season garments

loans.name: Martín

texts.es:
Martin is 45 years old, and married to Bernarda Roja. The couple have three children: the oldest is 20 years old and is a university student, their other son is 16 and is studying at middle-school. Their youngest daughter is 11 and is still in primary school.

In his youth he worked in the Yacyreta hydro-electric plant, where he was able to accumulate capital through saving his money through much personal sacrifice and then establish his own workshop for car electrics. Now he has 20 years experience in the business. His wife cares for a store that operates from their own home which also generates extra income for the family.

One part of the loan will be used to buy spare parts related to his business, which can be obtained for a better price if bought in bulk, and the other part of the loan will be used to purchase merchandise for the grocery-store. In this way, they will increase the family’s income and consequently its members quality of life.

Translated from the Spanish by Katy Long, Kiva Volunteer

El Sr. Martín de 46 años de edad, esta casado con la Sra. Bernarda Rojas. La pareja tiene 3 hijos, el mayor tiene 20 años y es estudiante universitario, otro varón de 16 años que esta cursando la etapa media y una menor de 11 años que sigue en la escuela primaria.

En su juventud trabajo en la hidroeléctrica de Yacyreta, donde se hizo de capital ahorrando su dinero con mucho sacrificio y luego monto su propio taller de electricidad de automóvil. Acutalmente ya cuenta con 20 años de antigüedad en la actividad. Su cónyuge atiende una despensa que funciona en su mismo domicilio que también genera ingresos para la familia.

Una parte del préstamo destinara para comprar repuestos relacionados a su actividad, que comprando en cantidad consigue a mejor precio y otra parte utilizara para adquirir mercaderías de despensa, de esta manera mejorara el ingreso de la unidad familiar y por consiguiente el nivel de vida de sus miembros.

.

loans.use: Purchasing electrical spare parts for cars

loans.name: Lis Estefani

texts.es:
In spite of her young age, Lis is already working in the public sector as secretary for the local government. Since she is working part-time she can study “Computer Science” in an local institute in order to improve her competitiveness. Lis lives with her parents and brothers; she is the second of 4 children and they all are in school, for this reason, it’s difficult for her parents to cover the family’s expenses quite often. Before this situation, Lis decided to work and she obtained this work in a government office a month ago. Her monthly salary allows her to cover her personal and school expenses. Lis’ goal is to open an Internet café at home and generate a bigger income to be able to support her family and find the economic stability that they all long. In order to start this project, Lis is requesting for a loan of 160 dollars in order to start conditioning the designated area for this business. She promises to repay over a period of 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Lis a pesar de su corta edad ya está incursionando en el trabajo del sector público como secretaria de la gobernación, debido a que su desempeño lo realiza a medio tiempo puede estudiar a la par la carrera de computación en un instituto de su ciudad con el fin de mejorar su competitividad..Lis vive con sus padres y hermanos; es la segunda de 4 hermanos y todos estudian por lo que muchas veces se torna tarea dificultosa para sus padres afrontar los gastos económicos familiares. Ante ello Lis decide trabajar y es así que hace un mes consigue este trabajo en la jefatura de gobernación el ingreso que percibe mensualmente le permite solventar sus gastos personales y los de su estudio. Lis se ha trazado metas y entre ellas está el deseo de implementar una cabina de internet en las instalaciones de su hogar para generar ingresos más amplios a fin de que su familia pueda encontrar la estabilidad económica que tanto anhela y para emprender este proyecto solicita un préstamo de 160 dólares con el propósito de iniciar el acondicionamiento del espacio que ya tiene designado y se compromete a retornar tu noble apoyo en un período de 6 meses.

loans.use: Start a Internet cafe at home.

loans.name: Julia Domenica

texts.es:
Doña Julia is originally from Huaycachi. She has been doing embroidery for the past 20 years. Her specialty is making big and elaborate skirts for parties/religious events. She is well-known in her town for her great craftmanship. She has been able to support her family by doing embroidery. She has 3 children whom she loves dearly and she is teaching them this art that she loves so much. The great quality and great style of all her embroideries have won her many clients. She loves what she does and she is very passionate about her work. She takes her time to make sure each work is a piece of art. She is very patient and detail-oriented.

Due to the celebrations and religous events coming up in the Mantaro Valley, her orders have increased tremendously. She is very worry that she might not fulfill her oders due to the lack of thread and/or fabric. This is why she is requesting a loan in the amount of $175 USD to purchase all the material she is going to need. She commits to repay this loan within 6 months. Let's help Julia make her dream come true!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Julia es natural de Huayucachi y hace 20 años se dedica al bordado de fustanes de manera artesanal, ese talento que la caracteriza ha hecho que cada una de sus obras sean de excelente calidad y muy bien cotizadas, esta actividad le ha permitido junto a su esposo sostener su hogar por años, ella es madre de 3 hijos a los que se ha dedicado diligentemente y en la actualidad esta a cargo sólo de 2 a los que con amor y sumo profesionalismo les inculca este bello arte.La elegancia y calidad de sus bordados la hicieron conocida en su localidad y cada vez tiene más clientes, este crecimiento es producto de su amor por los hilos y telas que afanosamente labra con finísima paciencia. Por esta temporada y en vista de innumerables fiestas que se realizan en todo el valle del Mantaro sus pedidos se han incrementado notoriamente y la preocupación de contar con más telas y variedad de colores para bordar los hermosos trajes la llevan a solicitar un préstamo de 175 dólares para invertir este capital exclusivamente en la compra de insumos para la obtención de magníficos productos y te extiende su compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses.Solidaricémonos con Julia para poder hacer realidad su anhelada labor.

loans.use: To purchase more thread and more fabric to make beautiful party costumes(skirts) for the people of Huancayo

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es:
Doña Hermelinda is originally from Huayucachi. She has been raising chickens in her home for the past 20 years which in turn she sells at the local mercado once the chickens are fully developed. Chicken meat is in high demand in this area due to its nutrional value. Her business has grown over the past years due to the good care Hermelinda gives to her chickens.

Hermelinda's motivation are her two children. Since she stays at home taking care of her chickens, she also spends a lot quality time with ther children. Hermelinda has big aspirations and one of them is to have her small chicken farm transform into a big and prosperous business. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 USD to purchase more chicks and to purchase better food to feed her chickens. She comitts to repay this loan within 6 months. She thanks you for your generosity!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Hermelinda es natural de Huayucachi, y hace 20 años decidió criar gallinas en las humildes instalaciones de su hogar para que a su madurez total pueda comercializarlas en el mercado de su localidad; debido a la demanda y al alto contenido proteico esta carne de ave es muy solicitada por las madres de familia para el alimento de sus pequeños en crecimiento y desarrollo continuo, con el tiempo este pequeño negocio ha ido creciendo y cada vez es más solicitado debido al cuidado que les profesa Hermelinda, en la actualidad su mayor motivación son sus dos pequeños hijos a los que atiende diariamente y gracias a que esta actividad la puede realizar en casa puede otorgarles mucho amor y dedicación.Doña Hermelinda tiene grandes aspiraciones y una de ellas es ver su pequeña granja de pollos convertida en todo una avícola, para ello es que solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares para invertirlos en la compra de más y mejor alimento para sus gallinas y la compra de más pollitos para criarlos hasta su madurez y te extiende el compromiso de retornarlos en un período de 6 meses y te agradece tu noble colaboración para llevar a cabo su propósito.

loans.use: To purchase more chickens and food to feed the chickens

loans.name: Elvira Bertha

texts.es:
Doña Elvira is originally from this region and she decided to stay in her native land to try to beat poverty which a lot of families are face with in this part of the country. She has been succesful due to her optimism and the love she has for her family. She has 3 children whom she supports and loves dearly. She wants for her kids to get an education and to have a better quality of life.

She raises and sells chickens. She has been doing this for the past 6 years. She gets up at the crack of dawn to feed her chickens and to make sure they are well-taken care of. She feels that she has enough experience doing this and her wish is to increase the number of chickens in her little farm. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $325 USD to purchase more chickens so that she can make more profit in a short time and use the money to take care of her family. With your help, Doña Elvira can make her dream come true!

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Elvira es natural de la zona y decidió quedarse en su propia tierra para salir adelante y enfrentar la pobreza que agobia a muchas familias en el interior de su país y hasta ahora lo ha logrado con suma satisfacción gracias a su optimismo y al amor de su familia, ella es madre de tres niños a los que mantiene y educa con sumo amor y su deseo de brindarles una mejor calidad de vida ha hecho que su perseverancia este centrada en la venta y crianza de pollos; actividad a la que se dedica hace ya 6 años.Su labor cada día es realizada con mucha entereza y para ello debe iniciar sus actividades desde muy temprano y para lograr pollos bien nutridos y de excelente calidad no escatima esfuerzos ni inversión. Habiendo adquirido la experiencia suficiente en este oficio su deseo es incrementar el número de ejemplares en su pequeña granja motivo por el cual solicita un préstamo de 325 dólares que invertirá exclusivamente en la compra de más pollos para que a corto tiempo pueda obtener mayores ganancias e invertirá sus réditos para mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Con tu ayuda podrá hacer de su anhelo un hecho real.

loans.use: To purchase chickens and food to feed the chickens

loans.name: Phin

texts.en: Mrs. Phin R., 36, is a mother of three children and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To contribute towards covering her family’s expenses, Phin R. work selling fruits on the roadside in her community, where she can typically makes around $2 of profit a dayt. Her husband works as a gardener, earning $4 each day and two of her children attend school. Phin R. has applied for a loan to purchase more different kinds of fruits to fulfill her customers' demands

loans.use: To purchase more different kinds of fruits to fulfill her customers' demands

payments.comment: Phin Ry has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Keo

texts.en: Mrs. Keo S. is a mother of three children and lives in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a landlord building different rooms and renting them to the people in her area. She generally generates around $2 each day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning $2 a day, one of her children is employed at a garment factory and the rest  are students. Because of her growing customer demand Mrs. Keo S. has recently applied for a loan to build more rooms which will enable her to generate  additional income.

loans.use: To build more rooms enabling her to generate additional income.

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Keo Sophat has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Sapitriah

texts.id:
With a small investment of table and a small rack, Sapitriah open a stall to sell tidbits and soft drinks at Port Gilimanuk. She chosen that spot, because she felt it's startegic and many people wait there to board the ship. She starts work at 10am and finish at 3. With the capital of Rp. 500.000, Sapitriah usually gets a profit of Rp. 25.000 per day. However this will used to sustain herself and her 5 year old child. Her husband works as a sandal seller around her area. Even though she has a strategic location , but due to her inability to offer a variety of food and drinks, her customers are not always satisfied. With DINARI's help, Sapitriah has manage to increase her variety and make her customer happy and herself happy because of the increased income.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan bermodalkan sebuah meja dan rak sederhana, Sapitriah membuka usaha berjualan aneka makanan ringan di pelabuhan Gilimanuk. Lokasi itu dipilih karena banyak orang yang akan naik ke kapal laut beristirahat dilokasi Sapitriah berjualan. Sapitriah mulai membuka usahanya dari pukul 10 pagi sampai pukul 3 dini hari. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 500.000.-, Sapitriah bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 25.000.- per hari. Namun keuntungan itu harus disisihkan untuk membiayai hidupnya dan seorang anaknya uang berusia 5 tahun, sedangkan suaminya berprofesi sebagai pedagang sandal dan tas yang dipasarkan dengan cara berkeliling di sekitar lingkungan tempat tinggalnya atau di desa lainya. Karena menempati lokasi yang strategis, dagangan Sapitriah banyak dikunjungi oleh pelanggan. Namun karena keterbatasan modal, seringkali pelanggan tidak mendapat yang diinginkannya. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dana dari Dinari, Sapitriah menambah variasi dagangannya sehingga para pelanggan menjadi puas karena semua keinginannya bisa terpenuhi. Hal ini menyebabkan pelanggan Sapitriah bertambah banyak dan keuntungan pun didapatnya lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use: Membeli aneka makanan dan minuman ringan - To buy  tidbits and Soft Drinks.

loans.name: Ni Luh Sudermi

texts.id:
After getting married, Ni Luh Suderni has already started this business to solve her problems. Ni Luh Suderni has a sow which she feed in the morning and afternoon, and every 6 months this sow gives birth to about 6-10 piglets which is then sold at around Rp.150.000 - Rp.175.000 each, she earns about Rp.800.000. From this she used to finance Gede Adi Sanjaya's education, which is now in Secondary Year 2. art of the income is also used to maintain her house expenses and repairs. The finance from DINARI will be used to buy pig feedings, furthermore her sow has just given birth to 10 piglets, hopefully they will be well feed and able to fetch a good price.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Sejak menikah Ni Luh Suderni sudah menekuni usaha ini untuk menopang kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Ni Luh Suderni memelihara 1 ekor babi induk yang secara rutin diberi makan pagi dan sore hari. Setiap 6 bulan sekali induk babi ini mempunyai anak 6 sampai 10 ekor,yang laku dijual dengan harga Rp.150.000 sampai Rp.175.000 perekor. Dari penjualan ini keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.800.000. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk biaya sekolah Gede Adi Sanjaya, anaknya yang kini sudah duduk dibangku SMA kelas 2, Keuntungan ini juga sedikit demi sedikit disisihkan untuk memperbaiki rumahnya sehingga menjadi permanent seperti sekarang ini. Dana yang dipinjam dari DINARI dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak apalagi sekarang Penginduk ini baru melahirkan 10 ekor anak jadi dibutuhkan makanan yang bagus agar anak-anaknya pun bertumbuh dengan bagus dan berkwalitas sehingga hasil penjualannya menjadi meningkat

loans.use: membeli bibit babi dan makanan ternak - to buy piglets and pig feedings

loans.name: Mudayani

texts.id:
Mudayani's Husband's salary as Ojek is insufficient to cover her family's expenses. This has prompted her to find alternative to increase their household income. She decided to become a seller. She chosen this, because she felt that the turnover is fast. She invested her savings of Rp. 450.000 as capital and operated her stall at Gilimanuk Port.Mudayani start selling from 8am till 3am because during those time many people waits to board the ship. She manage to earn about Rp. 20.000 per day. With the help from DINARI, Mudayani hopes to increase her selection of items that she sells. She also intend to buy new furniture to make her stall look more attractive to customers.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Penghasilan suami Mudayani sebagi Ojek ( jasa transportasi dengan sepeda motor ) dirasa kurang bisa memenuhi kebutuhan keluarga. Hal itu memacu Mudayani untuk mencari mencari usaha lain untuk menambah penghasilan keluarganya. Usaha yang dipilih Mudayani adalah sebagai Dagang Asongan ( menjual aneka makanan dan minuman ). Hal itu dipilihnya karena perputaran uangnya cepat, sehingga modalnya bisa diputarnya kembali. Bermodalkan uang tabungannya yang sebesar Rp. 450.000.-, Mudayani membuka usahanya di pelabuhan Gilimanuk. Mudayani mulai berjualan dari pukul 8 pagi sampai pukul 3 pagi, karena pada jam – jam tersebut banyak penumpang yang berdatangan untuk menunggu naik ke kapal laut. Dalam sehari, Mudayani mampu mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 20.000.- per hari. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, Mudayani berencana untuk menambah jenis dagangannya sehingga lebih banyak pilihan. Mudayani juga berencana untuk membeli rak dan toples yang lebih baik, sehingga dagangannya kelihatan lebih menarik dan akan menarik minat pelanggan lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use: Membeli aneka makanan dan minuman ringan - Stock up inventory of tidbits and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Simpen

texts.id:
Ni Nyoman Simpen, is a mother to 3 children. Her eldest child is first year in secondary school, which her second and third child is in 5 and 3 year student in primary school. Her husband works as a sweeper at a market neat Gilimanuk Port. With 3 schooling children, Ni Nyoman has to work hard to finance their education. She has a fruit stall business. She started this business since she was married. And didn't move into other business because she is very used to this business. Before having help from DINARI, Ni Nyoman SImpen only had capital from her own savings which is around Rp. 500.000, which is insufficient for her to cater for more fruits. She find it frustrated to not able to cater customer's request for a variety of fruits. Therefore some days NI Nyoman SImpen only manage to have a mere profit of Rp. 35.000. After having help from Dinari her capital increased to Rp. 1.100.000. She has also manage to increase her selection of fruits. And manage to get around Rp, 60.000 profit per day. With it She is able to cover finance her children studies and yet have enough cash flow for the business.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nyoman Simpen, ibu dengan 3 orang anak. Anak yang pertama sudah duduk dibangku SMA kelas 1, yang kedua SD kelas 5 dan yang terakhir duduk dibangku SD kelas 3. Suaminya bekerja sebagai Tukang Sapu di pasar dekat pelabuhan Gilimanuk. Dengan 3 anak yang duduk di bangku sekolah, Ni Nyoman Simpen harus bekerja untuk menunjang biaya pendidikan anaknya. Ni Nyoman Simpen mempunyai usaha sebagai Dagang Buah – buahan. Usaha ini sudah ditekuni Ni Nyoman Simpen sejak menikah dan tidak pernah beralih ke usaha lain karena pekerjaan ini sudah menjadi keahliannya Sebelum mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Ni Nyoman Simpen hanya mengandalkan uang simpanannya sendiri untuk modal usaha sebesar Rp. 500.000.- Dengan modal yang kurang mencukupi, Ni Nyoman Simpen seringkali tidak mampu melayani pembeli karena buah – buahan yang dimilikinya kurang bervariasi jenisnya. Terkadang dalam sehari Ni Nyoman Simpen hanya mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp. 35.000.- Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, modal yang dimilikinya sekarang menjadi Rp. 1.100.000.- dan dengan dana itu, Ni Nyoman Simpen sudah mampu menambah dagangannya dengan aneka jenis buah – buahan. Dengan kondisi yang sekarang, Ni Nyoman Simpen bisa mendapat keuntungan yang lebih besar yakni Rp, 60.000.- per hari. Keuntungan itu sudah bisa untuk menghidupi keluarga, biaya sekolah anaknya dan untuk modal usaha.

loans.use: Membeli berbagai jenis buah - buahan yang disukai oleh pelanggannya -  To buy more fruits to cater to her customer's request.

loans.name: Ni Putu Sunantri

texts.id:
Mdm Ni Putu Sunantri wants to be a successful farmer. To fulfill this dream, Putu Sunantri works very hard in her pig farming business which has been going for a few years. She has sow which give births to about 8-10 piglets each time which then can sold at a very good price at the market. But the sow has aged and cannot reproduce anymore. She just recently bought 4 new piglets, to be rear for about 5 months then be sold at the market. Her profit from this, which is around Rp.1.200.000 will be used to finance her child's education and her household expenses which is increasing.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Sunantri mempunyai keinginan menjadi seorang peternak yang sukses. Untuk itulah Putu Sunantri tekun sekali dalam menjalankan usaha beternak babi yang sudah dijalaninya beberapa tahun belakangan ini secara tradisional. Dulu babi induknya bisa menghasilkan anak babi antara 8-10 babi yang kalau dijual sangat lumayan untuk menunjang perekonomian keluarganya tetapi sekarang induk babi itu sdah tidak produktif lagi karena usianya yg sudah tua. Putu Sunantri membeli 4 ekor bibit untuk penggemukan yang dipelihara selama 5 bulan kemudian dijual. Keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp.1.200.000 untuk 4 ekor babi dan dari keuntungan ini dipergunakan untuk biaya sekolah salah satu anaknya yang kini duduk dibangku SMP kelas 1, serta untuk kebutuhan keluarga yang semakin hari semakin meningkat.

loans.use: Membeli bibit babi Dan Membeli makanan ternak - To buy piglets, and pig feedings.

loans.name: Ni Wayan Kormen

texts.id:
Since her husband’s income as a farmer is not enough and stable, Wayan Kormen (Wayan Suarka’s wife) started the pig farming business to support her family’s life with increasing daily life expenses. With Rp.800,000 (about $87) as the initial capital, Wayan Kormen bought 1 female pig. The female pig can give birth to 4 to 11 piglets every 6 months. 1 piglet can be sold for Rp.150,000 (about $16) to Rp.175,000 (about $19). From selling the piglets, Wayan Kormen usually earns Rp.750,000 (about $82) of profit per 6 months. However, this profit is not enough for the daily family expenses; therefore, Wayan Kormen will need to expand the business.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Karena penghasilan suami sebagai petani tidak mencukupi dan tidak rutin setiap hari maka Wayan Kormen istri dari Wayan Suarka menekuni usaha beternak babi. Hal ini dimaksud untuk menunjang ekonomi Rumah Tangga, yang semakin hari semakin meningkat. Dengan modal awal Rp. 800.000 Wayan Kormen membeli 1 ekor induk babi. Dari induk babi yang dipeliharanya bisa melahirkan 4 -11 ekor anak babi setiap 6 bulannya. Satu ekor biasanya dijual Rp.150.000 sampai Rp.175.000. Dari penjualan anak babi ini biasanya Wayan Kormen mendapat keuntungan Rp.750.000 per 6 bulan sekali. Namun penghasilan tersebut masih terasa kurang untuk memenuhi kebutuhan setiap harinya untuk itu Wayan Kormen akan terus mengembangkan usahanya.

loans.use: To add more growing pigs and pig's food

loans.name: Ni Luh Wiliani

texts.id:
With an initial capital of Rp.1,000,000 (about $109), Ni Luh Wiliani started her business in pig farming. Wiliani bought 1 female pig to breed. She has to spend at least Rp.10,000 (about $1) daily for feeding the pig and she also has to spend Rp.20,000 (about $2) for her daily family expenses. As Wiliani has 2 children who are still studying at school and her husband’s income as a farmer is not always reliable, she uses the pig farming business to support the family. She gets Rp.700,000 (about $76) of profit per 6 months. 1 piglet usually can be sold for Rp.150.000 (about $16) to Rp.175.000 (about $19) and 1 female pig usually can give birth to 5 to 10 piglets. Wiliani is very glad to get the loan from DINARI because she can use the loan to add 6 more growing pigs and she hopes that the business is getting better and more profitable.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan modal awal sebesar 1 juta rupiah, Ni Luh Wiliani memulai usahanya beternak babi.Wiliani membeli 1 ekor Induk babi untuk dipelihara .Setiap hari biaya yang harus dikeluarkan sebesar Rp.10.000 hanya untuk pakan babi saja.Sedangkan biaya rumah tangga rutin harus dikeluarkan sebesar Rp.20.000 setiap harinya.Karena penghasilan suami sebagai seorang petani tidak menentu,sedangkan Wiliani mempunyai 2 orang anakyang masih bersekolah yang harus ditanggung, maka dengan usaha beternak babi ini dapat menopang biaya rumah tangganya.Keuntungan yang diperoleh dari beternak babi ini Rp. 700.000 setiap 6 bulan sekali karena setiap 6 bulan sekali Induk ini baru mempunyai anak yang sudah siap dijual.Satu ekor biasanya laku Rp.150.000-Rp.175.000 dan untuk 1 induk babi biasanya bisa melahirkan anak 5 sampai 10 ekor. Wiliani sangat bersyukur sekali atas pinjaman yang diberikan oleh DINARI. Karena melalui pinjaman ini Wiliani bisa membeli 6 ekor bibit untuk penggemukan ,dengan harapan usahanya ini semakin maju dan hasil yang diperolehpun lebih meningkat.

loans.use: To add more growing pigs and pig's food

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok P., 27, lives with her husband and one little child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their plot of land raising pigs, grinding mill and selling rice to the people in their area. Together they earn approximately $6 each day. This couple hopes to use this loan to purchase a motorcycle to transport their rice crops and the remainder of the money is to be used to buy additional ten pigs and feed for their livestock supplies.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to transport their rice crops and the remainder of the money is to be used to buy additional ten pigs and feed for their livestock supplies

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sok Phom has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Ni Ketut Derni

texts.id:
Ketut Derni bought 1 female pig and she takes care of it every morning and evening. In 6 months, the female pig has given birth to 8-10 piglets that can be sold. She earned Rp. 650,000 (about $71) from selling the piglets and then she bought another female pig so now she has 2 female pigs to breed. She has to spend Rp.20,000 (about $2) daily for feeding the pigs. She earns Rp.2,000,000 (about $218) from 2 female pigs per 6 months. This business has helped Ketut Derni pay her children education fee and renovate her house to become a more decent place to live in. She spends the loan for buying the the pig's food due to its increasing price.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Ketut Derni membeli 1ekor Penginduk yang dengan telaten dirawatnya setiap pagi dan sore hari, dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan babi induk ini mampu menghasilkan anak antara 8-10 anak babi yang nantinya akan dijual dan dari hasil penjualan anak babi ini Ketut Derni mendapat keuntungan Rp.650.000,- yang dipakai untuk membeli 1 ekor babi induk lagi sehingga sekarang Ketut Derni memelihara 2 ekor penginduk. Setiap hari biaya yang harus dikeluarkan Rp.20.000 hanya untuk pakan ternak saja. Dari 2 ekor penginduk yang dipelihara keuntungan yang diperoleh adalah sebesar Rp.2.000.000 setiap enam bulannya. Lewat usaha ini Ketut Derni bisa membiayai sekolah anaknya dan juga memperbaiki rumah tempat tinggalnya menjadi sebuah rumah yang layak ditempati. Pinjaman dari DINARI dipergunakan untuk biaya pakan ternaknya karena semakin hari harga pakan semakin meningkat.

loans.use: To add growing pig, purchase female pig and pig's food

loans.name: Yang

texts.en: Mrs. Yang H., 57, lives with her three children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works as a tailor, earning  $3 each day; her husband is a cook and one of her children is employed at a garment factory, while another attends school. Mrs Yang H. hopes to use this loan to purchase a sewing machine to increase her tailoring business so she can generate more income.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine to increase her tailoring business and generate additional income.

loans.name: Sri Rahayu

texts.id:
Sri Rahayu is a hard-working lady. As a traveling saleswoman, she starts selling from 10am until 2am the next day. Besides renting a kiosk, she also sells the merchandises using a basket in the buses that just arrive in the harbor to wait for their turn to get on the ships. With Rp. 500,000 (about $54.5) capital, Sri Rahayu can buy several merchandise items including snacks and soft drinks. She can get Rp. 30,000 (about $3) profit per night. This profit has to be spent for capital and paying the kiosk rent fee so she often runs out of fund to buy merchandise. After getting the loan from Dinari, she can add more merchandise so that she won’t run out of merchandise. By increasing the capital, she can increase the profit to Rp. 50,000 (about $5.45) per night.

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Sri Rahayu, seorang wanita yang sangat ulet dalam melakukan pekerjaannya. Sebagai Dagang Asongan, Sri Rahayu sudah memulai usahanya dari pukul 10.00 sampai pukul 02.00 dini hari. Selain menyewa sebuah tempat untuk berjualan, Sri Rahayu juga menjajakan dagangannya dengan cara membawa sebuah keranjang dan masuk ke dalam bus – bus yang baru masuk ke dalam pelabuhan untuk menunggu giliran naik ke kpal laut. Dengan modal sebesar Rp. 500.000.- , Sri rahayu bisa membeli beberapa jenis dagangan berupa makanan dan minuman ringan. Dalam semalam Sri Rahayu bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 30.000.- Keuntungan itu harus juga dibagi untuk modal dan membayar sewa tempat, sehingga Sri Rahayu sering kekurangan modal untuk membeli dagangan lagi. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Sri Rahayu mampu menambah jenis barang dagangannya sehingga tidak pernah kekurangan stok. Dengan bertambahnya modal, Sri Rahayu mampu meningkatkan keuntungannya menjadi Rp. 50.000.-

loans.use: To add merchandise such as various snacks and soft drinks

loans.name: Khourn

texts.en: Mrs. Khourn C. L., 30, is a mother of three school-aged children and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To supplement her family’s expenses, Mrs.C. L. has a small stall in front of her house selling grocery items and provision to the people in her area. She can generally make around $3 each day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, earning $2/day. Mrs. Khourn C. L. is humbly requesting for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate his business and the leftover of the money is to expand her inventory.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for her husband to operate his business and the leftover of the money is to expand her inventory.

payments.comment: Congratulations to Khourn Chan Lourn for repaying the Kiva loan early

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en: Mr. Oeun K., 40, is a widower and lives with his six children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. To cover his family's expenses, he moderately earns around $2 each day from working as a fisherman, while three of his children are employed at a factory and the rest are students. Mr Oeun K. has recently applied for a loan to purchase a boat and a fishing net so that he will be able to improve his fishery business during this coming rainy season.

loans.use: To purchase a boat and a fishing net so that he will be able to have enough tools to improve his fishery business during this coming rainy season.

loans.name: Prihatini

texts.id:
Having a strategic selling place in the harbor is advantageous to Prihatini. Her daily customers are passengers who are waiting for the ship to depart. Having a limited fund of Rp. 500,000 (about $54.5), Prihatini often runs out of merchandise. Everyday Prihatini starts to sell from 10am until 11pm and her profit is Rp. 30,000 (about $3 ) per night. She wants to increase her quality of life by adding more merchandise to sell. Using the loan from Dinari, Prihatini has bought several kinds of beverages, cigarettes, and some other snacks. After increasing the quantity of the merchandise, Prihatini can double her profit to Rp. 60,000 (about $6.5) per night. This profit can make her family’s life better because her husband just works as a tukang ojek (a motorcycle driver who gets paid for sending people to their destination; usually travels in shorter distance compared to a taxi driver).

Translated from Indonesian by Kustini Lim, Kiva volunteer.

Menempati posisi yang strategis di pelabuhan untuk berjualan sangat menguntungkan Prihatini. Setiap harinya Prihatini melayani para pembeli yang merupakan penumpang kapal laut yang sedang menunggu kapal laut berlabuh. Dengan dana yang terbatas, yakni sebesar Rp. 500.000.-, Prihatini sering kewalahan bahkan kehabisan barang dagangannya. Setiap hari Prihatini mulai berjualan pukul 10.00 sampai dengan pukul 23.00 malam dan per malam keuntungan yang diperoleh sebesar Rp. 30.000.- Prihatini ingin meningkatkan kwalitas hidupnya dengan menambah barang dagangannya. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, Prihatini sudah membeli berbagai jenis minuman ringan, rokok dan makanan ringan lainnya. Setelah jumlah dagangannya bertambah, Prihatini bisa meningkatkan keuntungan itu menjadi dua kali lipat yaitu Rp. 60.000.- per malam. Keuntungan itu bisa menambah kesejahteraan keluarganya, karena suaminya hanya bekerja sebagai tukang ojek.

loans.use: To purchase various kind of snacks and beverages for more merchandise

loans.name: Srun

texts.en: Mrs. Srun L., 61, is a mother of two children and lives with her husband ( pictured because Srun L. is unavailable) in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She runs a store at home selling grocery products to the people in her area and typically earns up to $12/day in revenue. Her husband, 63, has retired from his job and two of her children work as waitresses, together earning $60 per month. This loan is to be used to expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand and the remainder of the money is to be used to repair her house.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by adding more grocery products to meet her growing customer demand. The remainder of the money is to be used to repair her house.

loans.name: I Wayan Sutarma

texts.id:
I Nyoman Sutarma owns a welding shop with one contract employee. Sutarma serves each customer who comes around, and services their equipment, and on top of that Sutarma himself also immediately begins work on each order. This business was pioneered four years ago with Rp. 1,700,000, which went towards used carbide welding equipment. Now it has grown into a busy shop with many orders. Moreover, now it has been completed with an electric welding machine which was purchased with money made possible through a loan of Rp. 2,000,000. With the business Sutarma now runs he can take in Rp. 400,000 a day with a profit of Rp. 150,000 a day. Sutarma uses this income to fund his kids who are still in primary school. Sutarma feels proud to own this business because in addition to earning a living, the man from Nengah Purwani can also contribute to the economy for the people in the area.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

I Nyoman Sutarma memiliki usaha yaitu bengkel las dengan satu (1) orang tenaga kerja yang digaji dengan sistem kontrak / prosentase. Sutarma bisa melayani setiap pelanggan yang datang memesan ataupun menservice barangnya. bahkan Sutarma sendiri juga ikut terjun langsung mengerjakan setiap pesanan yang ada. Usaha ini dirintisnya sejak 4 tahun yang lalu dengan modal Rp. 1.700.000.- yang berupa alat las karbit bekas (second). Kini sudah berkembang menjadi bengkel yang ramai dan banyak pesanan . Apalagi sekarang sudah dilengkapi dengan mesin las listrik yang di belinya dengan menggunakan uang pinjaman dari Dinari Rp 2.000.000 . Dengan usaha yang dimiliki sekarang Sutarma bisa berproduksi Rp 400.000/hari dan keuntungan bersih yang di dapat Rp 150.000/hari . Hasil inilah yang Sutarma pergunakan untuk membiayai seorang anaknya yang masih duduk di bangku sekolah menengah pertama ( SMP ). Sutarma merasa bangga memiliki usaha ini karena selain mendapatkan hasil tambahan , suami dari Nengah Purwani ini juga bisa menciptakan lapangan kerja bagi masyarakat sekitarnya .

loans.use: Purchase a dynamo to increase repair capacity and complete orders in a more timely fashion - Membeli sebuah mesin dinamo untuk meningkatkan kinerja bengkelnya, sehingga pesanan dapat diselesaikan tepat waktu

loans.name: Auk

texts.en: Mrs. Auk H., 44, lives with her husband and three children in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She is a vendor selling vegetables in an open-air market and earns around $1 of profits each day. Her husband, meanwhile, works as a motor-taxi driver and a middleman buying and selling cows; one of her children is employed at a garment factory, another one works as a blacksmith and the rest  attend school. Mrs. Ouk Han hopes to use this loan to purchase an electrical metal cutter and other blacksmith’s tools for her son’s business. She believes this loan will make his business grow further and faster

loans.use: To purchase an electrical metal cutter and other blacksmith’s tools for her son’s business

loans.name: Mohammad Eshan

texts.en: M. Eshan lives in district 5 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is an old man. He has a retail shop in Kabul. He has a lot of experience in has job. He wants to expand his business, so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, and packets of envelopes to enlarge his shop to attract more clients. He wants to make good income for his family. He is happy with this loan and would like to thank AFSG.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like boxes of chocolates, bags of sweets, and packets of envelopes.

loans.name: Ni Ketut Suarti

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Suarti has tried her hand at various kinds of business, in attempts to make sufficient money to help alleviate her husband's responsibility. But only the business of raising pigs has been a vocation that fits. By raising two piglets, Suarti can earn Rp. 250,000 per month. Every day Suarti is busy with raising the pigs in a very simple stable. Suarti business is growing, and this is not irrespective of Dinari's role, which has created the foundation for the business, including giving a loan of Rp. 1,400,000, used by Suarti to buy one sow which is ready to breed. Now Suarti no longer needs to buy piglits for raising, because Suarti can provide piglets for her neighbors. Many advantages are obtained by Mrs. Suarti from raising pigs, including earning enough to support her family, while the pig manure can be used as fertilizer in the vegetable garden.

Translated from Indonesian by Andrew Goss, Kiva Volunteer.

Ni Ketut Suarti sudah mencoba beberapa jenis usaha yang bisa mendatangkan keuntungan yang besar untuk membantu meringankan beban suaminya .Tetapi hanya usaha beternak babi yang merupakan usaha yang lebih menjanjikan. Dengan dua ekor babi yang di pelihara, Suarti dapat menghasilkan Rp. 250.000 per bulannya . Setiap harinya Suarti sibuk dengan mengurus ternak babi peliharaannya di sebuah kandang yang sangat sederhana . Usaha Suarti semakin berkembang , hal ini tak terlepas dari peranan Dinari yang ikut memberikan pembinaan tentang usaha disamping juga memberikan pinjaman modal Rp. 1.400.000.- , yang oleh Suarti di pergunakan untuk membeli 1 ekor induk babi yang sudah siap untuk di kawinkan. Kini Suarti tak perlu lagi membeli bibit untuk di pelihara sendiri bahkan Suarti sudah bisa menyediakan bibit bagi tetangganya. Banyak manfaat yang di peroleh Bu Suarti dari beternak babi ,di samping hasilnya yang cukup untuk kebutuhan keluarga, kotoran babi bisa diolah menjadi pupuk kandang yang berguna untuk kebun sayurnya.

loans.use: To buy a breeding sow ready to birth piglets - Membeli induk babi yang sudah siap untuk dikawinkan sehingga segera memperoleh anak babi untuk dijual kembali

loans.name: Ni Komang Karmini

texts.id:
Persistance is the main capital of Ni Komang Karmini, young mother, wife of I Gede Sujana. Although she felt resistance from the price speculation done by the pig businesspersons, that did not stop Komang Karmini to expand her business. With the capital from Dinari of Rp 1,400,000 (about US$150) this mother of a girl named Ni Luh Puspayani could buy 4 piglets to be fatten. With a cost of Rp5000 (about 60 cents) feed cost, within a period of 6 months she could profit Rp2000,000 (about $220). From that profit she will but more pig feedstock, so that within a year she could harvest 2X, and that would increase her profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ketekunan adalah modal utama yang di miliki oleh Ni Komang Karmini, Ibu muda pasangan dari I Gede Sujana ini . Meski sering mengalami hambatan dan permainan harga yang dilakukan oleh ulah para pedagang babi, hal itu tak membuat pupus semangat Komang Karmini untuk mengembangkan usahanya. Dengan modal pinjaman dari Dinari Rp 1.400.000.- Ibu dari seorang anak perempuan yang bernama Ni Luh Puspayani ini membeli empat (4) ekor bibit babi yang siap untuk digemukkan. Dengan biaya Rp.5.000 per ekor untuk biaya pakan, maka keuntungan yang didapat dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan adalah Rp. 2.000.000.- Dari keuntungan tersebut akan dibelikan bibit babi lagi ,sehingga dalam setahun bisa panen 2 kali dan keuntungan yang didapat pun lebih banyak

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock for fattening

Membeli bibit babi untuk penggemukkan

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sinten

texts.id:
Ni Ketut Sinten is a pig farmer. Today she owns 2 piglets to be fatten, and 1 mother pig. Pig price condition are high today because of high demand. To fatten piglets it need 5-6 months time before it could be sold. Within a month to buy feed for thes pigs, Sinten spent RP90,000 (about US$10)/month. In 6 months Sinten could profit Rp200,000 (about US$220) from piglets that she has fatten. This profit was used by Sinten to finance family needs, saved, also as business capital. Sinten lives in a semi permanent building (hut) made from woven bamboos. Loan from DINARI will be used to buy a mother pig, with the hope to produce more piglets.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Ketut Sinten adalah seorang peternak babi. Saat ini baru memiliki 2 ekor babi penggemukan dan 1 ekor induk. Kondisi harga babi saat ini sedang tinggi karena banyaknya permintaan di pasaran. Untuk penggemukan biasanya membutuhkan waktu 5-6 bulan baru bisa dijual. Dalam 1 bulan, untuk membeli pakan babi-babi tersebut Sinten menghabiskan Rp. 90.000,- Dalam waktu 6 bulan Sinten mendapat keuntungan Rp. 200.000,- dari penjualan anak babi yang sudah digemukkan. Keuntungan itu dipergunakan Sinten untuk membiayai kebutuhan keluarga, ditabung dan juga untuk modal usaha. Sinten tinggal di sebuah rumah semi permanent yang bangunannya terbuat dari gedeg. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk membeli induk babi dengan harapan induk babinya dapat menghasilkan lebih banyak anak babi.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig so that it could produce more piglets

Membeli induk babi, sehingga akan mendapat lebih banyak anak babi

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sumadi

texts.id:
Ni Nengah Sumadi live in her own semi permanent hut built from gedeg (woven bamboo). The traditional way Sumadi has raised pigs for 27 years. With a capital of Rp1,550,000 (about US$170) Sumadi bought 3 piglets for Rp250,000 (about $28) each, and the rest to buy pig feed. After 5 months Sumadi will sell those raised pigs, for a Rp250,000 (about $28) profit. Those profit is used for her daily expense with her husband. Laon from DINARI will be used to buy more piglets to be raised, with the hope Sumadi will get more profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Nengah Sumadi tinggal di sebuah rumah milik sendiri yang bangunannya semi permanent terbuat dari gedeg. Secara tradisional Sumadi memelihara babi sejak 27 tahun yang lalu. Dengan modal Rp. 1.550.000,- Sumadi membeli 3 ekor bibit babi penggemukan yang masing-masing harganya Rp. 250.000,- dan sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan babi-babi tersebut. Setelah 5 bulan Sumadi akan menjual babi-babi yang sudah dipeliharanya tersebut dan mendapat keuntungan Rp. 250.000,- Keuntungan tersebut digunakan untuk keperluan hidupnya sehari-hari bersama suaminya. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal membeli bibit babi penggemukan dengan harapan semakin banyak memelihara babi, Sumadi akan mendapat lebih banyak keuntungan.

loans.use:
To buy piglets to be fatten so that it could be sold at a higher pricer

Membeli bibit babi untuk digemukkan, sehingga dapat dijual lagi dengan harga yang lebih tinggi

loans.name: Ni Putu Suarni

texts.id:
Ni Putu Suarni is a housewife with one 5 year old child. Suarni stayed in a house she did not own. Since she did not have any other skills, Suarni became a pig farmer. Today, Suarni raise 1 mother pig and 3 piglets that she bought for Rp2000,000 (about US$220). A piglet cost Rp250,000 (about $28). Rest of the capital was used to buy animal feed. In a month Suarni spent Rp90,000 (about $10) to buy animal feed. After about 6 months Suarni could sell her raised pigs for a profit of Rp300,000 (about $33)/piece. Loan from DINARI wil be used to add capital to buy pig feedstock and animal feed, with the hope that she could raise more pigs and add profit.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Suarni adalah seorang ibu rumah tangga dengan 1 orang anak yang baru berumur 5 tahun. Suarni tinggal di sebuah rumah yang bukan miliknya sendiri ( menumpang ). Karena tidak memiliki keahlian lain, Suarni kemudian menjadi peternak babi. Saat ini Suarni memelihara 1 ekor induk babi dan 3 ekor penggemukan yang bibitnya dibeli dari modal Rp.2.000.000,- Satu ekor bibit penggemukan harganya Rp. 250.000,- Sisa dari modal tersebut dipakai untuk membeli pakannya. Dalam sebulan Suarni menghabiskan Rp.90.000,- untuk membeli pakan babinya. Setelah ± 6 bulan Suarni menjual babi hasil penggemukannya dan mendapat keuntungan Rp. 300.000,- per ekornya. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak, dengan harapan dapat memelihara lebih banyak lagi babi dan menambah keuntungan.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak

loans.name: Mohammadllah

texts.en: Mohammadllah lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two children: one son and one daughter. They are small. His wife is a teacher, and she helps her husband with the family expenses. He has a workshop where he fixes TV's and radios. He decided to increase his business and move to a new shop, so he wants to take an individual loan to complete his shop and expand his business. He wants to support his family. He is happy.

loans.use: To finish his shop

loans.name: Ni Made Wisani

texts.id:
Ni Made Wisani is a pig farmer since 2001. With an initial capital of Rp1,700,000 (about US$190) Wisani bought 4 piglets to be fatten. The rest was used to buy animal feed. Within 5-6 months Wisani sold her raised pig for a profit of Rp200,000(about $22)/piece, that was used to pay for daily expenses, and schooling of her 2 children, who are in 7th grade (1st year middle school), and 4th grade. Wisani lives in her own simple home. Loan from DINARI will be used to increase capital to buy feed for her pigs. She hoped that she would get the loan from DINARI so that her business could grow, and provide better results.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Made Wisani seorang peternak babi memulai usahanya sejak tahun 2001 yang lalu. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 1.700.000,- Wisani membeli 4 ekor bibit babi untuk digemukkan. Sisanya digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak babinya. Dalam waktu 5-6 bulan Wisani sudah menjual babi peliharaanya dan mendapat keuntungan Rp. 200.000,- per ekor, yang kemudian digunakan untuk biaya hidup sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah 2 orang anaknya yang masih kelas 1 SMP dan kelas 4 SD. Wisani tinggal di sebuah rumah milik sendiri yang sederhana. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal membeli pakan ternak babinya. Wisani berharap dengan mendapat pinjaman dari DINARI usaha ternak babinya semakin berkembang dan hasilnya semakin meningkat.

loans.use:
To buy quality animal feed so that her raised pig would grow better

Membeli pakan ternak yang berkwalitas sehingga pertumbuhan babinya menjadi lebih baik

loans.name: Rail

texts.en:
Mr. Rail is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 22 and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Rail owns a herd of cows.  Each year between July and August he buys two or three calves, breeds them and sells the breeded cows in the local market.  The business is profitable but is time-consuming and takes a lot of effort.  

Rail provides for his people and can't afford to save money to develop his business.  He needs additional investment, so this summer he applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a $500 loan.  This amount will allow him to buy four calves.  The price of a calf is about $120, but in half a year Rail could sell each breeded cow for $500.  He intends to constantly reinvest his profit margins to constantly increase the number of calves he can buy.

loans.use: To buy calves for breeding

loans.name: Ni Nengah Sarwi

texts.id:
A pig farmer since 1990. With a capital of Rp1,900,000 (about US$210) Ni Nengah Sarwi bought a mother pig and 3 piglets. Today Sarwi has 1 mother pig and 3 piglets. In a month Sarwi needs Rp90,000 (about $10) for pig feed. After about 6 months Sarwi would profit Rp250,000 (abot $28)/each from the pigs she raised. That profit was used to pay for her daily expenses, and schooling expenses for her 3 children. The first fisinish school but still live with her and not yet married. Her second child is in 8th grade (2nd grade moddle school). Her third is still 4 years old. Sarwi lives in a simple rental house. Loan from DINARI will be used to add capital with the hope her business would grow and income increased.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Menjadi seorang peternak babi telah dijalaninya sejak tahun 1990. Dengan modal Rp. 1.900.000,- Ni Nengah Sarwi membeli bibit induk babi dan bibit penggemukan. Saat ini Sarwi mempunyai 1 ekor induk babi dan 3 ekor babi penggemukan. Dalam sebulan Sarwi memerlukan Rp. 90.000,- untuk membeli pakan untuk babi peliharaannya. Setelah ± 6 bulan Sarwi baru mendapatkan keuntungan dari penjualan babi peliharaannya sebesar Rp. Rp. 250.000,- per ekornya. Keuntungan tersebut digunakan untuk membiayai kehidupannya sehari-hari dan biaya sekolah anaknya. Sarwi mempunyai 3 orang anak. Anaknya yang pertama sudah tamat sekolah namun masih tinggal bersamanya dan belum menikah. Anaknya yang kedua masih bersekolah kelas 2 SMP dan anaknya yang ketiga baru berumur 4 tahun. Sarwi tinggal bersama keluarganya di sebuah rumah sederhana, namun bukan miliknya sendiri ( numpang ). Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal usahanya dengan harapan usahanya dapat berkembang dan meningkatkan penghasilannya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock

Membeli bibit babi

loans.name: Cheng Chhun

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng Chhun L. (26) lives with her husband (28) and 2 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Cheng Chhun  makes Khmer noodles for resale. Her husband sells wholesale items, an activity which earns him $7.50  a day. Chen Chhun L. has applied for this loan in order to repair the car which her husband uses to transport the wholesale items for sale.

loans.use: To repair their car

loans.name: Janali

texts.en:
Mr. Janali is a vulnerable, low income young man.  He is single and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.  

Janali already has three pedigree cows but the income from them is too low to support Janali's family.  That is why he decided to apply to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher.  In the Caucasus region, the price of a good cow is about $800-1000, but Janali has some money of his own to add.

loans.use: To buy a pure-bred milk cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: I Ketut Sama

texts.id:
Every day Ketut Sama journeys from village to village to buy cocoa from farmers. This buying and selling cocoa has been his business for 7 years. With a capital of Rp2000,000 (about $220) Ketut Sama bought 160 kg (about 330 lbs) dried cocoa kernels. These cocoa kernels was re-sold to a larger processor, and could profit Rp40,000 (about $4.40)/day. From that profit Ketut Sama supports a wife and a 3rd grade child. Every day Ketut Sama spent Rp20,000 (about $2.20) for family food expenses. So that profit from selling cocoa kernel could be used to increase his capital. Ketut Sama still stays in his parents home. Loan from DINARI will be used to add capital so that his business could expand, and profit hopefully increased.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Setiap hari Ketut Sama berkeliling dari satu desa ke desa yang lain untuk membeli biji cacao ( Coklat ) dari petani. Pekerjaan jual beli biji cacao ini sudah dijalaninya selama 7 tahun. Dengan modal Rp. 2.000.000,- Ketut Sama dapat membeli 160 kg biji cacao yang sudah kering. Biji cacao tersebut dijual kembali kepada pengepul yang lebih besar dan mendapat keuntungan Rp. 40.000,- perhari. Dari keuntungan tersebut Ketut Sama menghidupi istri dan satu orang anaknya yang masih kelas 3 sekolah dasar. Setiap hari Ketut Sama menghabiskan Rp. 20.000,- untuk biaya makan keluarganya. Sehingga keuntungan menjual biji cacao dapat digunakan untuk menambah modal usahanya. Ketut Sama tinggal di sebuah rumah milik orangtuanya. Pinjaman dari DINARI digunakan untuk menambah modal usahanya agar usahanya dapat berkembang dan keuntungan yang diperoleh pun bisa lebih banyak.

loans.use:
To buy cocoa from farmers, and sell to processor

Membeli cacao dari petani untuk dijual kembali ke pengepul

loans.name: Seam

texts.en: Mrs. Seam K. (32) lives with her husband and 3 children in the Siem Reap district of Cambodia. Seam K. is engaged with cutting bamboo and selling it to the retailer for $2.50. Her husband is a trailer driver and earns $2 a day from this. Seam K. is applying for this loan in order to purchase timber to build a new house. She would like to make her home a safer and more comfortable environment for her 3 children.

loans.use: To build a house (buying wood)

payments.comment: Seam Kunthear has successfully repaid her loan early! Thanks to you, she was able to expand her business and improve the life of her family. Thank you for your support!

loans.name: Kleang

texts.en: Mrs. Kleang ChanT., 58, lives with her husband and two children and one grandchild in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She and her husband, together, work on their plot of farmland growing rice crops and a various types of vegetables and typically make around $2 each day. One of her children is married and works as a farmer as well. In order to make a good profit, this couple hopes to use this loan to purchase bananas from somebody else's plantation and then resell them at a good price

loans.use: To purchase bananas to resell at a good price

loans.name: Ni Wayan Sulastri

texts.id:
Wayan Sulastri has a firewood selling business. With a capital of Rp1000,000 (about US$110), Wayan Sulastri bought firewood from her customers about 700 bundles at a price of Rp500 (about 60 cents) per bundle. Then she sold to her customers at Rp600 (about 70 cents) per bundle. Her profit is Rp100 (11 cents)/bundle. Every day Wayan Sulastri could profit up to Rp70,000 (about $7.70). Serving her customers from home, Wayan Sulastri could also nurse her husband Bapak Nengah Wandra , who is ill with stroke. Every day living expense is Rp20,000 (about $2.20) plus child expense. With this business Wayan Sulastri is the backbone of the family, to provide for her sick husband. Loan from Dinari will be used to buy more firewood, with the hope that adding her sales would bring more profit for family better living.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Wayan Sulastri mempunyai usaha jual beli kayu bakar. Dengan modal Rp.1.000.000,- Wayan Sulastri membeli kayu api dari langganannya kurang lebih 700 ikat dengan harga perikat Rp.500,-. Sedangkan Wayan Sulastri menjual ke langganannya Rp.600. perikat. Keuntungannya Rp. 100,- perikat . Perharinya Wayan Sulastri bisa mendapat untung sampai Rp. 70.000,- .Dengan menunggu langganannya di rumah Wayan Sulastri juga bisa merawat suaminya Bapak Nengah Wandra yang sedang sakit struk. Biaya hidupnya sehari-hari Rp 20.000,- ditambah lagi biaya untuk anaknya. Dengan usahanya ini Wayan Sulastri menjadi tulang punggung keluarga dan menghidupi suaminya yang sakit.. Pinjaman dari Dinari digunakan untuk menambah pembelian kayu Bakar dan diharapkan dapat menambah barang dagangannya agar keuntungan yang diperoleh bisa meningkat untuk kesejahteraan keluarganya.

loans.use: Buy firewood from firewood collectors, and sell to processor

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna L. is divorced with a son. She lives in Kharkov and sells children’s footwear and clothing in the market of Barabashovo. Anna purchases her inventory from wholesalers and then sells it at retail prices. She has been in this business for 8 years. Anna has fully repaid 10 loans she has received from Nadiya Ukraine. Currently, her turnover capital is about $7000. 

Anna would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital and purchase seasonal inventory for the fall season. She is always looking for ways to promote the growth of her business and to stay competitive in the market. Anna believes that timely financial assistance will help her business develop and expand which will ultimately improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: Increase seasonal inventory

loans.name: Identity

texts.en:
The entrepreneur is 40 years old. She has 4 children. Her husband died two years ago in an explosion when he was at work, so she is responsible for a big family. She applied to borrow $1200 to purchase a new sewing machine and some modern fabric in order to increase her income and expand her small project. She wants to save for a better life for her family.

Disclaimer: This entrepreneur is from a volatile region where the security situation remains unsettled. Lenders to this business should be aware that this loan may represent a higher risk and accept this additional risk in making their loan.
