Note: Personally identifiable attributes of this entrepreneur have been altered to protect him or her (i.e. blacking out portions of the entrepreneur in his/her picture, altering his/her first or last name, etc.).

loans.use: Purchase new sewing machine

loans.name: Sergey

texts.en:
Sergey is married with two children – a 6 year old daughter and a 4 year old son. Sergey and his family live in Kharkov. He runs a business selling children’s clothing with two vending facilities in different parts of the city. As some markets in Kharkov work 24/7, Sergey works day and night shifts trying to provide a better living for his family. Despite the fact that he has been in this business for only one year, our client has already increased his turnover capital to $6000. His monthly net profit is currently about $1000.

Sergey is requesting a loan of $1200 to buy a vending facility and open a clothing store. He believes that opening a store will make shopping with kids easier and more comfortable for parents and would further promote the expansion of his business. Sergey has great managerial skills. He combines the responsibilities of church pastor, loving and thoughtful Dad and successful entrepreneur. We believe these skills will help him repay his loan on time and achieve all of his professional and personal goals.

loans.use: to open a new vending place

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is divorced with one child. She lives in Zaporozhye and runs a small business selling toys in one of the city markets. Tatyana lives alone and has to provide for the needs of her family. Her husband left her with her baby daughter right after her birth and ever since, she has had to find ways to support herself and her family. Tatyana likes to work in this sphere of trade because she knows the demand for toys is high in any season. Tatyana believes that loans from Nadiya Ukraine have helped her expand her trade. Since she started her small venture five years ago, her turnover capital has grown to $2,400. Her net profit currently amounts to $600 a month.  

Tatyana is requesting this loan to increase her turnover capital and sustain her business. We believe Tatyana’s generous heart, love for children, and perseverance in work will help our client succeed and achieve her business goals as well as provide better living standards for her daughter.

loans.use: Increase turnover capital

loans.name: Ruslan

texts.en:
Mr. Ruslan is a vulnerable, low income person. He is 30 years ols, married with two children and lives in the town of Saatli in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.  

Ruslan rents a small shop in the local bazaar of Saatli town and sells food.  The business is very successful, but he needs some investments to increase the daily turnover.  However, Ruslan has no collateral to apply to the commercial banks for a loan.  That is why he has applied to Normicro Saatli branch for a $500 loan.  This credit could allow him to buy and sell bigger amount of goods, and to better provide for the necessities of life for his children.

loans.use: To increase the volume of his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nen

texts.en: Mrs. Nen L. (21) and her husband live in the Siem Reap province with their child. They work selling hardware items, earning about $5 a day between them. Mrs. Nen L. is applying for this loan in order to purchase more hardware items so that she can more effectively meet customer demand.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

payments.comment: Congrats! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for taking a sincere interest in helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like Nen Lin start and sustain their businesses. Your willingness to share your financial resources has made a difference. We hope you continue to lend through CREDIT in the future. Sincerely, Joshua Benadum, CREDIT Intern, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.en:
Nataliya S. is married with two teenage sons. She lives in Pavlograd with her family. Nataliya was laid off from her previous job and had to find a stable source of income to provide for her family. That is how she ended up as an entrepreneur. Presently, Nataliya sells children’s clothing in the central city market. Her kiosk offers a large variety of clothing items at a reasonable price. Nataliya has repaid all of her previous loans from Nadiya Ukraine without any delinquencies. Financial assistance helped her purchase a new vending kiosk in a favorable location in January 2007.

Nataliya has been in this trade for 5 years. Currently, she has 150 items for sale in her kiosk. Her monthly net profit is about $600. Nataliya is requesting a loan of $1200 to purchase some inventory wholesale and increase her turnover capital. Her long-term plan is to open one more vending facility. Moreover, Nataliya is hoping to use generated profit to help her daughter get a good education in a technical school. We believe her enthusiasm, motivation and desire to improve her living standards will guarantee prompt loan repayment.

loans.use: to purchase 70 items of children’s clothing

loans.name: Nina

texts.en:
Nina is a widow with two children. They live in Mukachevo, western Ukraine. Nina runs a small vending kiosk selling clothing at the local bus station. She works in a sphere of trade where the demand is always very consistent and high. Nina has been in this business for 15 years. She has always been an active and enthusiastic entrepreneur.

Nina presently has about $1,500 in turnover capital. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to increase her available capital. She believes the profits she will be able to generate will not only help her keep a stable position in the market but will also offer a better livelihood for her children and grandkids. Nina has been a role model of discipline, accuracy and responsibility. Difficult family circumstances and ill-health have not hindered consistent growth in her business. We believe her perseverant work and natural liveliness will help her continue to succeed in her trade and repay this loan on time.

loans.use: To increase her turnover capital

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en:
Mr. Ramiz is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 58, married with four children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Ramiz and his whife (she is pictured) run a family business together.  Ramiz sells milk in the town of Saatli while his wife takes care of their three cows.  The income from their herd is too low to support the family, and that is why Ramiz applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher.  This amount of loan is not enough to purchase a pedigree milk cow because in the Caucasus region the price of a good cow is about $800-1000, but Ramiz has some money of his own to add.

loans.use: To buy a pedigree cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Nov

texts.en: Mrs. Nov S. (26) lives in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia with her husband and 2 children. Her husband works as a middleman buying winged yam from people's plantations and selling them at the market. He earns $5 a day from this. Nov S. herself owns a grocery store which she would now like to expand. In particular she would like to purchase more grocery products so that she can sell a greater selection and quantity in order to more effectively meet customer demand.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery products for her inventory

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Nov Sinan has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Rooslana

texts.en:
Rooslana is divorced with one child. She lives in Mukachevo and sells clothing and footwear in the market next to the local bus station. Rooslana started this business because she had to find ways to provide for her family. She has been in business now for 5 years. Currently, her monthly income is about $1200. The success of her business can be attributed to her integrity and outstanding managerial skills.

Rooslana would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase the assortment of inventory in her kiosk. She believes that more merchandise will help her meet the demand of her customers. We think that her desire to persist with her venture and promote its expansion will ensure prompt repayment of this current loan.

loans.use: To increase the assortment of inventory

loans.name: Ragibe

texts.en:
The lady featured in the photo is A. Ragibe.  She is 30 years old and the mother of three children.  She is from the Sumgayit region and currently lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.  She started her business in 2002 when she purchased a small variety of fruits and vegetables.  

With this business she earns little money.  This money is enough for only some of her family's basic needs, and she has difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school, etc.
 
In 2005, Ragibe borrowed $400 to expand her business and add to her monthly salary.  With this loan she increased her supply of fruits and vegetables and improved the livelihood of her family.   

Now, she needs a $700 loan.  She wants to lease a selling place in the market.  She believes this will improve her business and, as a result, considerably increase her income.  She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To lease a selling place in the market

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Yean

texts.en:
Mr. Yean Loeuv (40) is a widower who lives with his elderly mother in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. He earns $1.30 a day selling crayfish at the market.

He has applied for this loan in order to purchase a trailer to help him transport his crayfish to the market.

loans.use: Purchase a trailer to transport fish to market

loans.name: Sal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sal M. (29) lives in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband. She works as a farmer on the land. Her husband buys bananas from local farmers, which he then sells to markets across town. He earns $5 a day.

She requests a loan to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.use: Purchase bananas

loans.name: Keng

texts.en:
Mrs. Keng N. is a 35-year-old mother, who lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She sells traditional Khmer cake, fish, and fermented fish at a busy market, where she earns up to $7.30/day in revenue. Her husband works at a factory, and earns around $2 each day.

Mrs. N. hopes to use this loan to purchase fish, fermented fish, and dry fish to expand her inventory. The remainder of the money she and her husband will use to buy cows to raise and sell for an additional profit.

loans.use: Purchase fish, fermented fish, and dry fish to sell at the market

loans.name: Nizami

texts.en:
Mr. Nizami is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 52, married with two children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Nizami has run his business since early childhood when he helped his father to graze the family herd.  After he married and lived separately, Nizami started his own business with two cows given to him as a gift by his father.  Today his number of milk producing cows has risen to 12.  

Nizami sells 120 litres of milk daily in Saatli town, but he sees that he can provide more customers with milk.  To do this he has to increase the number of milk cows in his herd.  That’s why Nizami has applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more pure-bred cow to make his monthly income higher.  This amount isn't enough to cover all of his purchasing expenditures because the price of one calf in the Caucasus region is about $80-100 and Nizami plans to buy ten calves.  He has some money of his own to add to cover all his expenditures.

loans.use: To buy a pedigree cow

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Mol

texts.en:
Mrs. Mol T. is 45 years old and lives with her 52-year-old husband and 5 children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. They are both farmers, and earn $1 per day. Two of her children are construction workers, two work in a garment factory, and the last is a student.

The two construction workers earn $100 between them. She has applied for this loan for the two construction workers, who need new tools for their jobs.

loans.use: Purchase construction tools for two of her children

loans.name: So

texts.en:
Mrs. So P. is 24 years old and lives with her 27-year-old husband and their daughter in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Her husband is a tuk tuk driver, earning $3 a day.

So P. herself works raising pigs and ducks, and she also earns $3 a day. She has applied for this loan because she would now like to expand her business by buying more pigs. This will help her meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: to purchase additional pigs

payments.comment:
Thanks to the successful of her business that is why she can pay off the loan a head of time.
She would like to say thank deeply from her heart all lenders.

loans.name: Suon

texts.en:
Mrs. Suong K., 50, is a widow and lives with her single daughter in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. To supplement her household, K. works selling traditional Khmer cake and generally earns around $3.50 each day.

She intends to open a small grocery store for her daughter so that she will be able to help generate additional income. Mrs. Suong K. has recently applied for a loan to help her and her daughter to open and run the small grocery store.

loans.use: Open a grocery store to generate more income

loans.name: Eang Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Eang Sok N., 35, works in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband and four children. Her husband works as a construction worker, and earns $5 a day. Eang Sok N. has a grocery store, which brings the family an additional $1 a day.

She has applied for this loan so that she can expand her inventory to sell a greater quantity and range of products. This will help her meet her customers' demands.

loans.use: Purchase more grocery items to expand inventory

loans.name: Saum

texts.en:
Mrs. Saum D., 33, is married with two little children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling grocery products to the people in her community. Her husband operates a motor-taxi business. Together they earn around $8 each day.

Mrs. Sum D. wants to use this loan to expand her inventory by adding more grocery items to meet her growing number of customers. In the future, she wants to expand expand her business so she can provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: Expand her inventory of grocery items to meet growing customer demand

payments.comment: Congratulations to Saum Dany for repaying the Kiva loan early!

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreng S. is 36 years old, and lives with her 41-year-old husband and their two young children in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia. Sreng S. works growing vegetables on their own plot of land, and earns $0.50 a day. Her husband is a motor taxi driver and earns $3 a day. His motorcycle is very old and needs frequent and expensive repairs.

Mrs. Sreng S. would like to buy her husband a new motorbike so they no longer have to spend their very limited resources on repairing the old motorbike.

loans.use: Purchase a replacement motorbike for taxi service

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Mrs. Sok S. is 30 years old and lives with her 32-year-old husband and two children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Their children are both too young to attend school.

Sok S. and her husband own a grocery store, from which they earn $30 a day. Sok S. now wants to expand their store by buying extra products to sell in order to meet the increased demands of customers.

loans.use: Purchase more products to sell in grocery store

loans.name: Muazama

texts.en:
Muazama G. is a cheerful person, as you can see from this picture. She loves life and children very much. That is why she decided to choose this kind of business, selling toys. Her sales point is located in Chkalovsk, in Khujand. She has several shelves for her goods and two tables--that's it. She sells various toys such as dolls, cars, balls, and so on. She says that her business place is very crowded every day and she sells her goods in a short time.

The turnover of her working capital is good and she makes a good profit under the circumstances. She gets her toys from distributors from China. Her chief problem is the condition of her sales point especially in rainy and snowy weather. (It is upsetting to her and bad for business when her goods became dirty.)

The government of Chkalovsk plans to build shops in this market and Muazama hopes in future to be able to rent one for her business. For this purpose, she wants to increase her inventory of goods and save money for a future shop.

loans.use: increase her inventory so as to save to have her own shop

loans.name: Orifjon

texts.en:
Orifjon S. has been engaged in business since 1999. He is married and has 2 children. His wife is a housewife. His elderly parents also live with him, so he is the one who earns money for all the family needs.

Orifjon's business is selling men's shoes in Panjshanbe market in Khujand. He brings his goods from Istaravshan, Khujand. One batch of his goods consists of 60-70 pairs of shoes. He goes to purchase shoes one or two times a month. The turnover of his goods is good, but his business place is not large and he would like in future to rent another space near his place. For this purpose he wants to increase the number of shoes in his inventory and spend the profit he will make from increased sales for renting additional space. For the coming season he is going to purchase a batch of warm shoes. He needs a loan of US$ 1200.

loans.use: to develop his business by buying warm shoes to sell this winter

loans.name: Dunya

texts.en:
A. Dunya was born in Sumqayit city.  She is 34 years old and the mother of two children.  Currently, she lives with her family in Sumgayit city, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.  She started her business in 2002.  She sells creams, lotions, perfumes, shampoo, etc.
 
With this business she earns little money.  The money is enough for only some of her family's basic needs.  She has difficulty in covering other family consumption needs for medication, clothes, school etc.
 
Her best clients at the moment are young ladies who work at the offices.  She needs $800 to buy merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory and be able to offer her clients a larger variety and better quality.  She will be able to support her children’s studies and help with the family’s expenses with this income.  She will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: To buy merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Mr. Jalal is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 23 and lives with his people in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Jalal owns a herd of cows.  Every day he grazes the cows starting early in the morning while his mother sells milk in Saatli town.  He started this business as a child because milk selling is their family business.  The work is quite profitable, but takes a lot of time and effort.  There is a need to widen the cow-shed.  It is not so expensive, but Jalal has no money to provide for this project.  That is why he has applied to Normicro Saatli branch to get a $500 loan.  If he could make his cow-shed bigger, he could have more pedigree cows, and hence, a higher income.

loans.use: To widen his cow-shed and increase his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en:
Salomat H. is divorced and lives with her mother. Her mother is her business partner. They have been selling garments for 20 years. From childhood, Salomat helped her mother to sell garments. Gradually her mother helped Salomat to open her own business place. Thanks to loans from MicroInvest, she was able to purchase goods for her business place. Today her stall is one of the best-known stalls in Chkalovsk.

Salomat has a wide assortment of modern garments and her goods are attractive. She has many constant clients and is always ready to help them to choose garments according their personal style. (She has good experience in that.)

Now Salomat and her mother have rented an additional stall in Gafurov, Khujand. This is one of the clothing markets in Khujand. They need another loan to use for purchasing garments for their new stall.

loans.use: Purchasing garments for a new place of business

loans.name: Ragif

texts.en:
Mr. Ragif is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 25 and lives with his parents in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Every week Ragif sells bulls and cows in the local market and then uses the profit to buy calves.  He breeds them in his cow-shed and in half a year sells them in the market again.  Now he wants to make an investment into his business to increase the profit.  That is why Ragif has applied to Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy one more cow to make his monthly income higher.  In the Caucasus region the price of a calf is about $100, but in half a year, the price of a breeded bull goes up to $500.

loans.use: To purchase a calf to expand his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Noemí

texts.en: Noemi is a lively 22 year old woman.  She is living with her husband, a farmer, and their 4 children.  A year ago she started her business, a small grocery store, which allows her to earn a living and assist her husband in taking care of their children.  She wants to purchase assorted goods in order to diversify and enlarge her inventory.  In fact, until now, she sold basic foodstuff.  For that reason, she is requesting a US$125.00 loan that she’ll repay in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase more products to increase and diversify inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase young animals

loans.name: Maritza Pichardo

texts.en: Maritza, 45, runs a colmado (a typical Dominican grocery store) with her husband.  They have 8 children, and only the youngest (a boy of 19 years old), lives with them; the others are either with a partner or working in other townships.  None of her children have attended school, and Maritza herself had no formal education.  Her husband is jobless and helps her with the business.  Maritza wants to purchase larger quantities of goods like rice, oil, sugar, salt and so on, that can last for a long time.  This way, she won’t have to go to the capital every weekend to get the goods to sell.   For this reason, and also to set aside some money for her family’s needs, she is requesting a loan of US $375.00 that she’ll repay in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase more goods and put aside some money for family needs.

loans.name: Felicia De Paula

texts.en: Felicia is a 30 year old lady. She’s been married for years and has 4 children. Presently, her husband takes care of the whole family through a small business he owns where he sells a kind of Dominican meal cooked with bananas leaves not far from a public school. To be more helpful in the maintenance of the family she’d like to build her own business so she can provide her kids with what they need. Her plan is to have a grocery store where she’ll sell drinks, rice, sugar…well, a little bit of everything. She already has a fridge that she can use for the drinks and knows some specific places where she can buy the articles she needs for the store. She expects to borrow US$325.00, money that she will repay in 6 months.

loans.use: To start a colmado (grocery store)

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Mr. Vasif is a vulnerable, low income person.  He is 46, married with three children and lives in the village of Saatli town in the south-central flat area of the Azerbaijan Republic in the Caucasus region.

Vasif owns a herd of cattle.  Each morning he grazes his herd and then sells beef in the local market of Saatli town.  He uses some of his profit margin to buy calves to breed.  The income from the four cows he has is too low to support his family, and that is why Vasif decided to increase his number of cattle to increase his income and to provide for all the necessities of his family. 

For this purpose he has applied to the Norwegian Microcredit Saatli branch for a $500 loan to buy four calves.  In the Caucasus region the price of one calf is about $100.  In half a year Vasif can sell one breeded cow for $500.

loans.use: To purchase 4 calves to increase his business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Tomasina

texts.en:
Tomasina is 20 years old and is single. She’s living with her mother and four brothers and sisters in a modest rented house, in Yamasá. She finished secondary school three years ago and has been working in her mother’s business, a grocery store. At the same time, she has been working as a young entrepreneur, by running a small business of selling calico jewelry. This activity has helped her to save money towards university that will begin next January. Her business keeps growing and she presently has an established clientele. She gets the jewelry in Santo Domingo, the capital, and sells it in her township in such a way as to set asiD. money for studying at the university. In fact, Tomasina thinks that education is a gateway to wealth and well being, and she is committed to reaching that goal.

This entrepreneur has applied for a US$175.00 loan to buy more jewelry and sell a larger quantity of her supplies. This will help her increase her business net income, and therefore have money to start her marketing career.

loans.use: To boost her business so that she can increase her income to start a university career

loans.name: Elmin

texts.en:
Elmin M. is 26 years old.  He is single.  He was born in the Sumqayit region of Azerbaijan.  Sumqayit is situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan.  Currently, he lives in Sumgayit city with his family.  His father and mother live with him.  His parents are old and ill, therefore, he is the only breadwinner of his family.  

He is a cab driver.  He began his business 4 years ago.  Elmin is a good and experienced driver, but this job is very hard.  Elmin currently rents a car to be able to earn money for his family.  He has gathered some money to buy a car, but it is not enough, so he needs to borrow money.  

Elmin would like to receive a loan of $800 in order to buy a car, build a garage for his car and to buy necessary tools and equipment.  He will repay the loan within 12 months.  He hopes to eventually expand his business and improve the living conditions of his family.  He helps with the family’s expenses and with this income, Elmin will repay his loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To buy a car, build a garage for his car and buy necessary tools and equipment

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Ana

texts.es:
Mrs. Ana Maria (58) is a native of the city of Asunción, and for reasons of work she moved to the city of Encarnación. She is the single mother of one son (30) with whom she has lived in a rental in Barrio Catedral for more than ten years.

She worked for more than 15 years in Buenos Aires (Argentina) as an employee of a business. After much sacrifice, she decided to return to Paraguay with the idea of starting her own business.

At present she is the owner of two businesses located in the area around the bus terminal, one store that sells clothing (pants, t-shirts, shirts, etc.), where she works, and one business selling electronics (CD, DVD, radios, cameras, etc.) which is run by her son, who helps at every moment with the expenses of the home and the financial accounts.

The reason she is requesting this financing of $300 is to buy merchandise for the boutique, such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, skirts, etc.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La Sra. .Ana Maria (58), es oriunda de la ciudad de asunción y por motivos laborales se traslado a la ciudad de Encarnación. Es madre soltera de un hijo varón (30), con el cual vive en alquiler hace más de diez años en el Barrio Catedral.

La Señora trabajo más de 15 años en Buenos Aires (Argentina) como empleada de un negocio. Después de mucho sacrificio decidió volver a Paraguay con la idea de montar un local propio.

Actualmente es propietaria de dos locales ubicados en la zona de la terminal de Ómnibus, una tienda de venta de ropas (pantalones, remeras, camisas, etc.) que es atendida por ella y un negocio de venta de electrónica (CD, DVD, radios, cámaras fotográficas, etc.) del cual se encarga su hijo quien en todo momento ayuda con los gastos del hogar y las cuentas financieras.

El motivo por el cual solicita la financiación de $ 300 es para la compra de mercaderías para su boutique, como remeras, camisas, pantalones, faldas, etc.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as t-shirts, shirts, pants, skirts, etc.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
43-year-old Maria M. is married with four children. She sells dried fish, vegetables, rice and candies in the village of Kikurala in Northern Sierra Leone.

Maria has been in business for five years but due to lack of capital, she could not make enough profit to expand and diversify her business. Maria says it takes time to save a small amount of cash to build up enough for investment. With her previous loan, Maria was able to purchase six bags of rice from farmers. That increased her profit, and she used some of the profit to hire laborers to work in her farm.

Maria works together with her husband to develop the business. She is requesting a US$ 200 loan to purchase more rice and store it for the off-season.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing wholesale goods for the off season.

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Mrs. Comfort E. is a 58 year old woman, who has a chemist shop for the care of people in her community. She is married with seven (7) children, and lives in Benin City, Nigeria. She hopes to get the loan amount of $400 for business improvement, i.e., buying more drugs for sale. She has been in this business for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sale

loans.name: Kankoh

texts.en:
Kankoh S. is fifty-two years old and is a widow with five children. Although the children are grown up, Konkoh says her income is to help them to start good homes of their own. She sells vegetables and other items.

With her previous loan, Kankoh purchased one cow, paying the loan installments with income from her petty trading business. She is requesting a loan of US$ 175 to invest in her business. Her future plan is to raise cows and sheep.

loans.use: Purchase livestock to diversify her business

loans.name: Heliodora

texts.es:
Mrs. Heliodora (55) is married to Mr. Rodrigo (60), and they live in their own home. Their three grown children have already become independent from the family home.

The couple have owned a nice grocery store for more than 15 years, where they offer all kinds of necessities, such as sugar, noodles, bread, milk, etc. She and her husband both work there; since they don't have any other obligations, they are always in their store, offering good service to their customers. This personal and cordial attention from the owners makes the difference between them and their competition in the neighborhood.

The reason Ms. Heliodora is requesting this financing for $400, is because an opportunity has been presented for their business which they want to take advantage of. One of their suppliers has made them a good offer on canned goods and cleaning products. With those discounts, she will obtain a good profit and also will be able to satisfy her customers with the new products.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La Señora Heliodora (55) casada con el Sr. Rodrigo (60) viven en casa propia. Sus tres hijos mayores ya se han independizado del hogar familiar.

La pareja posee una linda despensa desde hace mas de 15 años, donde ofrecen todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad, como azúcar, fideos, panificados, leche, etc. y la cual es atendida por ella y su marido; como no tienen otras obligaciones, están todo el tiempo en su negocio, ofreciendo buena atención a sus clientes. Esta atención personalizada y cordial de los dueños, hace la diferencia con sus otras competencias en el barrio.

El motivo por la cual doña Eliodora nos solicita esta financiación de $ 400, es porque se le presento una posibilidad de negocio que quiere aprovechar, uno de sus proveedores le ha hecho una buena oferta en productos enlatados y artículos de limpieza, con dichos descuentos ella obtendrá una buena ganancia y también va poder satisfacer a sus clientelas con los artículos nuevos que desea adquirir.

loans.use: to buy canned goods and cleaning products wholesale

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: "I started this business 3 years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to safeguard my capital to ensure continuity in business." All these are words of Mrs. Patience O., who is 49 years old and a married mother of four (4) children. She is requesting $400 to expand her business and also buy more wood for sale.

loans.use: To buy more firewood for sale

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en:
Ahmed K. is a twenty-four year old high school student. At the age of fourteen, he lost his father. It was then that Ahmed started petty trading to earn additional income to supplement his mother’s earnings. Ahmed raised his small working capital doing work as a casual laborer.

With his previous loan, Ahmed increased his stock and his profit. He is engaging in petty trade before attending school in the afternoons. He is determined to complete his education for a better future.

Ahmed now helps his two sisters with school expenses after the death of his mother two years ago. He is requesting a US$ 175 loan to purchase a small generator to provide mobile phone battery charge services to the community.

loans.use: Purchase a generator to start up a business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is married with four children and runs a micro-business out of her home. She sells vegetables, peppers, sesame and palm oil, flour and rice in the village of Yogomaia in the Koinadugu district of Sierra Leone. Her husband’s income is insufficient for the family expenses.

Rebecca plans to expand the business and increase her income and also hopes to build a small shelter where she can run her expanding business. For these reasons, Rebecca is requesting a second loan from SMT of US$ 200.

loans.use: Increase her business inventory to generate more income

loans.name: José

texts.es:
Mr. José P. (59) is married to Miriam (48), and they have lived in a rental house for more than 10 years with their two grown daughters. One of them has a snack bar near the regional hospital; the other is a student at the university and works in the city of Encarnación.

He is a shoemaker by profession, owner of a shoe store located 50 meters from the bus terminal for over 30 years. His wife used to work providing catering service, which she quit in order to help her husband in the shoe store so that they could fill all the orders from customers and have a better income.

Mr. José's dream is that his younger daughter complete her studies in the university, so that in the future she can be a professional and obtain better opportunities in life. She is the only one among her siblings who has had the opportunity to attend the university.

He is requesting this loan of $300 for the purchase of materials for making shoes, such as glue, shoemakers' thread, leather, etc. In this way he will be able to fill all the orders without any inconveniences.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

EL Señor José P. (59) casado con Miriam (48), viven en alquiler hace mas de 10 años con sus dos hijas mayores de edad. Una de ellas posee un copetín cerca del hospital regional; la otra, es estudiante universitaria y trabaja en la Municipalidad de Encarnación.

El señor es de profesión zapatero, propietario de una zapatería ubicado a 50 mts de la terminal de ómnibus hace más de 30 años. Su Señora trabajaba realizando servicios de viandas (catering) la cual tuvo que dejar para poder ayudar a su marido en la zapatería para así concretar todos los pedidos de los clientes y poder tener mejor ingreso.

El sueño del Sr. José es que su hija menor culmine sus estudios universitarios para que en el futuro pueda ser una profesional y obtener mejores oportunidades en la vida, ya que es la única que tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar entre sus hermanos.

El cliente esta solicitando este crédito de $ 300, para la compra de materia prima para la zapatería, como ser pegamentos, hilo de zapatero cueros etc. y así poder realizar todos los pedidos sin ningún inconveniente.

loans.use: to buy materials for making shoes, such as glue, shoemakers' thread, leather, etc.

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en: Muhamed J. is forty-five years old and has a wife and four children.  He buys sheep, fattens them, and then sells them at a higher price after three months.  With his previous loans he managed to increase the number of sheep by four.  He says his plan is to increase the number of sheep for a better profit and to purchase cows for the family one at a time. He is requesting $175 to purchase three lambs and one calf.

loans.use: Purchase additional livestock for fattening

loans.name: Christy

texts.en: Mrs. Christy O. is a 37 year old woman who sells female wraps & shoes to people. She is married with two (2) children. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the loan amount $800 to expand her business. She has been in this business since 2002 and has been a LAPO leader for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more female wraps & shoes

loans.name: Alfa

texts.en:
Alfa S. J. is married and has seven children. Like the majority of the Fulah tribesmen in the Koinadugu district, he is engaged in the buying and selling of sheep. With his previous loan, he purchased three sheep and one calf. He paid his loan installments with the income from petty trading that is being managed by his wife.

He is now requesting a loan of US$ 175 to purchase two more calves. Alfa said, with a lump sum of cash from SMT, he will be able to increase the number of cows in the shortest time.

loans.use: Purchase additional livestock for rearing

loans.name: Magno

texts.es:
Mr. Magno (37) is married to Sonia (28), and they have four children, three of whom are school-age and go to a public school. They have lived in the home of a relative for eight years, ever since they have been married.

Mr. Magno, is a native of the town of Mayor Otaño, 180 km from the city of Encarnación, where he moved 12 years ago in search of better work opportunities. He started out as an employee at a supermarket.

His wife, for the past 6 years, has had a grocery store, which she runs efficiently. Thanks to a little bit of capital they had, three years ago he decided to change jobs and he opened, in the same location as the grocery store, a business selling corn, which is going quite well.

The couple's project is to first consolidate their micro-enterprises, then start investing the earnings in a house of their own, a dream which the whole family yearns for.

Magno is soliciting financing of $300 for the purchase of corn on sale, an offer which he just received. Buying in large quantity and at this price makes it possible for him to compete better in the his market.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

El Señor Magno (37), está casado con Sonia (28), y tienen cuatro hijos, de los cuales tres están en edad escolar y van a una escuela pública. Viven en la casa de un pariente desde hace ocho años, tiempo en que están casados.

El Señor Magno, oriundo de la colonia Mayor Otaño, distante a 180 Km. de la ciudad de Encarnación, a la cual se había mudado hace 12 años en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo. Empezando así como empleado de un Supermercado.

Su esposa, desde hace 6 años posee una despensa, el cual administra eficientemente. Gracias a un pequeño capital que poseía, hace tres años decidió cambiar de trabajo y abrió en el mismo local de la despensa, un negocio de ventas de maíz, el cual le esta yendo bastante bien.

El proyecto de la pareja es consolidar primero sus microempresas, para luego empezar a invertir las ganancias en una casa propia, sueño que anhela toda la familia.

Magno nos solicita la financiación de $ 300 para la compra de maíz en oferta que esta recibiendo en estos momentos. La compra en cantidad y al contado de estos productos hace que pueda competir mejor en el mercado en la que trabaja.

loans.use: to buy corn on sale and in bulk

loans.name: Manteheh

texts.en:
Manteneh is fifty years old and married with five children. Her husband is ill and unable to work, so Manteneh is the sole provider for the family. Her previous loan enabled her to purchase supplies wholesale because of which she made a good profit. She said she used part of the profit to purchase corrugated iron for building a restaurant shelter and used some for the children’s school fees.

Manteneh sells mainly cooked rice with beans, cooked cassava leaves and fish outside her home in Yogomaia, in the outskirts of Kabala Town of Sierra Leone. She is requesting $200 to increase her little restaurant's offerings and cope with the increased demand after the month of fasting when schools re-open.

loans.use: Increase her supplies for her restaurant business so that she can meet demand

loans.name: Nilda

texts.es:
Mrs. Nilda (32) lives with her husband Mr. Carlos (35) and their two children, one age 6 and the other age 4. They have lived in their own home for over 6 years in the San Miguel neighborhood, in which they also have a store. Nilda is the owner of a business selling clothing for ladies and gentlemen.

The income which their micro-enterprise generates gives them the possibility to pay all the expenses which their nuclear family generates. The type of work they have involves many sacrifices, since it is a field in which one must travel constantly to other cities and even other countries to satisfy the orders from clients.

With the income they generate selling merchandise and thanks to the fact that they have all the conveniences, the lady has decided to open a beauty salon, which is her profession, taking advantage of the fact that in the area there is no similar business.

The couple is requesting this loan of $600 with the aim of investing in merchandise to supply the shop, which will help them provide greater satisfaction for their customers.

(Translated from the Spanish by Naomi Johnson, Kiva volunteer)

La señora Nilda (32), vive con su marido el Sr. Carlos (35) y sus dos hijos, una de 6 años y otra de 4 años. Viven en su casa propia hace mas de 6 años en la zona de San Miguel, en la cual poseen un deposito de mercaderías. Nilda es dueña de un negocio de venta de ropas para damas y caballeros.

El ingreso que generan en su microempresa les da la posibilidad de poder solventar todos los gastos que se generan en el núcleo de la familia. El tipo de trabajo que ellos poseen es muy sacrificado ya que es un rubro en el cual hay que viajar en forma constante a otras ciudades e incluso países para satisfacer los pedidos de su clientela que ya la tienen formada.

Con el ingreso que se genera en la venta de las mercaderías y gracias a que cuenta con todas las comodidades, la señora decide abrir una peluquería, la cual es su profesión, aprovechando así que en la zona no existe otro negocio similar.

La pareja solicita el préstamo de $ 600 con el fin de invertir en la compra de mercaderías para llenar el depósito, la cual ayudara a la mayor satisfacción de sus clientes.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as pants, t-shirts, socks, underwear, tank tops, etc.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Mrs. Edith U. a 51 year old woman, from a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells charcoal to people in her area, and she is a married mother of two (2) children. She needs the loan $800 to buy more charcoal and expand her business. She has been with LAPO for 4 years and has been in this business for 8 years.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for sale

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Mariama J. is forty-nine years old and married with six children. She has been in business for the last ten years but her business was small before her previous loans. She is engaged in selling roasted peanuts. She also buys large quantities of palm oil and exports it to traders from the Republic of Guinea.

With her previous loans Mariama expanded her business and profit. She said she purchased three sheep 18 months ago with her first loan and her flock has increased to ten sheep which she keeps in the village with her relatives. She is requesting $200 to purchase forty gallons of palm oil and four bags of peanuts to increase her stock. Her hope is to help her husband to pay school fees for the children and to develop her sheep farm little by little.

loans.use: Purchase large quantities of palm oil and peanuts for distribution

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Mrs. Jennifer L. a 36 year old woman living in a semi-rural area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells first class fairly used clothes for a living, and is married with two (2) children. She needs the sum of $550 to purchase shoes, clothes & bags. She has been in this business since 2003. She has been with LAPO for 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, bags & shoes for sale

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Fatmata restarted her business six years ago. Married with six children, her income supplements her husband’s earnings from the selling of sheep. Before her previous loans, Fatmata used to buy fifty gallons of palm oil that would take her two weeks to mobilize from individual producers in various villages in the Koinadugu District of Sierra Leone. She would then supply the oil to the market women, and this would take another week to sell before she could again go to purchase more.

With previous loans, Fatmata increased her purchases to one hundred and fifty gallons and there is now a constant flow of supply to the market women. She makes a profit of $75 a week. Recently, she got customers from Liberia and for this reason, she is requesting a loan of $200 to increase her supply by an additional sixty gallons to meet her customers' demand and increase profits.

loans.use: Increase wholesale purchase of palm oil for distribution

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: "I changed to this business four (4) years ago and I have no cause to regret it. My numerous customers always give me satisfaction," says Mrs. Patience O.. She is a divorced with 3 children, and is 45 years old. She needs the loan amount $400 to expand her business and buy more pepper soup items. She has been with LAPO for the past 4 years.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
Mohamed S. is a barber in Kabala Town of Sierra Leone. At thirty years old, he is married with two children. In addition to being a barber in his own shop, Mohamed employs three female hairdressers and sells wigs and extensions for female clients.

With his previous loans Mohamed was able to increase his profit, purchasing more wigs, extensions, and cosmetics. His business has created employment for five youths. Mohamed is requesting a loan of $275 to buy more supplies to further increase his profit.

loans.use: Purchase additional salon cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Ferembe

texts.en:
Ferembe is a widowed mother of six. Now thirty-seven years old, she started her business two years ago. With the death of her husband, she is left with the responsibility of bringing up the children and providing for their education.

Ferembe runs a grocery shop in the open market in Kabala Town of Sierra Leone. With her previous loan, Jerembe managed to get her children back in school after they were dismissed for not meeting school fees. She says a loan of US$ 275 will enable her to diversify her business. She would like to use the funds for purchasing rice and beans from farmers to store them for selling in the off-season when her profit margin will be higher.

loans.use: Purchase excess rice and beans for storage until the off-season when profit margins are higher

loans.name: Edna

texts.en: Mrs. Edna I. is a 53 year old divorced woman with (8) children, and she acquired the formal knowledge of this business from her mother. She resides at Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. The amount she has requested is $175 to improve her business which she started in 2002. She has been with LAPO for 2 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions & food items for sale

loans.name: Muhamed

texts.en:
Forty-eight-year-old Muhamed K. is a baker. He learned the skill from his late father. Married with six children, Muhamed started his business very small. He used to buy half a bag of flour from a friend's shop on credit and produced one hundred small loaves of bread daily. Thanks to a previous loan from SMT, Muhamed can now purchase three bags of wheat flour at once and use one and half bags daily to produce three hundred loaves of bread. He purchased a piece of land and corrugated iron for roofing with the profits.

Muhamed also employs ten part-time bakers for making the dough, using local handmade machines. This has created employment for some idle youth.

Muhamed’s dream is to build his own bakery and increase his productivity to five hundred loaves of bread daily. He is currently renting the bakery, which is old and small and in a very inconvenient location. He also hopes to extend his market to various nearby villages. For these reasons, he is asking for $1050 to boost his micro-business.

loans.use: Build his own bakery to increase production and marketing

loans.name: Mabinty

texts.en:
Mabinty B. is a mother of two children. Thirty years old, she is engaged in selling rice. Although she started her business two years ago, she could not earn much at first due to the lack of sufficient capital.

With her previous loan Mabinty was able to make a profit that enabled her to pay her children’s school fees and buy other school requirements. She is now requesting a loan of $200 to further expand her business.

loans.use: Increase her supply of rice for resale

loans.name: Perla

texts.es:
Perla (age 37) is maried to Leonardo (age 38), and they have two children, Maria (age 15) and José (age 8) who study in the neighborhood schools. Thanks to both parents having their own microbusinesses, they can offer their children a life without worrying about basic necessities. They own a humble yet beautiful home, where Perla has her business, and her husband is a mototaxi driver. 5 years ago, Perla asked her husband to use a part of their home, that until then was used as the living room, to put in a small business and in this way help with the family income. In this store she sells basic, needed products such as sugar, noodles, and also candy, soda pop and fast food. Her customer service and administration of this new microbusiness made her business grow every day, to the point of having to expand her storefront. While she and her daughter are in chage of the business located in their home, Leonardo, with his motorbike, works as a mototaxi driver within the city and towards Posadas (Argentina). The couple asks for $1000 to invest in finishing the expansion of the store facility in order to be able to offer better service to their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva volunteer.

La Sra. Perla (37), casada con el Sr. Leonardo (38), tienen dos hijos menores, Maria de 15 años y José de 8 años, quienes estudian en instituciones educativas nacionales del barrio. Gracias a que ambos esposos tienen sus propias microempresas, pueden ofrecerles a sus hijos una vida sin mayores necesidades económicas. Poseen una humilde, pero hermosa casa propia, en donde Perla tiene su autoservice, mientras que su marido se dedica al mototaxi. Hace 5 años, Perla le pidió a su marido utilizar una de las piezas de su domicilio particular, que hasta ese momento era utilizada como sala, para poner un pequeño negocio y así ayudar con el ingreso familiar. En la misma vende productos de primera necesidad como azúcar, fideos, asi como también golosinas, gaseosas y comidas rápidas. La buena atención y administración de la nueva microempresaria hizo que su negocio vaya creciendo cada día más, hasta el punto que está ampliando la infraestructura de su local. Mientras ella y su hija se encargan del negocio de la casa, don Leonardo, en su moto realiza servicios de taxi (mototaxi) dentro de la ciudad y hacia Posadas (Argentina). La pareja nos solicita la financiación de $ 1 000, para invertir en la terminación del local ampliado, para así poder ofrecer mejor atención a sus clientes

loans.use: Expansion of store facility and infrastructure

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mrs. Mary O. is a 31 year old woman with two (2) children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She sells garri & yam to the public and she has been in this business since 2002. She needs the loan amount of $175 for the purchase of garri and yam for sales. She has been a LAPO member for 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more garri & yam to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en: Moses started his business of selling children’s clothes in 2003 after the civil war.  He started by selling second-hand clothes but with his previous loans he was able to change over to imported clothes from China.  Those loans enabled him to increase his stock and he is now requesting a  loan of US$ 200 to purchase women's clothes.  Moses is a thirty-year-old father of two children. He says his customers have been requesting him to include adult clothes and he would like to take the opportunity to do so.

loans.use: Diversify the clothing he sells so that he can better satisfy his customers' demand

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Kadiatu is engaged in selling plastic sandals wholesale. She started her business four years ago by buying the goods she sold on credit from a merchant. Most of her customers are poor retailers from the surrounding villages and Makeni Town. This purchasing on credit did not give Kadiatu much profit as she had to re-pay her loan on a daily basis.

Using her previous loan from SMT, Kadiatu was able to build up her own business capital. She is planning to be the sole wholesaler of plastic sandals in Makeni and capture retail customers from nearby districts and villages. She is therefore requesting a loan of US$ 1050 to purchase goods directly from The Republic of Guinea.

loans.use: Purchasing shoes wholesale from a cheaper supplier

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Fatmata K. is forty-two years old and married with four children. She is engaged in selling rice in the open-air market of Makeni, in Sierra Leone. Like many other Sierra Leonean women, she re-started her business after the civil war at a micro level.

With her previous loan, Fatmata was able to purchase six bags of rice at one time and increase her profit and decrease time spent on traveling to and from Freetown to purchase the commodity.

Fatmata's priority is to save money for her children’s future education while her husband covers other family expenses. She is requesting a loan of $200 to increase her supplies for resale.

loans.use: Increase supply of rice for resale

loans.name: Pa Dura

texts.en: Pa Dura S. is engaged in the buying and selling of chickens in the town market of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  At fifty years of age, Pa Dura has been running his business for the last eight years.  Pa Dura said that although his previous loan enabled him to increase his stock, his business could not expand because the profit went to paying school fees for his eight children and for repayment of his loan.  He hopes to be accorded another loan of US$ 200 to purchase fifty chickens. He thinks this time his profit will be invested back into the business, as he has completed paying his children’s school fees for the semester.

loans.use: Buying and selling of chickens for profit

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en: Fatmata is thirty-four years old and has been doing the same business for seven years.   Married with two children, she spends most of her income on school requirements and other household expenses.  With her previous loans she was able to purchase materials for her business wholesale.  She is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to increase her stock and diversify her business.  She also conducts her business in the open-air market of Makeni and would like, in the long run, to put a shelter up for the business.

loans.use: Increase African prints and handicrafts for sale.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy E. is a 30 year old woman who sells food items, drinks, and provisions to people. She is married and the mother of two children and lives in Benin City in the Edo state of Nigeria. She is proud of her business and promises to effectively use the loan amount of $400 to buy food items, drinks, and provisions.

loans.use: To buy more food items, drinks, & provisions for sales

loans.name: Amadu

texts.en: Amadu started his small hardware business three years ago.  With his previous loans, he was able to increase his turnover by including padlocks, ropes and nails.  Amadu is fifty years old and married with five children.  He has had to spend all his profits on the children’s school fees and this has reduced the capacity of the business.  He needs a loan of $200 to increase his stock and thus his profit.

loans.use: expand his inventory for his hardware store

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Mrs. Roseline O. sells drinks in the semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned the trade for six months after which she started her business in 1996. According to her, if the loan amount of $325 is given to her, she will be able to expand her business (i.e. buy more drinks).  She is 40 years old and married with five children.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks for sale

loans.name: Ajugba

texts.en: Mrs. P. Ajugba, who specializes in the sale of ice cream, started her business in 1996. She is 44 years old, a married mother of five children, and lives in semi-rural area in Benin City, Edo State of Nigeria. She has been with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) as a secretary of her union. She seeks a loan for $800 to boost her business.

loans.use: To buy an additional freezer for ice cream

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo is originally from Iquitos, but has lived in Pucallpa for a few years. She sells baked bread and plantain. With her husbands help and thanks to the good business they have been doing, they have been able to put their kids through school easily.

The competition hasn't been long in coming though, and their neighbours have started selling the same products. In order to keep their business going, Amparo's family came up with the innovative idea of selling butter with the bread so that everyone can enjoy it. This initiative has gone very well, and means that they have not been affected by the competition.

It is for this reason that they would like a loan of $300, which they will repay in 6 months. They will use it to buy more bread, butter, plantain and a window in order to display all of the bread alongside the delicious butter.

Let's make this initiative work to make more for Amparo's family. they all thank you for your great help.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Amparo es natural de la ciudad de Iquitos, radica en Pucallpa desde hace varios años y se dedica a la venta de panes elaborados artesanalmente y de plátanos al por menor; con el apoyo de su esposo, gracias a su desempeño en esta actividad comercial han logrado que sus hijos en edad escolar puedan estudiar cómodamente. La competencia debido a la acogida de este negocio no se ha hecho esperar y sus vecinos ahora también se dedican a esta labor; como es de suponer la familia de Amparo ha ideado una forma aún más novedosa de ofrecerlos y ahora les unta mantequilla para que se convierta en un bocadillo agradable al paladar de sus asiduos clientes, la idea fue bien acogida y gracias a esta iniciativa no se han visto tan afectados con la oferta vecina. Por esta razón requieren un capital de trabajo de 300 dólares financiado en un plazo de seis meses, para que puedan comprar más panes, mantequilla, plátanos y una vitrina que le servirá para mostrar los panes untados con la deliciosa mantequilla. Hagamos que esta iniciativa siga generando ingresos a la familia de Amparo, ella y su familia agradecen tu noble colaboración.

loans.use: To inrease sales by buying boxes of butter and a window to display bread/Incrementará las ventas en su negocio comprando mantequilla en cajas y una vitrina para la exhibición de panes.

loans.name: Itohan

texts.en: Mrs. Mercy Ebeye is a young dynamic woman who is 45 years of age. She is married with four children, lives in the semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo, State of Nigeria and started her business in the year 2002. She sells provisions, bread, and drinks to the people living in her community. She hopes to get the loan of US $550 to enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions, bread, and drinks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Boost and Diversify Stock

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en: Mrs. Veronica O. is a hair dresser, she sells weavon, hair cream, and cold drinks in her shop. She is 50 years old, married mother of five children, and she is from a semi-urban area of Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She has been in this business since 2003 and has been with Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) for five years. She hopes to obtain the loan of US $625 to enable her to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, hair cream, and a freezer for cooling drinks

loans.name: Carmen Nora

texts.es:
Carmen is 49 years old and she sells much needed products from a small room in her house. She learnt and got to know this trade while she was in the capital working for her older siblings' company which sells these sorts of things. The support it has brought her husband and kids has been vital, and her kids have been able to go to university in their home town. She started this business from a small room and served people from the window. Little by little the business has grown and she now has lots of clients near where she lives. She now has a very organized room with display cabinets, and she would like a freezer now too so that she can sell ice creams, lollies and cold drinks. This means that she would be able to offer a better service to all her clients. In order to do this she needs a loan of $325 which she will repay in 6 months. She would use it to buy the freezer as Carmen's dream is to own a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carmen es una señora de 49 años; dedicada al comercio de artículos de primera necesidad en un pequeño espacio dentro de su casa, esta actividad la emprendió y conoció durante su permanencia en la ciudad capital de su país en compañía de sus hermanos mayores pues ellos se dedican hace ya varios años al comercio de abarrotes al por mayor en dicha ciudad.El apoyo incondicional para desarrollar esta actividad satisfactoriamente se la han brindado su esposo e hijos quienes gracias a los ingresos generados han podido acceder a estudiar en la universidad de su ciudad natal. Inició su negocio con una pequeña bodeguita atendiendo por una de las ventanas de su casa y poco a poco hasta la fecha ha ido creciendo por la cantidad de clientes que logró reunir en la zona donde vive.Actualmente cuenta con una bodega bien organizada, con vitrinas de exhibición, estantes y para complementar su negocio requiere adquirir una congeladora, artefacto que le permitirá tener bebidas heladas, hacer hielo y helados. Estos artículos ayudarán a que el negocio pueda ofrecerles más novedades a cada uno de sus clientes y para llevar a cabo este propósito requiere financiar el importe de 325 dólares en 6 meses para poder comprar la congeladora ya que la meta de Carmen es convertir a largo plazo su bodeguita en un Minimarket,

loans.use: To buy a freezer to sell frozen drinks to meet her clients' demands/ADQUIRIR UNA CONGELADORA PARA OFRECER BEBIDAS HELADAS ADEMÁS DE HELADOS PARA SATISFACCIÓN DE SUS ASIDUOS CLIENTES.

loans.name: Perpetual

texts.en: Mrs. Perpetual K. is 49 years old, married with six (6) children, and lives in semi-urban area in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She started her trade in the year 1987 after undergoing training from her mother. She is soliciting a loan of US $550 for business expansion. She has been in Lift Above Poverty Organization (LAPO) for seven years and she is proud of LAPO.

loans.use: To buy more drinks & VCD plates for sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Boost his Stock

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa is a 25 years old woman who is married with no children and lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. She learned her business for two years before she started her own business in the year 2003. She sells weavons, relaxers, drinks, and recharge cards. According to her, the loan of $250 will boost her business.

loans.use: To buy more weavon, relaxers, drinks, and recharge cards

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Mrs. Grace O., an LAPO client, sells drugs and treats patients. She lives with her husband and five children in Uromi of Edo State and has been an LAPO client for over two years. Grace hopes to receive a loan of US $475 so that she can buy more drugs for resale.

loans.use: To buy more drugs for sales

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia U. is 35 years old, married, a mother of (4) four children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State and specializes in sewing, designing clothes, and sells women wrappers. She has been a member of LAPO for two years. She hope to increase her business if the amount US $475 is given to her.

loans.use: To buy additional machine and materials

loans.name: Ben

texts.en: Ben Jet is 32 years old and lives in Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 32 years old and has been a LAPO client for a year now. He renders laundry services to the community where he lives and hopes to purchase more laundry equipment in order to increase his services if the amount US $550 is approved.

loans.use: To buy more laundry equipment

loans.name: Perin

texts.en: Perin A. is 52 years, married, and the mother of four children. She learned her trade for three years and started her own business in the year 2004. She sells wholesale drinks in her shop. This business is a source of income to the family. She says, "I hope to improve my business and the standard of the living of my family through the loan of US $800. I have been with LAPO for 2 years as a leader of my union."

loans.use: To buy more crates of drink for sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To Boost his Stock

loans.name: Justa Betty

texts.es:
Betty studied beauty a few years ago and before doing this she sold household items form a small room which she fitted out to become a beauty salon in the 1990s. This is her vocation so she decided to go ahead with the shop, even though it was very different from what she was doing before. She has 4 kids, one of them is at university and the others are at school. In order to meet household costs Betty relies on her husband who is a motorbike-taxi driver for a security firm.

She started her beauty salon in 1994 with only 2 mirrors and plastic chairs, but thanks to the hard work her and her family put in, it grew and became notable in the community and with her clients. She decided that she would not give up until she had a complete beauty salon. She now needs a loan of $500 which she will repay in 6 months so that she can enlarge her salon, buying tools so that she can work effectively, and beauty creams for deep down cleaning for her clients that need it.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Betty estudió cosmetología hace varios años y mucho antes de dedicarse a esta actividad trabajaba en la venta de abarrotes en el espacio que ahora acondicionó para su salón de belleza allá por lo años 90´, su vocación por esta actividad hizo que sin meditarlo una y otra vez se decidiera a dar un giro total a la labor que había estado desempañando en ese entonces.Ella es madre de 4 hijos, uno de ellos estudia en la universidad y los demás están en el colegio y para solventar los gastos de su hogar, Betty, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que presta servicios de mototaxi a su comunidad y su vez en una empresa de seguridad.Comenzó por el año 94 en forma precaria sus servicios en el salón de belleza, con tan sólo dos espejos y unas sillas de plástico, conforme el esfuerzo y empeño constante se manifestaban en la familia el negocio cobraba más notoriedad y dinamismo y fue creciendo paulatinamente llegando a ocupar un puesto muy especial en cada uno de sus clientes y ella manifiesta que su esfuerzo y dedicación no se detendrán hasta tener un centro de estética completo.Actualmente necesita un capital de 500 dólares financiados en 6 meses para ampliar su salón de belleza, comprar herramientas para desarrollar su trabajo eficazmente y cremas de belleza para una limpieza integral para las clientas que lo requieran.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to make her small shop one of the best stocked/La compra  de accesorios y productos de belleza harán de su humilde local uno de los más y mejores implementados.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
I have been sold food (like my delicious menuda and quesadillas) for 13 years. This restaurant has been my family's source of income and my two daughters work with me. I am asking for a loan of $1,200.00 to buy a temperature control system for my restaurant because the cold season is approaching and I want my customers to be more comfortable and be able to eat the food that I sell.

Translated from Spanish by Alexandra Jaffe, Kiva volunteer.

Tengo ya mas de 13 años dedicandome a la venta de comidas (como el delicioso menuda y quesadillas). Este negocio a sido la fuente de ingresos de mi familia, en este negocio trabajamos mis dos hijas y yo. Solicito un préstamo de $1,200.00 dlls para acondicionar el negocio ya que se viene la temporada de frió y quiero que mis clientes estén mas cómodos y puedan consumir los alimentos que vendo.

loans.use: To install temperature control in my restaurant

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius O. is 43 years old, and a married father of six children. He process and sells chicken to the public.  He has been in this line of business since 1998. He seeks a loan of US $1,175 for the growth of his business.

loans.use: To buy more chicken for sale

loans.name: Chief

texts.en: Chief E. is originally from Ubiaja, Edo State, Nigeria and has seven children. He has farmland where he plants and harvests pineapple for sales. E. learned how to farm pineapple from his father and years later bought his own land for the cultivation of pineapple and others fruits. He has been a LAPO member for over five years. He needs the loan amount of US $1,175 for expansion of his farmland.

loans.use: To expand his pineapple farm

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience E. is a farmer. She lives in Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria. She is 42 years, and the married mother of two children. She has been a LAPO leader for the past four years. To expand her business growing farm land, Patience is requesting a loan of US $800.

loans.use: To buy more seed for planting

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther I. is a farmer has farm land in which she plants and produces cassava, maize, and cocoyam. She is a married mother of eight children. She is a native of Ubiaja and has been in this business for over seven years. She has been a LAPO member for over four years. Esther is requesting a loan of US $625 and with that money, she intends to buy maize, cassava stems, and farm land.

loans.use: To buy more maize, cassava stem and farm land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Stock of Shoes

loans.name: Aluola

texts.en: A. is 45 years old and has three children. He has a farm land in his village were he cultivates yams and cassava for sale. He needs the loan US $400 to improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more yams and cassava stems for cultivation

loans.name: Sylvester

texts.en: Sylvester I. is 45 years, married, and has three children. He has been a farmer for the past 10 years. He plants and harvest crops for sale and consumption. He needs the loan US $625 to improve his farm land.

loans.use: To expand my farm land

loans.name: Okakah

texts.en: Okakah L. is 41 years old and has been a trader for nine years. He is married with four children and has a shop where he sells kitchen utensils to people in his area. He is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He needs the loan US $550 to buy more kitchen utensils for his business.

loans.use: To buy more kitchen utensils for sale

loans.name: Carolay

texts.es:
Carolay is a young mother of 26 years old, and she works with her husband selling wood from 6am. Her husband cuts and works the wood and she sells it. He has to travel to the highest point of the city to get the best wood, and it is for this reason that they decided to start a small workshop. They have 2 kids who are not yet at school and they would eventually like to buy their own piece of land to build a house and a larger workshop so that they could sell more. Right now they rent the space for the workshop, but they also need to buy tools to condition the wood in order to give it a better finish. It is for this reason that they would like a loan of $500 which they will pay back in 6 months so that they can buy tools. She trusts in us to be able to give their business the investment that it needs to have a good future and provide a good quality of life for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

Carolay es una joven madre de 26 años trabaja con su esposo, desde las 6 de la mañana en la venta de madera a sus clientes actividad comercial a la que se dedica en vista de que su esposo se dedica a la extracción de madera por lo que tiende a viajar diariamente a las alturas de su ciudad a fin de extraer la madera más fina para su comercialización por tal motivo ambos decidieron poner un almacen modesto que poco a poco esta creciendo.Son padres de dos niños que no están en edad escolar. y los planes de esta familia con el tiempo es poder contar con un terreno propio para poder construir su casa y poder contar con un local más grande para las ventas. Debido a que actualmente han alquilado un espacio para almacenar la madera y venderlos desde ahí. Necesitan comprar herramientas para acondicionar la madera y ofrecerlos en mejores presentaciones por tal motivo desean obtener como capital de trabajo el importe de 500 dólares financiados en 6 meses con el fin de poder cubrir el gasto que les ocasionará la compra de herramientas. Ella confiá en nuestra institución para poder hacer del negocio una inversión estable a futuro en bien de la calidad de vida de su familia.

loans.use: To buy tools to improve the presentation of the wood and the workshop area/La compra de herramientas para mejorar la presentación de la madera y la adecuación de un espacio especial  para el almacenamiento harán  que el negocio de Carolay se convierta en una fuente estable de ingresos familiar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy Additional Stock

loans.name: Emma Aurora

texts.es:
Mrs. Emma has been working since she was 8 years old in her neighborhood market because even at this young age, she saw that it was necessary to help earn a living for her family. Since she was very small, she learned how to organize her time so that she could balance her work and school at the same time. When she finished her basic studies, she continued on to higher studies. Nevertheless, she had to quit school because she did not have enough time to follow such a demanding educational path.

Because of this, she has worked very diligently so that she could give her children the chance to follow their dreams. Fruit sales was and continues to be a job that begins at 4 in the morning and consequently from her long working hours and dedication to her family, she separated from her husband and is now head of the household. Her children help their adored mother to maintain the family economy by finding time to work daily with her in her noble work.

After a while, she was able to acquire a location to sell her products from and to equip this space, she is asking for a loan of 325 dollars to purchase accessories to make her shop more comfortable and clean, so as to attract customers.

With our help, we can assure that the hard work of Emma continues to have success.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

La Señora Emma trabaja desde los 8 años de edad en un mercado de su localidad debido a que a su corta edad se vió en la necesidad de contribuir con los gastos familiares. Desde muy chica aprendió a organizar su tiempo para que pueda compartir sus actividades comerciales con las educativas; al concluir sus estudios básicos satisfactoriamente emprendió sus estudios superiores; sin embargo tuvo que abandonarlos debido a que el tiempo que le dedicaba no era suficiente para tan exigente carrera. Por esta razón ahora ella se ha propuesto trabajar muy diligentemente para que cada uno de sus hijos puedan hacer realidad sus anhelos. La venta de frutas fue y es un trabajo que desarrolla desde las 4 de la mañana y a consecuencia del trabajo duro y mucho dedicación a su familia se separó de su esposo y ahora se encarga de los gastos de su hogar con la ayuda de sus hijos, quienes se dan tiempo para poder colaborar con tan noble trabajo que desempeña diariamente su adorada madre.. Hace poco adquirió un espacio para la venta de sus productos y para poder acondicionar este lugar requiere un préstamo de 325 dólares con el deseo de comprar accesorios para que la tienda se convierta en un lugar cómodo y limpio a fin de complacer a su exigente clientela. .Hagamos que la fuerza y empeño de Emma prevalezcan por más tiempo con nuestra ayuda.
