That's why she decided to found her own business selling cosmetics. A little after, thanks to the savings she had been able to accumulate, she bought cleansing products and began selling them, getting very good results.

At this time, Maria needs a loan of $275 dollars that she will use in the purchase of merchandise to cover the demands of her clients so her business will continue to grow. She is offering to pay back the amount in four months. Choose to help Maria; she needs it, and thanks you for the support that you can bring her.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Trabajadora, entusiasta y optimista es como podemos describir a Maria Angélica, desde hace cinco años ella se separó de su esposo y no recibía ningún tipo de ayuda de su parte, por lo que ha tenido que esforzarse mucho para sacar adelante a su pequeño hijo, así fue como decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de cosméticos, poco después gracias a los ahorros que pudo acumular, compro productos de limpieza e inició su venta, obteniendo muy buenos resultados.

En este momento Maria necesita un préstamo de $ 275 dólares que empleará en la compra de mercancía para poder cubrir las demandas de sus clientes y continuar creciendo con su negocio, ella ofrece regresar esta cantidad en 4 meses. Decídete a ayudar a Maria, ella necesita y agradece mucho el apoyo que puedas brindarle.

loans.use: Purchase of cosmetics and toiletries

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo is a hard-working married man. He went to Monterrey in search of work, but when he was unable to find work, he decided to found his own business. As he was familiar with sowing and planting, he chose to grow seeds to sell, and with that he began his own business. His wife now assists him with the sale of his products. Besides this small business, he could never place another due to a lack of financial resources. He now has spent 20 years with this business that has allowed him to live with dignity, but he want to grow his business and sell a broader range of seeds to earn more income and continue improving his quality of life.

Pablo is requesting a loan of $650 to supply more products, such as peanuts and other types of seeds that will allow him to increase his sales and broaden his market. He is offering to pay the loan off in six months. He and his wife thank you very much for the support that you grant them to make their business grow.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Pablo es un hombre casado muy trabajador, él fue a Monterrey en búsqueda de trabajo pero no lo consiguió así que se decidió por emprender su propio negocio y como conocía lo que es la siembra, optó por sembrar semillitas para vender y fue así como inició con su negocio, su esposa ahora le ayuda a la venta de sus productos, aparte de conocer este pequeño negocio tampoco pudo poner ningún otro por falta de recursos económicos, ya lleva 20 años con su negocio y le ha permitido vivir dignamente, pero el quiere crecer con su negocio y también vender diversos tipos de semillas para poder obtener mejores ingresos y continuar mejorando en su calidad de vida.

Pablo esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $650 para surtirse de mas cosas como cacahuates y otros tipos de semillas que le ayudaran a incrementar sus ventas y ampliar su mercado, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, el y su esposa te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para poder hacer crecer su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of seeds and stock

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manual is married. His wife is a homemaker, and they have no children. He began selling hardware in a company; When it was sold, he began his own business with the money from the deal. It has grown a lttle at a time and now he wishes to expand his hardware selection to include refurbished parts, which are often requested. He wants to progress with his business to create a better quality of life for him and his wife. Manuel is a hard-working, enterprising man, and he has a vision for how to grow now that he hears what his customers want.

So he is requesting a loan for US $925 to purchase refurbished merchandise and better hardware supplies for his base business. He is offering to pay the loan in six months. He and his family thank you for the support that you grant to continue growing his business.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Manuel está casado y su esposa se dedica a su hogar, no tienen hijos, y él empezó vendiendo artículos de ferretería en un negocio y cuando lo liquidaron fue cuando inició su propio negocio con el dinero de su liquidación, ahora el ha ido creciendo poco a poco y desea ampliar sus artículos de ferretería a también vender refacciones que le son muy solicitadas, y desea progresar con su negocio para tener una mejor calidad de vida para él y su esposa. Manuel es un hombre trabajador y emprendedor, y tiene la visión de cómo crecer ya que escucha lo que sus clientes le solicitan.

Por ello, él esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 925 para comprar mercadería nueva en refacciones y mayores artículos de ferretería que es su fuerte, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Él y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le brindas para seguir creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of hardware merchandise

loans.name: Rita

texts.es:
Rita is a widow with three three children. When she became a widow, she found herself needing to bring up her children and keep her household, which is why she began her sewing business. She now has eighteen years of experience with the business; her first clients were her family and neighbors from her area, but then thanks to her fine sewing, she was recommended by friends to various clients, and she now sews school uniforms and elaborate dresses, as well as mending and repairing clothing. With her business, she has been able to help her children get ahead, and she wishes to continue with the business.

Rita is asking for a US $250 loan to buy quality material for her business, such as cloth, thread, and the upkeep of her sewing machine to make her products, and she is offering to pay off the loan in three months. She and her family thank you for the support that you give her to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

Rita es una mujer viuda y tiene tres hijos, al quedar viuda se vio en la necesidad de sacar adelante a sus hijos y mantener su hogar, por ello es que empezó con su negocio de costura, ella ya tiene 18 años con el negocio y sus primeros clientes fueron su familiares y vecinos de su colonia y luego por su buena costura la fueron recomendando con sus amistades y así se fue haciendo de varios clientes, cosiendo también en escuelas y vestidos laboriosos, además de composturas y arreglos, con su negocio a podido sacar adelante a sus hijos y desea continuar con su negocio.

Rita esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 250 para comprar materia prima para su negocio como telas, hilos y mantenimiento de la maquina de coser que tiene para elaborar sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Maria De Jesús

texts.es:
Maria cohabitates with her partner and her six children, of whom only one helps in the business. When she and her husband separated, she was left with all the expenses of keeping house and raising her children, and the payment sent by her husband was not enough to cover these expenses. That was when she found a type of powdered milk and noted that she could sell it to her acquaintances. She discovered with the milk thanks to a friend who invited her to try it, and as it was quite good for her, she became interested in selling it. She began by selling it to her family and neighbors, and later she sold it at factories close to her home. She now has been at her business for a year and a half, and thanks to it, has been able to her family get ahead, but she wishes to be able to continue with the business and improve her quality of life.

Maria is requesting a loan for US $375 to purchase merchandise to offer her clients now that they are asking for many more products, and she is offering to pay the loan in six months. She and her children thank you for your support that you give her to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

María vive en unión libre con su pareja y tienen 6 hijos, de los cuales solo uno de ellos ayuda en el negocio, al separarse de su esposo ella se quedo con todo el gasto de la casa y la manutención de sus hijos y con lo que él le enviaba como pensión no cubrían los gastos, en esos momentos ella tomaba un tipo de leche en polvo y vio que podía venderla a sus conocidos, ella conoció esta leche debido a que una amiga la invito a probarla y como le hizo mucho bien entonces fue ahí cuando se intereso en venderla, así ella empezó a venderla entre sus familiares y vecinos, más adelante la vendió en fábricas cercanas a su domicilio, ya tiene más de año y medio con su negocio y gracias a el, ha podido sacar adelante a su familia pero desea poder continuar con su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida.

María solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para comprar mercadería para ofrecer a sus clientes ya que le están solicitando mucho sus productos, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y sus hijos te agradecen el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Purchase of merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz E. is a 45 years-old mother of four children. She is a hard working woman and her dreams of having a better life made her start working when she was only 15 years old. She started working by selling the following: stuffed potatoes, hamburgers, fruits, and other products. Once she started her family, she decided eighteen years ago to start her own small store in order to generate a stable source of income that would support her family. Beatriz starts work at five in the morning and hopes for the loan to improve and to expand her store. The income her husband makes as a mechanic does not cover the tuition costs for the higher education of her children. In order to complete her objectives, she needs $500 dollars to invest into her store’s expansion. She promises that her business will pay back the loan in a six-month period. With your support and generosity Beatriz and her family improve their lives. Believe in her because she will not disappoint you.

Translated from Spanish by Johnny of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

Beatriz E. de 45 años es madre de 4 hijos su capacidad emprendedora y sus inmensos deseos de superación hicieron que empezara a trabajar a los 15 años vendiendo papa rellena, hamburguesas, frutas, entre otros productos; con el tiempo y una vez formada su familia hace más de 18 años decidió abrir su bodeguita con el fin de generar ingresos económicos más estables y sustanciales para su hogar..Beatriz empieza a trabajar desde las 5:00 de la mañana y desea el préstamo para implementar y ampliar su pequeña bodeguita, puesto que los ingresos de su esposo como mecánico es insuficiente para cubrir los gastos de estudios superiores de sus hijos.Para cumplir con sus objetivos solicita 500 dólares que podrá invertir en la bodega para ampliar e implementar su negocio ella promete devolver el préstamo en un lapso de 6 meses.Con tu apoyo y generosidad Beatriz puede salir adelante confía en ella, no te defraudará

loans.use: To buy more merchandise so that each and every one of her customers will receive better service and have more options when shopping at her store.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria is married, has three children, and devotes her time to selling food. Her husband works as an independent welder, but does not earn enough to pay for household expenses or their children's education. That's why she decided to help him by opening her business, which she started in her home 15 years ago. At first she sold to her neighbors, and later began selling in the streets on traveling carts. Little by little, her business has been growing and now she also sells to the merchants near her home. Her oldest daughter, 27 years old, helps her in the business and wishes to continue to make it grow.

Maria is requesting a loan for US $250 to purchase raw ingredients for making food, and offers to pay off the loan in three months. She and her family are very grateful for the support that you give to allow them to continue their business and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Shannon Skoglund, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada y tiene tres hijos ella se dedica a la venta de comidas, su esposo trabaja como soldador independiente, y con lo que gana no les alcanzaba para pagar los gastos del hogar ni la educación de sus hijos, por ello es que ella decidió ayudarlo y puso su negocio, ella empezó con su negocio hace 15 años desde su casa, vendiendo a sus vecinos y luego ya vendía en la calle en puestos ambulantes y poco a poco ha ido creciendo con su negocio y ahora también atiende en los mercaditos cercanos a su domicilio, su hija mayor le ayuda en el negocio ella tiene 27 años y desean continuar con su negocio y hacerlo crecer cada vez más.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar materia prima para la elaboración de sus comidas y ofrece pagar el préstamo en 3 meses, ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le brindas para continuar con su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Purchase of food ingredients

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana is married and has four children. Her husband works on ovens and their eldest son, who is 28 years old, helps him in the ovens business. She sells used and new clothing, and she started her business because she had to contribute income to help her husband with the family's expenses that could not be covered with his salary. Juana has worked selling used and new clothing for more than 6 years. She started selling to her relatives and neighbors and over time she had the option of buying lots of clothing and now she sells in temporary moving markets on different days of the week. She carries the clothes in her van and sells directly to the people.

Juana asks for a loan of US $250 to buy merchandise for her business and she offers to pay the loan in 3 months, since she wants to buy clothes for the season and she knows it will sell very quickly. Juana and her family thank you for your support in helping them make progress.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Juana está casada y tiene cuatro hijos, su esposo trabaja como hornero y su hijo mayor de 28 años le ayuda en el negocio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa nueva y usada, y ella empezó con su negocio por que tenía que aportar ingresos para ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares que no podía cubrir con el sueldo de su esposo, hace ya mas de 6 años que ella se dedica a esta actividad, inició vendiéndole a sus familiares y vecinos y con el tiempo tuvo la opción de comprar pacas de ropa y ahora vende en mercados rodantes en diferentes días de la semana, lleva su ropa en su camioneta y hace su venta directa a las personas.

Juana solicita un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 250 para comprar mercadería para su negocio y ofrece pagarlo en 3 meses, ya que ella quiere comprar ropa de temporada y sabe que la va a vender muy rápido. Ella y su familia te agradecen el apoyo que le das para salir adelante.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (clothing)

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Evelia

texts.es:
Evelia is divorced, has two young children, and started her business when she separated from her husband, since she is responsible for their children and with what she gets in child support from her ex-husband she cannot cover the family's expenses because her ex-husband works as an employee in a business and does not make much money. She was invited by a friend more than 3 years ago to see the american products they could sell, and now she has many clients and many Avon products. She also sells women's shoes and is responsible for 25 more sellers, since her sales have been growing a lot and she wants to continue to grow.

Evelia is asking for a loan for US $ 375 to buy merchandise and to be able to fulfill her clients' orders. She offers to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family are very thankful for the support you give her to continue growing her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Evelia está separada de su esposo, tiene dos hijos menores y empezó con su negocio cuando se separo de su esposo ya que se quedo a cargo de sus hijos y con lo que recibe de pensión de su ex esposo no le alcanza para cubrir los gastos familiares, ya que su ex esposo trabaja como empleado en una empresa y no gana mucho, así ella fue invitada por una amiga hace más de 3 años para ver los productos americanos que podía vender y ahora ya cuenta con muchos clientes y además de productos Avon también vende calzado para dama y tiene a su cargo 25 vendedoras más, ya que ella ha ido creciendo mucho con sus ventas y desea continuar con su crecimiento.

Evelia está solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para comprar mercadería y así poder tener el surtido que necesita y abastecer los pedidos de sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia están muy agradecidos por el apoyo que le das para continuar creciendo con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise (Avon products and women's shoes)

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Edna Patricia

texts.es:
Edna is married and her husband works as a used car salesman. They have two school-age children, 16 and 11 years old. She started with her business when her husband was fired from his previous job, and since she is a very good cook and can make delicious desserts, she decided to sell food and desserts among her neighbors. Her business has been growing little by little and now she even advertises in local magazines and she sells to other people. She also advertises through fliers to increase her market and in consequence get more clients.

Edna is asking for a loan of US $375 to buy new pots, pans, and steamers to make bigger quantities of food and satisfy the demand for her products. She offers to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you for the support you give her to continue her business and improve their quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Edna está casada y su esposo trabaja como vendedor de autos usados, ellos tienen 2 hijos en edad escolar, de 16 y 11 años respectivamente, ella inició con su negocio cuando a su esposo lo despidieron de su anterior trabajo y ella como sabe cocinar muy bien y hace muy ricos postres, decidió vender comida y postres entre sus vecinos y poco a poco ha ido creciendo y actualmente ya se anuncia en las revistas de publicidad locales y ya vende a otras personas además de anunciarse en volantes para poder tener más mercado y por ende clientes.

Edna esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 375 para comprar vasijas y vaporeras nuevas para la elaboración de sus comidas en mayor cantidad y cubrir su demanda, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen mucho el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Gabriela

texts.es:
Gabriela lives with her partner and has three children from her ex-partner. It was then, when she separated from her ex that she started her business of selling natural products. This was more than a year and a half ago, when through a friend, Gabriela was recommended with the coordinator of the products and that is how things started. Now she has a good group of clients, since they have verified that the products she sells are good and work to improve people's health. She wants to continue her sales and improve her income.

Gabriela is asking for a loan of US $1200 to buy products and offer them to her clients directly. She is offering to pay the loan in 6 months. She and her family thank you very much for your support to continue her business.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

Gabriela vive en unión libre con su pareja y tiene tres hijos de su ex pareja, y fue en ese momento cuando se separó que inició con su negocio de venta de productos naturales, esto fue hace más de un año y medio, que por medio de una amiga fue recomendada con la jefa de los productos y ahí comenzó, ahora ya tiene una buena cartera de clientes, ya que han probado que los productos que vende son buenos y funcionan para el mejoramiento de la salud de las personas, ella quiere continuar con sus ventas y mejorar sus ingresos.

Gabriela esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $1200 para surtirse de productos y poder ofrecer directo a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses, ella y su familia te agradecen mucho por el apoyo que le das para continuar con su negocio.

loans.use: Buying merchandise

location.town: San Nicolás de los Garza, Nuevo León

loans.name: Julia

texts.en:
Julia lives by herself with her two small children. She is not married, and she supports both children by herself. She currently has a papelería (stationery store) and a centro de comunicaciónes (cyber cafe). This is the first loan she is soliciting from Kiva through Esperanza.

Julia plans to sell the papelería, where she sells basic notebooks, pencils, school supplies, etc., and concentrate on the cyber cafe (centro de comunicaciónes). In the communication center, Julia has set up five calling booths for people to make international calls, an open space where she plans to put the computer terminals, and she also sells cell phones and calling cards for both Orange and Claro, the two main telecommunications companies here. Her long term goals are to open up three franchises of her communication centers.

Challenges she faces/overcomes: Julia says it is extremely hard to be a woman and own a technology-oriented business. When men come into her store and see that she is activating new cell phones, or fixing network connection problems, they don’t treat her as respectfully as they would a man, and they often challenge the quality of her work. In spite of these challenges she likes her job and finds the challenge stimulating. She has been successful with these two businesses for several years and is excited to take her business to the next level with this loan.

loans.use: To add on computers and internet access so that people in the local community have a chat room (centro de chateo)

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio is a married man, has four children, and his wife is a homemaker. He started his business when he was very young and through his effort he managed to buy a light truck with which he could offer a service of transportation for light loads. His business continued growing and with his income as well as with help from his relatives, he managed to buy his own heavier truck with which he now can offer to transport more things and larger loads. His market consists of small towns close to his community. He is very persevering and hard working, so he expects his business will continue to grow.

Sergio is asking for a loan of $475 for maintenance service for his truck which is his main means for working so he can continue giving a good service to his clients and not disappoint them due to mechanical problems with his truck. He offers to pay the loan in 3 months. He and his family thank you for your support in continuing his business and improving it every day.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva volunteer.

Sergio es un hombre casado y tiene cuatro hijos y su esposa se dedica al hogar, él empezó desde muy joven con su negocio y con su esfuerzo pudo comprar pudo comprar una camioneta con la cual podía ofrecer el servicio de transporte de cosas ligeras, pero continuó creciendo y con lo que junto y ayuda de sus familiares pudo comprar su propio camión con el cual ahora ya puede dar el transporte de carga de más cosas y más grandes lotes, su mercado son poblados cercanos a su comunidad, él es muy perseverante y trabajador por lo que espera continuar con su crecimiento en el negocio.

Sergio esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 475 para darle mantenimiento a su camión que es su arma de trabajo para que pueda continuar dándole un buen servicio a sus clientes y no fallarles por desperfectos de su vehículo, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 3 meses. Él y su familia agradecen mucho tu apoyo para continuar en su negocio y mejorarlo día a día.

loans.use: Maintenance/service for his truck

loans.name: Maria La Luz

texts.es:
Maria is married and her husband is an artisan, and they have three children. Since the expenses of their home cannot be completely covered by her husband, Maria decided to start her own business, which she was familiar with because her parents had also done so. Six years ago she started with a little stand in one room of her house. Her mother-in-law saw what a great worker she was, and helped her find a place where she could locate her business. Since then it has been growing steadily, little by little, with her efforts.

Maria is asking for a loan of $925 USD to buy merchandise, increase business in her store, and offer better service to her clients, and will pay back the loan in six months. She and her family thank you for your continued support that allows her business to grow.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

María esta casada y su esposo es obrero, ellos tienen tres hijos, debido a que los gastos de su hogar no podían ser cubiertos por su esposo, decidió empezar con su negocio, el cual conocía por que sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo, por ello fue que hace 6 años ella empezó con un pequeño estanquillo en una habitación de su casa, y posteriormente su suegra al ver lo trabajadora que era, le facilito un local donde actualmente tiene su negocio, que ha ido creciendo poco a poco con su esfuerzo.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 925 para comprar mercadería y tener un mayor surtido en su tienda y así ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y su familia agradecen el apoyo para continuar con el crecimiento de su negocio.

loans.use: Purchasing merchandise

loans.name: Maria Olivia

texts.es:
Maria Olivia is a single mother, and she has two daughters whom she supports, the oldest being 12 years old, who helps her with the business, and both of her daughters are also in shcool. Maria Olivia was employed at a rotisserie that in time closed its operations for reasons having to do with the health of her boss. Maria Olivia still needed to work, and so four years ago she looked into financing the business herself, and she was able to. With a lot of effort, she opened the business and was able to support her daughters and put them through school, and this is why she wants to continue to improve her business so that their quality of life can imrove as well.

Maria Olivia is asking for a loan of $325 USD to buy better products so that she can get better prices and increase her earnings so that her business can continue to grow, and she will pay back the loan in 6 months. She and her daughters thank you very much for the support that you continue to give their business.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

María Olivia es madre soltera, y tiene dos hijas a quien mantener, siendo la más grandecita de 12 años, quien le ayuda en el negocio, y ambas hijas estudian. María Olivia era empleada en una rosticería que con el tiempo cerro sus operaciones por motivos de salud de su patrona y necesitaba trabajar, entonces hace 4 años atrás ella le solicitó que por su cuenta podía trabajar el negocio si le financiaba el mobiliario que tenía, y así lo hizo. Con esfuerzo comenzó a sacar adelante el negocio y mantener a sus hijas y educarlas, por lo que desea continuar con el mismo para mejorar cada vez más su calidad de vida.

María Olivia esta solicitando un préstamo por US $ 325 para comprar mercaderías al por mayor y así obtener mejores precios y poder obtener mayores márgenes de ganancia y crecer con su negocio, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y sus hijas agradecen mucho el apoyo que les das para continuar con el negocio.

loans.use: To purchase better merchandise

loans.name: Maria Dolores

texts.es:
Maria Dolores is a single mother who at 15 years of age had twin girls. Since she suddenly had to support her daughters and the only thing she knew how to do well was cook, she began a food service business with the support of her mother. Two years ago, knowing of the demand for hot meals in her community, she began offering and selling dishes to her neighbors, including lunches and dinners, and thanks to these efforts has been able to support her family.

Maria Dolores is asking for a loan in the amount of $425 USD to be able to expand her business, increase her earnings, and improve her quality of life, planning to repay the loan in six months. Maria and her daughters thank you for your support that allows them to keep going.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

María Dolores es una madre soltera que a los 15 años de edad quedó embaraza y tuvo gemelas por ello como tenía que mantener a sus niñas y solo conocía bien el arte de la cocina, para poder salir adelante tuvo el apoyo de su mamá hace dos años atrás y sabiendo que había mucha demanda de alimentos preparados en su comunidad fue como empezó ofreciendo sus comidas entre sus vecinas haciendo almuerzos y comidas, y gracias a su esfuerzo a podido salir adelante con su familia.

María Dolores esta solicitando un préstamo por la cantidad de US $ 425 para poder ampliar su negocio y obtener mayores ingresos y así mejorar su calidad de vida, ofreciendo pagar el préstamo en 6 meses. Ella y sus hijas te agradecen el apoyo que le das para poder salir adelante.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Maria Leticia

texts.es:
Maria is a wife and mother to three children, and since she was a little girl, she has been helping her mother with making and selling pastries. Four years ago she began her own business in order to support her husband since he had been unemployed and they needed income to support their children. Since her husband didn't have a job, he began to help with the business and the sale of the pastries and they have very successfully increased their business.

Maria is asking for a loan of $375 USD to buy the primary ingredients for a term of six months to purchase and be able to go forward with her business and continue supporting her family, and thanks to the support of the loans she can do so.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Maria es una mujer casada y tiene tres hijos, desde pequeña ayudaba a su madre a la elaboración y venta de donas y al crecer hace cuatro años atrás siguió su negocio de venta de donas por la necesidad de apoyar a su esposo ya que se había quedado sin empleo y se necesitaban ingresos para mantener a sus tres hijos y como su esposo no tenia empleo empezó a apoyarla en el negocio de venta de donas para poder incrementar las ventas logrando con éxito incrementarlas.

María esta solicitando un préstamo por USD $ 375 para la compra de materia prima en un plazo de 6 meses para pagar y poder seguir adelante con su negocio y poder seguir manteniendo a su familia, agradece el apoyo que le brindas para poder seguir adelante con el negocio.

loans.use: Purchasing ingredients

loans.name: Omar

texts.es:
Omar is a young man who, upon finding out that his father had been laid off by the paper business where he worked, also saw in his own home urgent economic need. He asked his father's permission to leave school and begin an ecological project that was his father's idea, since they were going through a hard time financially. He was able to achieve his father's dream.

Omar is asking for a loan of $925 USD with a term of 6 months to maintain his machinery and be able to continue developing his father's dream to have financial security and support their family, as a way to repay all the support his father has given him.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Pixler, Kiva Volunteer.

Omar es una persona soltera a la que al enterarse de que a su padre lo había despedido de la empresa papelera donde trabajaba y en su hogar el ver la urgente necesidad económica le pidió a su padre permiso para dejar de estudiar y permitirle iniciar el proyecto ecológico de su padre ya que pasaban por una carencia económica muy fuerte, logro desarrollar el sueño de su padre.

Omar esta solicitando un préstamo de USD $ 925 con un plazo de 6 meses para mantenimiento de su maquinaria y poder seguir desarrollando el sueño de su padre a la vez de tener solvencia económica y poder mantener a su familia, agradeciendo el apoyo que le brindan.

loans.use: Machinery Maintenance

loans.name: Sutik Legiwati

texts.id:
Sutik Legiwati, 54 year old, is a mother who has a business as a seller of cooking ingredientss. The location of her business is at Gilimanuk market. She does her business from 5 am to 12 noon. With the start up capital of Rp 500,000 (US$ 53), Sutik started her business by selling several cooking ingredients. Her business is quickly to expand as she only sells a good quality ingredients at a competitive price.

Her average daily profit is Rp 45,000 (US$ 4.7). As she has a lot of customers now, she is having difficulties to keep up with her customers' demand as her merchandise is limited.

With the loan from DINARI, Sutik is able to add more variety to her cooking ingredients so she is able to cater her customers' demand. Of course this also improves her family's wellfare.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Sutik Legiwati seorang ibu yang sudah berusia 54 tahun, mempunyai usaha sebagai Dagang Meracang ( Menjual aneka jenis bumbu dapur ). Dengan mengambil lokasi di Pasar Pagi Gilimanuk, Sutik memulai usahanya dari pukul 05.00 pagi sampai dengan pukul 12.00 siang. Dengan modal awal sebesar Rp. 500.000.- , Sutik memulai usahanya dengan menjual beberapa jenis bumbu dapur. Usaha Sutik berkembang dengan pesat karena semua barang dagangannya berkwalitas baik dan dengan harga yang bersaing. Dalam sehari Sutik mampu meraup keuntungan sebesar Rp. 45.000.- Karena usahanya sudah memiliki banyak pelanggan, Sutik merasa kewalahan untuk melayani permintaan pelanggannya karena usahanya kekurangan Modal. Dengan pinjaman dari Dinari, sekarang Sutik sudah melengkapi variasi dagangannya dengan berbagai jenis bumbu dapur sehingga semua kebutuhan pelanggannya tersedia. Sekarang ini, Sutik mendapat keuntungan yang lebih banyak dari sebelumnya dan Sutik merasa sangat bersyukur, karena hal itu dapat meningkatkan kesejahteraan keluarganya.

loans.use: To add the working capital to enable her to put more stock/ ingredients to be sold.

loans.name: Seang

texts.en: Mrs. Seang S., 40, lives with her husband and three children in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their rice paddy together growing crops and some kinds of vegetables. They earn approximately $4 each day. Three of her children are employed at a garment factory, earning together on average $250 per month. Mrs. Seang S. hopes to use this loan to purchase two oxen to work in her farm.

loans.use: To purchase two oxen to work in her farm.

loans.name: Mann

texts.en: Mrs. Mann S. is 28 years old and mother of two little children. They live in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. Mann works as a housewife looking after her little kids, while her husband works as a taxi-driver, earning about $5 each day. This loan will be potentially used for her family to purchase a used car to operate a business. Mann believes that her husband will be able to earn more if he drives their own taxi.

loans.use: To purchase a used car to use to operate a business

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun S. (51) and her husband (52, pictured here) live in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with their four children. The family have several sources of income, and like most families in Cambodia, they pool all their earnings. Yun S.'s husband earns $1 a day transporting passengers by horse and cart. Two of her children work at a garment factory, earning $50 a month each, whilst the other two are students.

Yun S. herself earns $2 a day selling vegetables which she grows on the family's land. She intends to use the loan to purchase a water pumping machine to irrigate the land and increase the amount of vegetables she is able to grow.

loans.use: to purchase a water-pumping machine

loans.name: Pav

texts.en:
Mrs. Pav N. is 50 years old and lives with her 42-year-old husband in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Mrs. Pav N. buys fish from a wholesaler and sells them at the market, earning $3 a day. Her husband earns $0.50 a day as a fisherman.

The couple has five children, two are married, one works at a factory earning $100 a month, and the other two are students. Pay N. intends to use the loan to purchase a used car for her husband to operate a taxi service. The couple knows that he will be able to earn considerably more as a taxi driver than he does as a fisherman.

loans.use: to purchase a used car to operate a taxi business

loans.name: Tuy

texts.en:
Mrs. Tuy P. is a 30-year-old housewife living in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia with her 31-year-old husband and their two children (both students). Her husband earns $5.50 a day selling the bananas that he grows on a small plot of land .

Tuy P. would like to use this loan to purchase a plot of land so that her husband can grow more crops. She intends to use the rest of the money to purchase a motorcycle so that he can more effectively transport his crops to market.

loans.use: to purchase a plot of land and a motorcycle to transport crops

loans.name: Cleotilde De Jesús

texts.en:
Cleotilde is the kind of woman that wants to do everything she can to succeed and improve her situation in life.  She is 45, married and the mother of 3 children, 2 boys and a girl.  When she’s not in her beauty salon, that she has owned now for almost 25 five years, she’s selling Jafra’s cosmetics and skin care products to the people of her community.

Her salon was the first one built in her area and customers come for the quality and professionalism of her work.  She’s one of the few people that have an electric generator so her salon can work even with the power cut.   Even though she studied Nursing, Cleotilde had never had to work in a hospital or a health center, because her business provides her a higher income than working as a nurse.  In fact, she earns between 10.000 and 15.000 Dominican pesos a month (US $ 1.00 =33 pesos)  from her beauty salon.  Now, she really thinks things could be better if she could remodel the salon.  She also plans to put a showcase into the salon to exhibit some beauty samples to her customers.  All those plans will be possible if she can borrow US$ 375.00.

loans.use: To buy more products and a showcase to promote a line of skin care products.  The entrepreneur also needs money to cover operating expenses.

loans.name: Yem

texts.en:
Mrs. Yem C. is a 29-year-old woman living in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her 38-year-old husband and their two children, both of whom are students. Yem C.'s husband earns $5.50 per day as a blacksmith.

Yem C. herself works selling beef soup to people in her village and earns about $4.80 a day. She intends to use this loan to invest in her business: she would like to build a little shop as a point of sale for her soup. Furthermore, she intends to purchase more cooking equipment for the micro-enterprise.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and build a shop for her business

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean C., 36, lives with her 36-year-old husband in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her three children, all of whom are students. Her husband earns $9.60 a day as a blacksmith. Sean C. herself can be hired by couples getting married to take care of their wedding. She decorates the premises herself, finds clothes for the bride to wear and organizes the food. She has applied for this loan to improve this business; in particular she would like to buy more decorative items. With the remainder of the money she would like to repair her home.

loans.use: to purchase decorating items for her wedding business

loans.name: Sutiyem

texts.id:
Although she is 65, that does not lowered Sutiyem to do business to increase family's income. Sutiyem lives in a hut made from woven bamboo walls and sand floor (no tiles). Sutiyem has a business of "Packed rice" (nasi bungkus). All of it was done with her children and in laws at home, since they all live in the same one house. Every packed rice was sold at Rp 1500 or Rp 2000 (16 or 22 cents) depending on customer's request. For every package she profits about Rp 200 (2 cents), each day she produce about 100 packages. So in one day she could profit about Rp20,000 (about $2.20). The Dinari loan, Sutiyem use to buy a rice warmer: Magic jar, so that her packed rice would still be warm, and her customers would be more satisfied. Besides that Sutiyem will buy other kitchen aplliances like stove, pots and wok. This will make her business more efficient, and could produce more.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Walaupun usia sudah cukup tua, yakni 65 tahun, tidak menyurutkan semangat Sutiyem untuk melakukan pekerjaan untuk menambah penghasilan keluarganya. Sutiyem tinggal dirumahnya yang terbuat dari dinding gede dan lantai tanah. Sutiyem mempunyai usaha sebagai Dagang Nasi Bungkus. Semua itu dikerjakannya dirumah bersama dengan anak dan menantunya karena mereka tinggal bersama dalam satu rumah. Setiap bungkus dijual Sutiyem dengan harga Rp. 1.500.- atau Rp. 2.000.- tergantung permintaan pelanggannya. Dalam setiap bungkusnya, Sutiyem bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 200.-, sedangkan dalam sehari Sutiyem bisa mejual nasi bungkus sebanyak 100 biji. Jadi dalam sehari, Sutiyem mampu mendapat keuntungan Rp. 20.000.- Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Sutiyem menggunakannya untuk membeli Magic Jar ( penghangat nasi ), sehingga nasi bungkus yang dijualnya tetap hangat dan pelanggannya dapat menikmatinya dengan lebih puas. Selain itu, Sutiyem juga membeli alat – alat dapur yang dapat menunjang usahanya seperti kompor, panci dan penggorengan. Hal itu dilakukannya supaya kinerja usahanya lebih cepat dan dapat memproduksi lebih banyak lagi.

loans.use:
To buy kitchen appliances that could support her business

Membeli peralatan dapur yang dapat menunjang kinerja usahanya

loans.name: Neang

texts.en:
Mrs. Neang SamB., 50, is married with nine children and lives with her husband (pictured here because Mrs. S. B. was unavailable) in Prey Veng province, Cambodia. She is a street-vendor selling cakes and provisions to the people in her community, and she can typically make $3 each day. Meanwhile, her husband is a cook, earning around $4/day in profit. Three of Neang's children are currently employed at a garment factory, earning together about $150 per month.

During this rainy season, Mrs. Neang S. B. hopes to use the requested loan to purchase a boat with a motor to operate a fishery business. Any remainder of the money will be used to raise pigs, which will enable her to generate additional profits for her household.

loans.use: purchase a boat with a motor to operate a fishery business

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly R. is a 56-year-old woman who works selling Khmer traditional cake and porridge for $2 a day. Her husband is 58 and works as a blacksmith, and their three children all work in Malaysia. Ly intends to use this loan to buy some more tools for her husband's business.

loans.use: to purchase blacksmith tools

loans.name: In

texts.en: Mrs. In H. is 45 years old and lives with her 60-year-old husband in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Mrs. In H. is a farmer, whilst her husband works as a teacher in the local school, which earns H. only $1.60 day. They have three children, one of whom is married; the other two work at a garment factory, earning $2.40 a day. In H. intends to use this loan to buy a sewing machine for her husband to set up a tailoring business to run when he has spare time from his job as a schoolmaster.

loans.use: to purchase a sewing machine

payments.comment: Congratulation! Your Kiva loan has been repaid early. Thank you for interest helping Cambodian entrepreneurs like In Him and sustain their business. Your loan has made them different. We do hope that you will continue support the poor entrepreneurs in Cambodia through CREDIT MFI in the future. Best Regard, Vichet Ouch, Kiva Coordinator at CREDIT MFI, Phnom Penh Office.

loans.name: Felicia Roble

texts.en: Years ago, the husband of this brave 55 years old lady had an accident and became paralyzed. Since that day she had to do everything herself. Her best skill is dressmaking and that’s how she has raised her 6 boys. She buys the cloth and sews it into uniforms, sheets, tablecloths and other articles that people buy from her. She now has 30 years of experience. She realizes that she could be much more productive if she could buy even more fabric and make more articles. She hopes to borrow an amount of US $175.00 that she’ll repay in 6 months in order to increase her business.

loans.use: To buy more fabric in order  to sew more articles and sell a larger amount of products.

loans.name: Chok

texts.en:
Mrs. Chok M., 54, is a mother of six children and lives with her husband in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband work very hard on their rice paddy growing crops, earning around $5 each day from selling their crop at the market. Three of their children, meanwhile, are employed at a garment factory and together earn around $100 each month, whilst the other three are enrolled in school.

Mrs. Chok M. hopes to use this loan to purchase pig feed and some piglets to raise on their piece of land, with which she hopes to generate a good profit when she sells them.

loans.use: To purchase pig feed and some piglets to raise on their piece of land

loans.name: Lucía Martes

texts.en:
Since the death of her dearly beloved husband, Lucía, 63, has had to work very hard to support her five sons, all of whom live with her. Two of her children are part-time farm workers, two are on unemployment and the youngest was disabled in an accident and is not able to work.

Lucía started a small business three months ago and quickly realized that it was a great way to increase her income. She sells fresh chicken parts (legs, wings, giblets and so on) and boiled peas. Every day, she buys five live chickens from a poultry house near where she lives and sells the parts. A live chicken weighs four or five pounds, and costs about 30 pesos (or $1) per pound. Sold as parts, these chickens are worth more than 70 pesos per pound. Her boiled peas are popular because women in her township don’t want to use the energy needed to soften peas in their gas ovens.

Because these activities have proved so lucrative, Lucía has applied for a loan of $375 to expand her business. She'll use her loan to buy enough chickens and peas to substantially increase her income and better support her family.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory for a new and very profitable business

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa lives in district 7 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single, and he lives with his family. He has a dress shop. He has been in this business since 2005, and he works hard. He wants to expand his business so he wants to take an individual loan to buy extra materials like shoes, clothes, and bags to attract more clients. He wants to make  a good income to support his family. He is happy that he can expand his business.

loans.use: To buy extra materials like shoes, clothes, and bags.

loans.name: Komang Sunarti

texts.id:
With a simple stall that was made from bamboo and cement floor, Komang Sunarti and her 2 children is enthusiastic to help her husband raising pigs. Komang Sunarti could add income by raising these pigs. she needs capital of Rp700,000 (about US$80) to buy 3 piglets, and Rp600,000(about $70) to buy animal feed. Komang Sunarti could profit within 3 months Rp250,000 (about $28), since within that time frame the pigs were ready for sale. That profit is used to pay for children's education expenses, and some for household needs.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan kandang yang sederhana, yang terbuat dari bambu dan lantai semen, Komang Sunarti dan kedua anaknya dengan semangat membantu suaminya, memelihara babi. Komang Sunarti bisa memberi tambahan untuk kebutuhan keluarganya dengan memelihara babi. Dia membutuhkan dana sebesar Rp.700.000,-digunakan untuk membeli bibit sebanyak 3 ekor, dan Rp.600.000,- untuk beli pakan ternak. Komang Sunarti bisa mendapat untung dalam jangka waktu 3 (tiga) bulan Rp 250.000,- sebab dalam jangka waktu tersebut babi sudah siap dijual. Keuntungan yang diperoleh digunakan untuk membiayai anak-anaknya sekolah dan sebagian untuk kebutuhan rumah tangganya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and animal feed

Membeli bibit babi dan membeli pakan ternak

loans.name: Miswati

texts.id:
Miswati is a hard working rice seller tas she needs to have additional income because her husband who works as a bag and sandal seller cannot earn enough for the family.

Everyday Miswati starts the day at 4 am to cook the rice, the vegetables and others. She needs to be at Gilimanuk market at 8 am to open her rice stall. She usually opens the stall until 11 am.

With a start up capital of Rp 500,000 (US$ 53) she started this business. To protect her food from dust and flies, she always puts her food inside a glass display cabinet. From that capital, she can get daily profit in average of Rp 30,000 (US$ 3)/ day. This profit is used to buy the rent to the Market authority of Rp 1,000 (10 cent)/ day and also to finance the school for her 3 children who are now at primary school.

The loan from DINARI is going to be used to add more stock such as snack and soft drink with the hope that these additional merchandise will increase her revenue. With higher revenue she is hoping to be able to put her children to higher education.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Miswati seorang pedagang nasi yang ulet, karena penghasilan suaminya sebagai seorang pedagang tas dan sandal tidak mencukupi untuk memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangga. Oleh sebab itu jam 04.00 pagi Miswati harus sudah bangun untuk menyiapkan dagangannya, mulai dari memasak nasi, lauk pauk dan sayuran, karena jam 08.00 Miswati sudah harus sampai dipasar Gilimanuk untuk membuka usahanya.Miswati membuka usaha ini sampai jam 11.00 siang. Dengan modal awal Rp.500.000.- , Miswati membuka sebuah warung nasi. Untuk menghindari makanan dari debu maupun lalat maka dagangan tersebut ditempatkan pada sebuah rak kaca. Dari modal tersebut Miswati bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp.30.000 setiap hari. Keuntungan ini dipakai untuk membayar sewa (karcis pasar) sebesar Rp.1.000 setiap hari, dan juga untuk biaya ketiga orang anaknya yang sekarang sudah duduk dibangku sekolah. Sedangkan pinjaman dari Dinari rencananya dipakai untuk menambah barang dagangan seperti makanan ringan maupun minuman dengan harapan penghasilan yang diperoleh lebih banyak lagi.Dan nantinya anak-anak Miswati bisa melanjutkan kesekolah yang lebih tinggi.

loans.use: to add the capital to enable her to stock some soft drinks for her rice selling business.

loans.name: Ketut Nonti

texts.id:
As Ketut Nonti is only a secondary school graduate, it is difficult for her to get a job, especially in a remote village where she lives. Nevertheless she is not desperate in living her life.

With her full willingness and the money from DINARI, she decides to grow pigs.

She allocates Rp 1,000,000 (US$ 105) to buy piglets and another Rp 300,000 (US$ 31.5) to buy the pig feed.

After 6 month period, the pigs will be ready to be sold. The estimated net profit from this 6 month work is Rp 800,000 (US$ 84). From this she will be able to provide her family's daily needs.

While the profit is not tha big, she will keep to do this business as she can get additional income for her family.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Karena pendidikan yang hanya sampai SMP saja, tidak memungkinkan untuk bisa mencari pekerjaan dikantoran, apalagi didesa terpencil ditempat dimana Ketut Nonti tinggal, walau demikian, Ketut Nonti tidak putus asa dalam mengarungi kehidupannya. Dengan kemauannya yg tinggi serta dengan modal yang di dapat dari DINARI Ketut Nonti memilih untuk memelihara babi. Uang dengan jumlah Rp.1.000.000,- dialokasikan untuk membeli bibit sebanyak 5 ekor, dan yang Rp.300.000,- digunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak. Kadang Ketut Nonti mencari batang pisang untuk makanan tambahan. Setelah pemeliharaan selama enam bulan babi siap dijual. Keuntungan yang didapat sebanyak 800.000/enam bulan dan dari hasil jerih payahnya itu Ketut Nonti bisa memenuhi kebutuhan rumah tangganya. Usaha ini akan terus dijalani walau keuntungan yang didapat tidak begitu besar, namun usaha ini bisa memberi tambahan untuk keluarganya

loans.use: to buy pigs and pig feed

loans.name: Wayan Suarni

texts.id:
In her daily activities, Wayan Suarni, routinely feed her pigs eagerly as this effort will improve her family’s economic condition. Breeding 4 piglets, 1 male pig and 2 breeder sows represent substantial capital requirements, including daily needs and the children’s education costs. Feedings occur in the morning and afternoon, this activity is assisted by her son aged 17. With the capital provided by DINARI she is able to expand her pig farming effort.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Dalam kesehariannya, Wayan Suarni dengan rutin memberi makan babi peliharaannya, semua itu dlakukanya dengan senang hati karena usaha tersebut dapat menopang perekonomian keluarganya. Dengan 4 ekor anak babi, 1 ekor pejantan dan 2 induk babi yang dipeliharanya itu merupakan modal yang besar bagi keluarga Wayan Suarni untuk mencukupi kebutuhan setiap hari dan biaya pendidikan anaknya. Pemberian makan pada ternaknya dilakukan pada waktu pagi dan sore hari, pekerjaan inipun sering di bantu oleh anak semata wayangnya yang berusia 17 tahun. Dengan modal yang diberikan oleh DINARI Wayan Suarni mampu mengembangkan usaha pemeliharaan babinya.

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feed (Membeli bibit babi dan membeli pakan ternak)

loans.name: Siti Mariyah

texts.id:
Siti Mariyah has a business as a street vendor at the Gilimanuk Port. Her husband works as a hard labor at the Gilimanuk Market. Siti Mariyah has 2 children, the oldest one is in highschool and the youngest one is in primary school.

To finance her family's daily needs and the cost for her children's school, Siti Mariyah has to work hard. When she opened her stall for her street vendor business, she spent her saving of Rp 550,000 (US$ 58) to bought the merchandise. Three years later her business started to generate income for her family. Siti Mariyah daily profit in average is Rp 30,000 (US$ 3). As she wants to improve the wellfare of her family, she wants to improve her busines. However she doesn't have enough working capital to do so.

If she gets the loan from DINARI, she can improve her business. She will be able to stock more inventories and merchandise. She will also be able to buy new and cleaner plywood to be used to improve the condition of her wooden stall.

Siti Mariyah believes that her revenue will increase.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Siti Mariyah mempunyai usaha sebagai Dagang Asongan di pelabuhan Gilimanuk. Suaminya bekerja sebagai buruh di Pasar Pagi Gilimanuk. Siti Mariyah memiliki 2 orang anak, yang pertama sudah duduk dibangku SMA dan yang kedua di bangku SD. Untuk membiayai kebutuhan keluarga dan keperluan sekolah anaknya, Siti Mariyah harus bekerja keras. Pertama kali membuka usaha, Siti Mariyah hanya bermodalkan tabungannya sebesar Rp. 550.000.- dan semuanya itu dipergunakannya untuk membeli barang dagangan. Setelah usahanya berjalan kurang lebih 3 tahun, usahanya sudah menampakkan hasil bagi keluarganya. Dalam sehari, Siti mariyah bisa mendapat keuntungan Rp. 30.000.-.Sebagai wanita yang ingin mensejahterakan keluarganya, Siti Mariyah ingin meningkatkan usahanya. Namun Siti Mariyah kesulitan modal untuk mewujudkan rencananya. Setelah mendapat pinjaman dari Dinari, Siti Mariyah segera memperbaharui dagangannya. Dengan tambahan barang dagangan dan penampilan yang baru dengan rak kayu yang bersih, Siti Mariyah yakin akan mendapat pendapatan yang lebih baik dari sebelumnya.

loans.use: To buy supplies/ merchandise and to buy clean plywood to improve her wooded stall.

loans.name: Ni Luh Kerti

texts.id:
In addition to her daily work as a farmer at a field, Luh Kersi also has side business at home by growing up 4 pigs.

The working capital loan from DINARI will be used to buy pig feed which will be used to feed the pigs twice a day. The daily feeding cost is Rp 20,000 (US$ 2).

In the next 6 month period, the pigs will be ready to be sold for Rp 5,200,000 (US$ 547), minus all of the related expenses of Rp 3,600,000 (US$ 379), she will get a net profit of Rp 1,600,000 (US$ 168).

With this money Luh Kersi will be able to put her 2 children to school. She needs a lot of money as one of her child has graduated from highschool and now is entering to the university.

In addition to that she will be also to use part of the profit for her family's daily needs.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva Volunteer.

Selain sebagai seorang petani yang setiap hari bekerja di ladang Luh Kersi juga memiliki kesibukan di rumahnya yaitu memelihara babi penggemukan sebanyak 4 ekor. Modal yang diperoleh dari DINARI dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan seperti; dedak, konsentrat dan jagung, yang setiap harinya diberikan kepada ternak sebanyak 2 kali yang mengeluarkan biaya perhari Rp.20,000,-. Selain Konsentrat juga diberikan makanan selingan berupa hijauan seperti batang pisang dan daun talas yang sudah direbus dan dicampur dengan dedak. Dalam jangka waktu 6 bulan babi sudah siap untuk dijual dengan pendapatan kotor Rp.5.200.000,- dikurangi pengeluaran per panen sebesar Rp.3.600.000,- jadi pendapatan bersih yang diperoleh Luh kersi sebesar Rp.1,600,000,-.dari hasil ini Luh Kersi bisa menyekolahkan 2 anaknya yang memerlukan biaya yang cukup banyak karena 1 anaknya sudah tamat SMU dan akan melanjutkan ke perguruan tinggi disamping itu untuk membantu keperluan rumah tangganya.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Penh

texts.en: Mrs. Penh Khim is a 46-year-old wife and mother living in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. She and her husband run a stall selling a type of cereal made up of mixed vegetables, beans and grain to people in their community. She earns up to $7.40 a day from this activity. She intends to use this loan to buy more grain for this business so that she can increase production and sales.

loans.use: to buy grain for a cereal stall

loans.name: Ni Luh Yeni

texts.id:
Ni Luh Yeni, a housewife and a farmer, has side job of pig farming that helps her family economy. The working capital from DINARI is to be used to buy 3 piglets in addition to her female pig that already gave birth to 5 pigs.

Part of the working capital is to be used to buy pig feed that cost to Rp 25,000 (US$ 3) per day. The feeding is done twice a day, in the morning and in the afternoon. The total estimated cost to grow these pigs is Rp 3,000,000 (US$ 316) which can generate gross income of Rp 4,850,000 (US$ 511), so the net profit will be Rp 1,850,000 (US$ 195).

Ni Luh Yeni is very happy with her business and she hopes that her cooperation with DINARI can be sustainable and her business is growing.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Luh Yeni seorang ibu rumah tangga yang memiliki usaha beternak babi yang dirasakannya sangat membantu perekonomian keluarganya disamping sebagai seorang petani. Modal usaha dari DINARI dipergunakan untuk membeli 3 bibit penggemukan, karena Ni Luh Yeni mempunyai induk babi dan sudah beranak 5 ekor. Sebagian modal dipergunakan untuk membeli pakan ternak yang setiap hari membutuhkan biaya sebesar Rp.25,000,- dan diberi makan 2 kali setiap hari yaitu pagi dan sore. Biaya pengeluaran sampai panen baik anak induk babi dan babi penggemukan sebesar Rp.3,000,000,-. Pendapatan kotornya sebesar Rp.4,850,000,- jadi keuntungan bersih sekali panen sebesar Rp,1,850,000,-.Ni Luh Yeni sangat senang dengan usahanya ini harapannya supaya kerjasama dengan DINARI dapat berkesinambungan dan usahanya lebih maju.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mrs. Mut C., 36, is married with three children and lives with her husband in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She works on her piece of land growing a variety of vegetables and also operates a small grocery store in her community . She can generally earn $3/day. Her husband works as a fisherman, earning around $3 each day and three of her children attend secondary school.

Mrs. Mut C. hopes to use this loan to dig a well, so that she no longer has trouble with their watering system during the summers. In the future, she would like to save enough money to keep investing in her crop expansion.

loans.use: To dig a well, so that she no longer has trouble with their watering system during the summers

loans.name: Koim

texts.en:
Mrs. Koim Buntheng is a 51-year-old woman living in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband, 53, and their six children. Koim Buntheng works selling vegetables and earns $2 a day from this activity. Her husband currently earns $1 a day as a farmer.

Koim Buntheng has applied for this loan because she would like to purchase a car for her husband so that he can work transporting clothes from a factory to the wholesalers. The money he will get from this will be very useful additional income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase a car to transport clothes from a factory to a wholesaler

payments.comment:
Congratulations to Mrs. Koim Bantheng for paying back her loan early. Your support made it possible for her to increase her family's income. The car she bought is running well and her husband's transportation business is thriving. We hope you will continue to support poor Cambodian entrepreneurs and CREDIT MFI clients in the future.

Many thanks,
Jordyan Edmiston, Kiva Fellow, Phnom Penh, Cambodia
and the entire CREDIT MFI team

loans.name: Made Sekar

texts.id:
In the middle of her daily routine as a farmer, Made Sekar is still able to allocate some time to grow and farm pigs at the backyard of her house.

From the loan amount she can buy 3 local balinese piglets for Rp 750,000 (around US$ 79). She plans to grow these piglets for 3 month and re-sell them when they've grown up.

She will need to feed the pigs for 3 month period and the estimated cost for the pig feed for that period is Rp 250,000 (US$ 26). The feeding is done twice a day, in the morning and in the afternoon.

Made Sekar can sell the grown up pigs for Rp 1,500,000 (US$ 158). The net profit is Rp 500,000 (US$ 53) which will be used as additional income support for her husband who works as a farmer. This money can be used to improve the condition of their wooden made house.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Ditengah kesibukan sebagai petani Made Sekar masih sempat memelihara ternak babi dibelakang rumahnya. Dari dana pinjaman yang diperolehnya Made menbelikan babi jenis lokal Bali sebanyak 3 ekor seharga Rp 750.000,- Rencananya dalam 3 bulan kedepan akan dijual kembali dengan harapan berat babi Bali bertambah dan harganyapun semakin mahal. Selama memelihara 3 bulan diperkirakan biaya pembelian pakan sekitar Rp.250.000,-.Pemberian pakan biasanya dilakukan sebanyak 2 kali yaitu pagi dan sore .Made Sekar menjual 3 ekor babi yang sudah kelihatan gemuk dan sehat dengan total harga Rp.1.500.000,-. Keuntungan bersih yang didapat sekitar sekitar Rp.500.000,- dalam 3 bulan dipakai sebagai tambahan penghasilan suaminya yang sebagi petani dan dapat dipakai untuk memeperbaiki rumah yang terbuat dari kayu dan bedeg.

loans.use: to buy piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Ni Ketut Sriani

texts.id:
The surrounding conditions is a primary factor and very influential to one’s decision. Ni Ketut Sriani is not hesitant in carrying out pig farming as during every religious celebration in Bali pork is an essential. Currently, she only breeds the local pig, as her capital is small. With this loan from DINARI of Rp 1.400.000 (USD175), this capital can be used to fund 4 pigs, costing Rp 1.000.000 (USD125). The remainder to purchase feed. In less than 6 months, the pigs can be sold for gross income of Rp 2.800.000 (USD350) less cost of Rp 1.500.000, leaving a net income of Rp 1.300.000 (USD165) for the 6 months. She can then set aside funds to pay for her child’s education.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Lingkungan adalah faktor utama yang sangat berpengaruh atau mendukung Ni Ketut Sriani untuk menjalani usaha beternak babi, maka Ni ketut Sriani tidak ragu – ragu dalam menjalankan usaha ini. Karena di Bali setiap upacara keagamaan sangat membutuhkan daging babi.Saat ini Ni Ketut Sriani hanya memelihara Babi Lokal karena kurangnya modal yang dimiliki.Dengan adanya pinjaman modal dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.400.000,- modal ini dipergunakan untuk memelihara 4 babi penggemukan sebesar Rp.1.000.000,-. Sisanya dipakai untuk membeli pakan babi.Dalam kurun waktu 6 bulan babi sudah siap untuk dipanen pendapatan kotor yang didapat dari penjualan babi Rp.2.800.000,-sedangkan modal yang dikeluarkan Rp.1.500.000,-.Keuntungan bersih Rp 1.300.000,- per 6 bulan. Dari hasil usahanya ini Ni Ketut Sriani bisa menyisihkan uangnya untuk persiapan biaya sekolah anaknya .

loans.use: Purchase piglets and feed (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak)

loans.name: Celeste

texts.pt:
Celeste N. is a 46-year-old married mother of 5. She lives in the Maxaquene area of Maputo. She runs a hardware store in the Urbanização neighborhood where she sells a variety of materials for construction, plumbing, tools, etc. She entered the program in January of 2006, taking an initial loan of 6,000 MT (meticais). She is entering her third cycle with a loan of 22,000 MT to be repaid in 9 months. She experienced substantial growth in the business as evidenced by the increase in volume. She has paid her loans on time and has proven to be a person of good character.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Celeste N. tem 46 anos de idade, é casada e mãe de 5 filhos. Vive no bairro da Maxaquene na cidade de Maputo.Tem uma ferragem no bairro Urbanização onde vende diverso material como o de construção, canalização, ferramentas, etc.Entrou no programa em Janeiro de 2006 e tomou como primeiro empréstimo 6.000MT.Vai para o 3º ciclo e vai tomar 22.000MT pagáveis em 9 meses. Teve um crescimento substancial no negócio que é visível pelo aumento do volume do mesmo e ela tem pago pontualmente as prestações e demosntra ser uma pessoa de bom carácter.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Heng

texts.en:
Mrs. Heng S. P., 31, lives with her husband, 33, and four children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Heng S. P. works growing and selling vegetables for $1.50 a day, and her husband earns $4 a day as a construction foreman.

Heng S. P. intends to use this loan to buy construction supplies such as wood and iron to help her husband with his work. She will use the remainder of the money for seeds and fertilizer to increase the amount of vegetables she can grow.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies and seeds

loans.name: Wayan Sarmi

texts.id:
Because she resides in a rural area, Wayan Sarmi loves breeding, and breeding pigs generates adequate income. From the loan, currently Wayan Sarmi is able to purchase 4 local breed pigs also know as the Bali pig and supplies adequate for several months. After 3 months of feeding the pigs will be suitable to be a mother pigs. To cover expenses, 3 will be sold for Rp 2.000.000 (USD250) and 1 kept for breeding. Net income attained from this after 3 months will be Rp 700.000 (about USD90), can be used to supplement income from her husband as a farmer; 2 children are still her dependent.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Karena terletak di daerah pedalaman Wayan Sarmi gemar beternak, ternak yang dirasa cukup menghasilkan yaitu beternak babi. Dari pinjaman yang dia dapatkan saat ini Wayan Sarmi dapat membeli 4 ekor babi jenis lokal atau babi Bali, dan juga membeli persediaan pakan untuk beberapa bulan berikutnya. Masa pemeliharaan penggemukan hanya 3 bulan dan sudah siap menjadi calon induk.Untuk meringankan biaya akan 3 ekor penggemukan dijual dengan harga Rp.2.000.000,- dan 1 babi dipersiapkan menjadi Induk. Keuntungan bersih dalam 3 bulan dapat mencapai Rp.700.000,- dapat dipakai untuk menambah pendapatan suami yang seorang petani dan 2 orang anak yang masih menjadi tanggungannya.

loans.use: Purchase pigs and feed (Membeli bibit babi dan pakan ternak)

loans.name: Cheng

texts.en: Mrs. Cheng S., 37, lives with her husband and two children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Cheng Sokham works at her own grocery store, from which she earns $2 a day. Her husband earns $3 a day transporting customers by horse and cart. Cheng S. intends to use this loan to buy a used car for her husband so that he can operate a taxi business, which will earn more than his current occupation driving a horse and cart.

loans.use: to purchase a used car to operate a taxi business

payments.comment:
Congratulations to Cheng Sokhim for successfully repaying back the Kiva loan. Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs like Cheng Sokhim. We hope that you will continue your support through CREDIT MFI.


Best regards,
Isadora Tang
Kiva Fellow
Cambodia

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Mrs. Phuong S., 54, is a mother of five children and lives with her husband (pictured in the photograph) in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She and her husband work on their rice paddy, growing rice and vegetables. They earn around US$5 a day from selling their produce at a market. One of their children runs a small grocery store and another one attends school. With the help of a loan of US$500, Mrs. Phuong S. and her husband hope to make additional income by raising piglets which they expect to sell for profit in about four to five months after purchase.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets to raise for profit

loans.name: Assucena Albertina J

texts.pt:
Assucena Albertina Jorge M. is 21 years old and lives with her husband and son. She lives in the Polana Caniço area and runs a clothing business in the Xipamanine market. She purchases her products in South Africa and in Downtown Maputo. She entered the program in February of 2007, taking a loan of 6,000 MT (meticais). She is now seeking the same amount to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Assucena Albertina Jorge M. tem 21 anos de idade, vive maritalmente com o esposo e um filho. Vive no bairro Polana Caniço e tem o seu negócio de venda de roupa no mercado Xipamanine em Maputo. Faz as suas compras na Àfrica do Sul e na baixa da cidade de Maputo. Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro de 2007 e tomou de empréstimo 6.000MT. Vai voltar a tomar o mesmo valor para pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Van

texts.en: Mrs. Van Vannack, 28, and her husband, 25, live in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia with their child. Mrs. Van Vannack earns US$3 a day as a tailor, while her husband earns US$2.50 a day as a construction worker and a farmer. She would like to receive a loan of US$500 to purchase a water pumping machine and another plot of land to farm. This will help to boost the family's earnings by increasing the amount of vegetables her husband can grow and sell.

loans.use: Purchase of a water pumping machine and a plot of farm land

loans.name: Yim

texts.en: Mrs. Yim Phok, 34, and her husband, 33, live in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with their two children who are both students. The couple has a business selling clothes and grocery products, from which they earn US$6.50 a day. Yim Phok has applied for a loan of US$700, because she would like to increase the size of her inventory in order to more effectively meet the demand from her clients.

loans.use: Purchase of clothes and grocery items for sale

loans.name: Soa

texts.en: Mrs. Soa C., 50, is married, has six children, and lives with her husband in Prey veng province, Cambodia. She sells vegetables at an open-air market where she can typically earn about US$12.5/day in revenue. Her husband is currently employed at a local community, where he earns around US$2 a day, while one of their children works for Care (a local organization), earning US$100 a month. Another three of the couple's chilcren are students. Mrs. Soa C. has applied for a loan of US$1,000 to repair the leaks in their house, which is important because of the coming rainy season. She and her family are very grateful for all the lenders' trust and support.

loans.use: Repair of a house

loans.name: Horn

texts.en: Mrs. Horn S., 37, lives in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband, 38, and four children. One of their children works at a garment factory; the other three are students. Her husband is a moto-taxi driver who earns US$2.60 a day, while she earns US$2.50 a day selling vegetables at a local market. Mrs. S. intends to use the US$600 loan to buy more vegetables in order to meet the growing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of vegetables for inventory

loans.name: Nália Paulina

texts.pt:
Nália Paulina V. is a 30-year-old single mother of 2. She lives in the Guava area of Maputo and runs a beauty shop in the ‘3 de Fevereiro’ neighborhood. She entered the program in March of this year with an initial loan of 6,000 MT (meticais) which was properly repaid. She is entering her second cycle with a loan of 12,000 MT to be repaid in 8 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Nália Paulina V. tem 30 anos de idade e mãe solteira de 2 filhos. Vive no bairro Guava em Maputo e tem um salão de beleza no bairro 3 de Fevereiro. Entrou para o programa em Março do presnte ano com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT e comportou-se muito bem no reembolso. Vai para o 2º ciclo e vai tomar 12.000Mt para pagar em 8 meses.

loans.use: Purchase products for the business

loans.name: Sang

texts.en: Mrs. Sang P., 28, lives in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband, 38, and their three children who are all students. Mrs. Sang P. is a vendor selling rice-crops, while her husband currently works as a farmer and earns US$1 a day. She intends to use the loan of US$600 to buy a horse and a cart, so that her husband can start a business of transporting people from the village, thereby earning important additional income for the P. family.

loans.use: Purchase of a horse and a cart to operate a business

loans.name: Korng

texts.en: Mrs. Korng S. is a 45-year-old widow living in the Kampong Cham Province of Cambodia with her three children. She works as a market vendor, earning US$3 a day. Her two youngest children are students, while the oldest child helps Mrs. S. by working at the stall. Mrs. Korng S. would like to use the US$600 loan to purchase a cow to raise for sale, thus bringing the family additional income.

loans.use: Purchase of a cow

loans.name: Sath

texts.en: Mrs. Sath P. is a 29-year-old wife and mother of two. She works as a farmer in the Kampong Cham province of Cambodia, earning US$3 a day. Her husband is a taxi driver and earns US$7 a day. Mrs. Sath P. intends to use the US$500 loan to buy a new car for her husband, which will allow him to improve his transportation business.

loans.use: Purchase of a new car for a transportation business

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sath Phally has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Celeste Antonieta

texts.pt:
Celeste Antonieta M. is a 28-year-old married mother of 2. She lives in the Magoanine area and runs a clothing business in the Xipamanine market. She entered the program in May of this year with a loan of 6,000 MT (meticais). She paid back her first-cycle loan and is now seeking 8,000 MT to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Celeste Antonieta Matllombe tem 28 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de 2 filhos. Vive no bairro Magoanine e tem o negócio de venda de roupa no mercado de Xipamanine. Entrou para o programa em Maio do presente anocom um empréstimo de 6.000MT. Comportou-se bem no 1º ciclo e vai agora tomar 8.000MT para pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Increase stock

loans.name: Tati

texts.en: Tati H. is 45 years old and is married. She sells sandals on credit. She always goes around to other places besides her own village to find customers.  Her earnings from this business usually total around $22 per week. She is a new member of MBK and would like a $50 loan to buy more sandals and expand her business. She is willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: To buy more sandals and expand the business

loans.name: Titin

texts.en: Titin is a 42 year old mother of one child, aged 21. Her business is selling household goods such as cooking oil, rice, eggs, etc. Her husband, Maman works as a driver. Titin usually earns $1.50 per day in profit.  She is a member of MBK and needs a $50 loan to complete her shop. She is willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: Completing her small shop

loans.name: Tik

texts.en: Mrs. Tik T., 49, lives with her husband and five children in Preyveng province, Cambodia. She grows vegetables on her plantation, while her husband works as a teacher. Together, the couple earns around US$6 a day. One of their children is employed at a garment factory, earning US$60 a month; another three are enrolled in school. Mrs. Tik T. hopes to use the loan of US$400 to purchase ten piglets to raise and sell for profit about five months after purchase.

loans.use: Purchase of ten piglets to raise and sell for profit

loans.name: Suaebah

texts.en: Suaebah is 28 years old and is married. She has no children and lives with her family. She has a small shop and sells rice, snacks, vegetables, etc., and she usually earns $17 per day.
