Her husband, Ali, is a teacher and earns a small salary. Suaebah requests a $100 loan to buy some goods to complete the shop. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: To buy some goods

loans.name: Jumsiti

texts.en: Jumsiti is 45 years old and lives with her only son. Her husband passed away and now she is working on her own. She has a small shop and sells some foods and household goods.  She usually earns $5.50 per day and it's just enough for her daily needs. She requests a $100 loan to expand her business. Jumsiti is a member of MBK, and as a result, her business does increasingly well. She projects that she can earn $33 per day. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Endang

texts.en: Endang is 27 years old and is married. She sells rice and some fried foods such as fried chicken, potatoes, fish, fried snacks, and many more items. Her husband, Asep, is a musician in a group with an unfixed income. Endang has been running her business since she joined MBK, and can earn $17 per day. She needs a $100 loan for buying some food and to increase her capital. She hopes that this will increase her business and she is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy some food and increase the capital

loans.name: Jawiyah

texts.en: Jawiyah is 45 years old and is married with two daughters, aged 18 and 14. Her husband has no fixed income, and is only able to do odd jobs. Therefore, to contribute to her family's income, she sells food and snacks at her small kiosk. She usually earns $5.50 per day and it's not enough to cover her family's daily needs. She asks for a $75 loan to expand her business. Jawiyah is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy some food and increase the capital

loans.name: Khuon

texts.en: Mr. Khuon S., 35, lives with his wife and four children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He works near Chbar Am Pov market, driving a trailer to transport passengers passing by. He generally earns about US$7 a day, while his wife operates a grocery stand, earning around US$4 a day. The couple hopes to use the US$700 loan to expand their grocery stand's inventory, thus allowing them to better meet the growing customer demand.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products to meet growing customer demand

loans.name: Beatriz Fabião

texts.pt:
Beatriz Fabião M. M. is a 46-year-old married mother of 5 who lives in the George Dimitrov area of Maputo. She is a seamstress and runs her business out of her home. She entered the program in December of 2006 with an initial loan amount of 6,000 MT (meticais). She has paid back her previous loans and is now going into her third cycle for a loan of 10,000 MT to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Leo Duran, Kiva Volunteer.

Beatriz Fabião M. M. tem 46 anos de idade, é casada, mãe de 5 filhos e vive no bairro George Dimitrov em Maputo. É Costureira e tem o seu negócio na sua residência. Entrou para o programa em Dezembro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Comportou-se bem nos empréstimos anteriores e vai para om terceiro ciclo e pretende um empréstimo de 10.000MT para pagar em 5 meses.

loans.use: Invest in the business

loans.name: Lilis

texts.en: Lilis is 23 years old and is married with one child, aged 3. She sells clothes on credit, and requests a $100 loan to expand her business.  Some of the loan will be used for her husband's business, selling meat-balls in the market. They expect earnings of $33 - $35 per day and the profit will be used to buy more goods for their business. Lilis is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business and her husband's business

loans.name: Sou

texts.en: Mr. Sou S. (61) lives with his wife (52) in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Sou S. works on a farm, earning US$3 a day. He has applied for a loan of US$1,000 to help his wife run her grocery store. The store offers basic food items and drinks and currently earns US$15 a day in revenue. The loan will help her expand the range and quantity of products she sells.

loans.use: Purchase of inventory

loans.name: Sam

texts.en: Mrs. Sam K., 47, lives in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia with her husband and three children. One of her children is a mechanic, and the other two are students. Her husband works as a policeman and earns US$0.60 a day. Mrs. Sam K. earns US$6 a day, making and selling wine. They would like to help their son start his own motorcycle-repair business. A loan of US$1,000 will help him buy the necessary motorcycle spare parts..

loans.use: Purchase of motorcycle spare parts

payments.comment:
Congratulations! Sam Kunny has fully repaid this Kiva loan early.

Thank you for your support of Cambodian entrepreneurs. Lenders like you allow entrepreneurs around the world access to low-interest loans to finance their small businesses and support their families.

We hope you will continue your support by reinvesting in another Kiva entrepreneur.

Sincerely,
Isadora Tang, Kiva Fellow, Cambodia

loans.name: Nina

texts.en: Nina is a 27 year old mother of two children aged 8 and 3. She sells clothes on credit and some fabrics. She always goes around door to door to get customers, and collects the payments at the end of each month. She can earn $16 - $17 per week. Her husband is a driver in Jakarta and sends his wife some of his earnings, once a week. Nina is a member of MBK and asks for a $100 loan to expand her business, and earn more income for her children's education. She willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Mey

texts.en: Mrs. Mey S., 41, is married, has three children, and lives with her husband in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She is employed at a local garment factory, earning US$3 a day, while her husband is a construction worker, earning up to US$10 a day. One of the couple's children works at the garment factory as well, while the other two attend school. Mrs. Mey S. hopes to use the loan of US$1,200 to purchase construction tools for her husband, in order to make his job faster and easier.

loans.use: Purchase of construction tools

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok P., 28, lives with her husband and three children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Her three children are all too young to go to school. Sok P. and her husband work together raising pigs, ducks, and poultry, earning US$6 a day. She has applied for a loan of US$1,000 to be able to expand the size of the livestock. In addition, Mrs. Sok P. also plans to buy a motorcycle to cut the family's long-run transportation costs.

loans.use: Purchase of pigs for inventory expansion

loans.name: Eti

texts.en: Eti is 37 years and is married. She is a tailor, and has an opportunity to teach a tailoring course at home. Her husband has a small kiosk in the market, where he sells meat-balls in Bogor. They both work very hard for their children's education. Eti requests a $100 loan to buy all of the equipment needed for her business, such as raw material to make clothes. This will improve her business and make it more sustainable. She is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To buy raw materials and equipment

loans.name: Moa

texts.en: Mrs. Moa S., 42, lives with her husband, 44, and their two children in the Kampong Cham district of Cambodia. Moa S. herself is a tailor, earning US$2 a day. Her husband is a motor-taxi driver, also earning US$2 a day. Their two children are currently employed at a garment factory. Mrs. S. intends to use the loan of US$1,000 to purchase beauty products that her children could sell to their co-workers at the factory, thereby increasing the family's earnings.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products for sale

loans.name: Uum

texts.en: Uum is 28 years old and is married with no children. She lives with her parents, and operates a small shop in which she sells snacks. Working in the morning, she usually sells coconut milk rice and fried snacks. Her husband, Ucup sells vegetables in the market. She can earn $7.50 per day. Uum is a member of MBK and requests a $100 loan to expand her business so that she can increase her daily income.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Noviyanti

texts.en: Noviyanti is 25 years old and is married, with 1 child aged 4. Selling snacks is Noviyanti's business to supplement her family's income, usually earning $16 per day. Her husband, Heri, is a mechanic. Noviyanti is a member of MBK and asks for a $100 loan to expand her shop. The remainder will be used to improve her husband's business. She willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her shop and increase her husband's business

loans.name: Vasco Alfredo

texts.pt:
Vasco Alfredo D. is 45 years old, he is married and father of 7 children. They live in the neighborhood of Urbanização in Maputo. He makes and sells bricks from his home, he also operates a small grocery store. He joined the program in 2006, his first loan was of 6.000MT which he repaid on time. He is now in the 3rd cycle of the program and is requesting 15.000MT to be repaid in 9 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Vasco Alfredo D. tem 45 anos de idade, é casado e pai de 7 filhos. Vive no bairro Urbanização em Maputo e tem um pequeno estaleiro na sua residência no qual produz e vende blocos e tem também uma mini-mercearia. Entrou para o programa em Junho de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Comportou-se muito bem nos empréstimos anteriores em relação ao reembolso. Vai para o terceiro ciclo e vai tomar 15.000MT para pagar em 9 meses.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Saiyah

texts.en: Saiyah is 42 years old and is married. She is in the business of selling vegetables and snacks in her small shop. Her husband Ukar has an unfixed income. From her business, Saiyah can earn $16 per day. She needs a $125 loan to expand her business, and she intends to use some of the loan to improve her husband's business as well. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To expand her business and increase her husband's business

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti R. is 38 years old and is married. She sells clothes on credit and goes door to door to reach new customers. Her husband Junaidi sells machinery equipment. She needs $100 loan to buy more clothes and the rest will be used for her husband's business. She usually earns $16 - $17 per week, with a profit of about $3.50 per week. Siti hopes this loan will allow her to help her husband and supplement their incomes. She's a member of MBK and willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: Increase her husband's capital and their income

loans.name: Zumyati

texts.en: Zumyati is 33 years old and is married. She sells clothes on credit and almost all of her customers are her husband's friends at work. They buy shoes, shirts, or coats, and she usually earns $22.50 per week. Zumyati asks for a $100 loan to purchase more stock. She is a member of MBK and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To purchase more stock

loans.name: Rovshen

texts.en:
X. Rovshan was born in the city of Sumqayit. He is 37 years old and the father of two children. He currently lives with his family in Sumgayit, situated in the eastern part of Azerbaijan. He started his business in 2002 selling perfume and nail varnish.

With this business, he earned little money. The money was enough for only some of his family's basic needs. He had difficulty covering his family's other needs including medication, clothes, schooling etc.
 
At this moment, his best clients are young ladies who work at offices.  He needs $600 to buy silver goods and merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory and be able to offer clients greater variety and quality. 

With the income from his business, he will be able to support his children’s studies and help with the family’s expenses. He will repay the loan within 12 months.

loans.use: to buy silver goods and merchandise in order to have a bigger inventory

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 23, 2008)

loans.name: Siti

texts.en: Siti J. is 35 years old and is married. She sells rice, cooking oil, eggs and noodles, usually earning $33 per day. Her husband Oman is a motorbike taxi driver, so his income is not fixed. She needs a $100 loan to improve her shop and hopes that this will earn more income for her children's education. She is willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Berta David

texts.pt:
Berta David M. is 40 years old, she lives with her husband and child in the neighborhood of George Dimitrov in Maputo. Berta operates a small grocery store form her home, she joined the FDM program in 2004, and requested a loan of 18.000MT. She is now in the 5th cycle of the credit program and is requesting a loan of 10.000MT to be repaid in 6 months. Berta has noticed an improvement in her business, the increase in income has helped to improve the quality of life of her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Berta David M. tem 40 anos de idade, vive maritalmente e é mãe de um filho.Vive no bairro George Dimitrov em Maputo. Tem uma mini mercearia na sua residência. Entrou para o programa em 2004 como membro de grupo e tomou 1.800MT como primeiro empréstimo.Já vai no 5º ciclo como cliente individual e pretende tomar 10.000MT para pagar em 6 meses. Tem verificado crescimento do volume de negócio e os lucros têm ajudado a melhorar a casa e tem pago as prestações pontualmente.

loans.use: Aumento do Stock

loans.name: Nyai

texts.en: Nyai H. is 30 years old and is married. She sells snacks, cooking oil, eggs, noodles, and usually earns $33 per day. Her husband sells goats in the market, two days a week. He usually earns $130 per week with a $20 profit. She asks for a $50 loan to complete her shop and is willing to repay this loan.

loans.use: To complete the store

loans.name: Gonce

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Sulaymanova Gonca. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan-Armenian territory in the Gubadli region, which is situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. She lives in the city of Sumqayit. 

She is a business woman with a small used clothing business. She has dedicated many years of her life to this type of activity.  Her earnings go towards the family's expenses. She wants to improve her business and increase the number of clients and her income.  Therefore, she needs a $600 loan. Thanks to her wages, she can cover her children's education expenses.

loans.use: to expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Simah

texts.en: Simah is 45 years old and is married. She lives with her husband and all her children are grown and married. She sells snacks, candies, beverages, cigarettes, and other similar items. In the morning, she sells coconut milk rice and fried snacks together with her husband, earning $22.50 per day. She requests a $50 loan to complete her business and is willing to repay this loan within the loan period.

loans.use: To complete her store

loans.name: Rute Graça

texts.pt:
Rute Graça M. is 48 years old, she is a widow mother of 4 children. They live in the neighborhood of Polana Caniço in Maputo. She works as a seamstress, operates a beauty salon and sells clothes she buys from South Africa. She works from her home. Rute joined the program in January, she borrowed 6.000MT, she never missed a payment. She is the 3rd cycle of the program and is requesting a loan of 8.000MT to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Rute Graça M. tem 48 anos de idade, é viúva e mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro Polana Caniço em Maputo. É costureira, tem um salão de beleza e também vende roupa nova vinda da Àfrica do Sul. o Negócio está situado na sua residência.Entrou para o program em janeiro do presente ano com e tomou 6.000MT como 1º empréstimo e nunca teve qualquer atraso no reembolso dos empréstimos. Está no 3º ciclo e vai tomar 8.000MT para pagar em cinco meses.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.en: Boymurod S. is 40 years old, he has secondary education. After school he worked as a driver in an auto park. For four years he is making business, he sells vegetable and fruits in a market (potatoes, tomatoes, pepper, onion, carrot, brinjal, apple, pears, and grapes). He has a car which is appropriate for goods carrying so it is helping for his business. He buys vegetables and fruits straightly from fields at wholesale and sells them to sellers in a market.        For the loan amount he is going to buy vegetable and fruits and increase the turnover. This loan helps to local habitant obtain vegetable and fruits cheaper not far from their home. Client is going to pay off the loan amount for 6 months.

loans.use: buying of vegetable and fruits, increase the turnover

loans.name: Cicek

texts.en:
A. Cicek is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict in the Gubadli region, which is situated in the western part of Azerbaijan.  She lives in the city of Sumqayit. She is 41 years old and the mother of two children. 

She is busy with her business, trading mobile industry goods. She began her business with $300 in 2004. At first, she was selling industry goods and earned little money. This money was enough for only some of her family's basic needs. She had difficulty providing for her family's other consumption needs for medication, clothes, schooling etc.
 
She wants improve her business and increase the number of clients and increase her income.

Now, she needs $1000 loan. With this loan, Cicek wants to operate her business in the central market and expand her business. Cicek thinks that expansion of her business will directly improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 14 months. Cicek will repay her loan on a monthly basis. She is very grateful for your help.

loans.use: to open area of private trade for selling of the industry goods in the central market and expand her business

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: “I started this business of pop corn years ago and it has helped me take care of my family. I know how to manage my capital to ensure continuity in the business.”  These are the words of Mrs. Esther O.. She is a married mother of 7 children, and is 46 years old. She is a member of LAPO, and is requesting a loan of US$550 to buy another machine and more maize to improve sales.

loans.use: To buy an additional machine and maize for production

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Ana M. is 36 years old, she is the single mother of 4 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Infulene in Matola. Ana resells meat and beans which she buys bulk in Chicualacuala and in Swazilândia. She joined the FDM program in 2006, her first loan was of 6.000MT, she is now in the 4th cycle of the program and requests a loan of 15.000MT to be repaid in 6 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

na M. tem 36 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro do Infulene na Matola. É uma vendedora ambulante e vende diversos tipos de carnes as quais compra em Chicualacuala e na vizinha Swazilândia e, dependendo da época vende produtos agrícolas como é o caso de feijão.Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro de 2006 com um empréstimo inicial de 6.000MT. Está no 4º ciclo de empréstimo e vai tomar 15.000MT pgáveis em 7 meses.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Boymurod

texts.en: Boymurod S. is 40 years old and has a secondary education. After school he worked as a driver in an auto park. He has been selling vegetable and fruits in a market (potatoes, tomatoes, pepper, onion, carrot, brinjal, apple, pears, and grapes) foor four years. He has a car which is appropriate for carrying goods so it is helping for his business. He buys vegetables and fruits straight from the fields at a wholesale price and sells them to venders in the market. For the loan amount he is going to buy vegetable and fruits and increase his businesses sales. This loan helps local habitants to obtain vegetables and fruits for a lower price not far from their home. This client is going to pay off the loan amount in 6 months.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and fruits and to increase sales.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: She enjoys selling provisions and food items. She is optimistic that her business will improve if she is given a loan of US$475. Mrs. Elizabeth O. is 42 years old and is a married mother of 10 children. She is from Uromi in Edo State and has been with LAPO for the past 3 years.

loans.use: To buy more provisions and food items

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Mrs. Regina has five (5) children and is 35 years old. She owns a mother care shop (baby things) and has been in business for the past five years. Regina said her customers give her satisfaction, and she is seeking a loan of US$800 to buy more baby things for sales and to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy more baby things

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Mrs. Beatrice O. sells machine parts to the community. She started this business in 1995 after undergoing her 6 years of training. She is 29 years old and is married with 4 children. LAPO has made a difference to her business. She needs the loan of US$800 to buy more motorcycle spare parts for sale.

loans.use: To buy more machine spare parts for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase Breeder Sow - female pig (Membeli  Induk babi)

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Mrs. Esther A. is a business woman who specializes in the sale of ladies'  wear. She is 25 years old and she hails from Emu in Edo State. Esther has been in this business since 2004 and is a member of one of the LAPO unions. She is requesting a loan of US$625 to purchase more ladies' wear.

loans.use: To buy more ladies' wear

loans.name: Negmatullo

texts.en: Negmatullo S. is a 35 year old habitant of the Vakhdat district.  He is highly educated; he is married and has 3 children.  He is entrepreneur and has 8 years of experience in business.  He rents out a club for playing billiards. This is his main source of income.   For a loan of $1000, S. can purchase an additional billiard table so he can serve the high demand of the locals. In their free time, after their schoolwork and chores are finished, you adults spend their time at billiard clubs because there are no discos or movie theatres, or other entertainment in the village. S. was forward thinking enough to open up a billiards club so he could give young adults an activity to do, to socialize. This loan will help young adults spend their time in a safe and enjoyable area away from criminal activity. S. will pay off the loan in 10 months.

loans.use: To purchase a billiard table for his billiard club.

loans.name: Vigina

texts.en: Vigina is an experience business woman. She has been in the business of selling women's and babies wear for over 5 years. She is from Ubiaja, Edo State, Nigeria, and is excited to increase her business if she is given a loan of US$800. She is 45 years old, a mother of 5 children, and she has been with LAPO for the past 5 years.

loans.use: To buy more women's and babies' wear

loans.name: Goddey

texts.en: Goddey O. is 32 years old, and is married with 2 children. He sells baby things in his shop. This business is a source of income for the family. Goddey lives in Uromi, Edo State, and has been in business since 2003 and a member of LAPO for 4 years. Goddey hopes to receive a loan of US$550 so that he can buy more baby things for resale, improve his turnover, and thus his profits.

loans.use: To buy more baby things for sale

loans.name: Custódio Maurício

texts.pt:
Custódio Maurício D. S. lives in Mahotas in Maputo. He is married and father of 3 children. He sells charcoal from his home to support his family. He joined the FDM program in March of this year and requested a loan of 5.000MT which he repaid on time. He is now in the 2nd cycle of the program, he is requesting a loan of 10.000MT to be repaid in 5 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Custódio Maurício D. S. vive no bairro Mahotas em Maputo.É casado e pai de 3 filhos.Tem um negócio de venda de carvão em sacos na sua residência em Maputo.Entrou para o programa em Março do presente ano com um empréstimo inicial de 5.000MT. Está no 2º ciclo e vai tomar 10.000MT para pagar em 5 meses. Comportou-se bem no 1º ciclo e houve um amento no volume de negócios do cliente.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sanavbar

texts.en: Sanavbar R. is 39 years old and lives in the Yavan district. She has a secondary education.  After school graduation Sanavbar took a sewing course and started sewing for friends and family. Ten years ago she decided to start her own business. She rented a studio and sewed clothes. Her business has a very high demand because of her high quality and skill in sewing. She wants to expand her business.  For a loan of $800 she will purchase a new sewing machine so she will be able to sew curtains in addition to clothes. As of now, people must order curtains in town. If R. receives this loan however, she will be able to prove high quality curtains and save people money and time by providing these curtains in her district. R. will pay off the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine to sew a curtain.

loans.name: Abhulimen

texts.en: Abhulimen G. is 30 years old, married, and has 3 children. His business is a source of income for the family. He sells ladies wear in his shop, and he lives in Uromi, Edo State. He has been with LAPO for 2 years. Abhulimen hopes to receive a loan of US$550 to expand his business and help towards his children's education.

loans.use: To buy more ladies wear for sale

loans.name: Friday

texts.en: Friday is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. He is 30 years old and has a child. He sells bags of rice, beans, and provisions by wholesale. To keep the business growing as it has to this point, Friday is requesting a loan of US$625, which he will use to purchase supplies to meet his customers' demands.

loans.use: To buy more rice, beans and other provisions for sale

loans.name: Rosa Alexandre

texts.pt:
Rosa Alexandre P. is 29 years old, she is the single mother of 4 children. She lives in the neighborhood of Mavalane in Maputo. She resells chicken in the Mavalane market. Rosa joined the program in February of this year and requested a loan of 5.000MT which she repaid on time. She is the second cycle of the program and is requesting a loan of 8.000MT to be repaid in 8 months.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Rosa Alexandre P. tem 29 anos de idade, é solteira e mãe de 4 filhos. Vive no bairro de Mavalane em Maputo. Revende frangos no mercado de Mavalane. Entrou para o programa em Fevereiro do presente ano com um emprétimo inicial de 5.000MT com um bom desempenho em termos de reembolso. Está no 2º ciclo e vai tomar 8.000MT para pagar em 8 meses.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes A. is 35 years old and a married mother of 7 children. She is from Uromi, Edo State, Nigeria. To improve her family’s standard of living, Agnes decided to start her own business, and so she began selling cooked food. She started selling to her neighbours and other members of the community, but thanks to her quality of service she soon found success and increased her number of customers. If given the loan US$625 she hopes to expand her business by buying food items in bulk.

loans.use: To buy more food items for cooking

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: "I have been designing clothes for the past 5 years, and this business has helped me a lot with my family," says Mr. Gabriel I.. He is 48 years and has seven (7) children. As a member in one of the LAPO unions, he hopes to  receive a loan of US$325 so that he can buy another machine and sewing materials to make more clothes for his customers.

loans.use: To buy an additional machine and sewing materials

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.en: Mr. Benjamin O. is 45 years old, and has seven children. He has a lot of  experience farming, and acquired his knowledge from his father. Benjamin resides in Ubiaja, but he is a native of Igueben, in Edo State. He has been in the farming business since 1980. He is a dedicated LAPO client and has been a member of LAPO for 2 years. He is seeking a loan US$325 to expand his farm.

loans.use: To expand his farm

loans.name: Sarvinoz

texts.en: Sarvinoz K. is 22 years old, she has a secondary education.  Three years ago she started her business.  She has rented space and started selling.  At first it was just food, but lately she has also started dealing phone cards.  This kind of service has high demand and brings Sarvinoz good profits.  For the loan amount for $1200 she is going increase the range of foods she carries and start selling cell phones.  This loan will help Sarvinoz K. to achieve this growth.  Locals can buy food near where they live and can get cell phone service nearby.  The client is going to pay off the loan in 12 months.

loans.use: to increase revenue and expand business

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.en: Mercedes, 39, is running a little garage.  Her son (19 years old) is working as a mechanic in the business.  In addition to fixing pneumatic tires, she sells spare tires, lubricants, and spark plugs for both motorcycles and cars.  Every two weeks, Mercedes sends her son to Santo Domingo, the capital, to purchase the materials, especially lubricants, since it’s one of the most desired items.  On each occasion (every two weeks), she buys more or less US $50.00 and earns more than double that amount weekly.  Mercedes wants to keep purchasing products, but also wants to save money so she can provide her five children with a good education.  Her husband’s income is not sufficient to face those issues, since he’s working on the dustcarts, picking up the rubbish, and is not well paid. The entrepreneur is requesting a US $375.00 loan.

loans.use: To purchase articles to supply her garage.  She also needs money to provide food and education for her children

loans.name: Luisa

texts.pt:
Luisa A. was born in the province of Inhambane, she is a single mother of 6 children. The father of her children has a wife of his own. Luisa has always cares and provided her children on her own. She joined the FDM in 2006. Her first loan was of 125$ which she repaid in 3 months. Luisa is in the 4th cycle of the program, she is requesting a loan of 225$ to buy more goats to resell.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Luisa A. natural da Provincia de Inhambane,e solteira, mas tem 6 filhos. O pai dos filhos vive com a sua propria esposa. Luisa foi quem sempre cuidou dos filhos sozinha. Ela entrou para o Programa de Credito do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006. O primeiro emprestimo que tomou foi de $125 a serem pagos num prazo de 3 meses para a compra de cabritos para a revenda.Como o negocio esta-lhe a correr bem ela ja esta no quarto ciclo e pretende tomar agora $225 para aumentar o numero de cabritos a comprar, pois que a procura de cabritos aumentou e ela precisa de satisfazer a demanda em termos de procura destes animais, quer para consumo, quer para criacao por parte dos seus clientes.

loans.use: Buy more goats to sell

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a farmer by profession; he has farmland which he cultivates and harvests in order to sell his crops. He is proud to be a farmer. He learnt farming from his father.

Moses is from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria. Moses needs the loan of $325 for his farm maintenance.

loans.use: To maintain his farm

loans.name: Naya Garcia

texts.en: Naya is an example of a hardworking woman that makes the impossible happen when it’s about taking care of her family and ensuring their survival.  Naya is  34 years old, is a single mother and is living with four children.  She has to work hard to provide them with food and pay for their education.  After working for a long time for other people, she recently decided to start her own business.  Actually, she’s running a small store where she sells casual clothes, baby clothes and perfume.  Furthermore, early in the morning, she prepares foods and converts her store into a little cafeteria.  She purchases the clothes every two weeks from a salesman that brings them to her house.Her  plan is to keep investing the profit in the business.  She also wants to set aside money for any emergency or the needs of her children.  She has applied to borrow US $375.00 that she’ll repay in six months.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in the township and to save money for her children's needs.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en: Uktam N. is 41 years old. He is married and supports his three children. Currently he rents a small space at the market, where he sells foods. His shop is on a busy street, and he is the only food vendor in the area. Utkam will use the $1000 loan to expand the range of foods he can offer to his customers and give local habitants the opportunity to obtain quality foods close to home. Mr. N. will pay off the loan over a twelve month period.

loans.use: increasing turnover, to buy foods

loans.name: Marlene Simone

texts.pt:
Marlene lives her boyfriend in the village Patrice Lumumba near the city of Xai Xai. She has a small stand, where she sells basic groceries and home products. This is her first loan, she is requesting it to increase her inventory. In the future, she plans on helping her husband in improving their home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Marlene , nao e casada oficialmente, mas vive maritalmente com um homem. Ainda nao teve filhos. Ela vive na aldeia Patrice Lumumba um dos bairros suburbanos da cidade de Xai-xai, onde explora uma pequena loja chamada vulgarmente de barraca. Nessa pequena loja, ela vende produtos de primeira necessidade. este emprestimo que ela vai tomar e o primeiro. Ela precisa deste emprestimo para poder repor os produtos de primeira necessidade na sua pequena loja. Planos futuros se o negocio lhe correr bem ela pretende ajudar o marido na construcao de uma casa melhorada.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en: Francisca, 41, is married, without children.  Her husband owns a Moto Concho (motorbike taxi) and is working as a ‘taxi’ driver in the township.  She runs a small cafeteria that she started two years ago.  Spaghetti, fried fish, fruit juice, tostones (flattened fried plantains) are some of the things that can be found at her stand.  She opens the business early in the morning to attend to people that are going to work or going to school.  As a result of this activity, she has been able to help her husband face the housing problems.  However, since demand is growing, she is oftenin short supply.   She would like to be able to supply a larger amount of goods and sell more so that it will be easier for her to attend to her growing client base.  For that purpose, she is requesting an US $375.00 loan that she’ll repay in six months.

loans.use: To buy larger amounts of goods to prepare more food and sell more to clients.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael is a trader who makes his living selling childcare necessities. He has been in the business since 1980 and he is a dedicated LAPO client.

Michael is married with 7 children of his own. He hails from Igueben in the Edo State of Nigeria.

He wishes to expand his business by buying more wears for sale. To do this, he is requesting a loan of $400.

loans.use: To increase his inventory

loans.name: Soraya

texts.en: Most of the time, they say that young people do not have plans for their future, or they are all wasting their time in unavailing things.  That’s the case for some people, but if you meet Soraya N., you’ll see something totally different. Soraya is an 18 year old girl. She lives with her mother and her two sisters. Her father doesn’t only have her family to support; he also has some other children from another woman, a fact that makes the situation much more complicated for Soraya’s family. 2 years ago, she started with a lunchroom where she sells food to people in the surrounding area and that helped her a lot. Now, she earns around $34 daily working in her small cafeteria. She’d like to sell even more things in the cafeteria and that’s the reason she hopes to borrow US $375.00. She’ll repay it in 6 months.

loans.use: To purchase more goods for her cafeteria.  And help her mother face housing issues

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Mr. Michael O. is a 57 year old man. He is married with 14 children, and he lives in Ubiaja, Edo State, Nigeria. He specializes in the milling of cassava for the community. He started his business in 1989 after 6 months of training.

Michael has been an LAPO client for 2 years. He now hopes to improve his milling business with a loan of $325.

loans.use: To improve his milling business

loans.name: Ismoil

texts.en: Ismoil N. is 47 years old and he is in the business of stocking cattle. He received a secondary education and supports his wife and 5 children. Ismoil has been stocking cattle for 10 years, and he will use the 1,000 loan to purchase three bull-calves. By adding to his stock of cattle, he will be able to supply his community for reasonable prices. Mr. N. will pay off the loan over a twelve month period.

loans.use: buying three bull-calves

loans.name: Amelia Carlos

texts.pt:
Amelia is a single mother. She lives with her son, she is young and with the help of her parents she was able to re-open a store that had been abandoned during the war. She joined the FDM fund in 2006, her first loan was of 250$ to open the small grocery store. Now Amelia is requesting a loan of 1.050.00$ in order to increase her inventory. This loan will be repaid in 6 months. Because the business has been doing well she has been able to improve the diet of her family, she plans on making sure her son attends school and finding a husband to complete her family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Amelia e mae solteira. Vive com o seu filho. Jovem muito dinamica, com o seu trabalho e o apoio dos pais conseguiu reabilitar uma antiga loja abandonada durante o periodo da guerra na sua zona de origem. Ela entrou para o programa de credito do Fundo de Desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2006 , tendo tomado nessa altura $250 para investir na mercearia.Ela agora pretende tomar $1,050.00 para poder comprar produtos nos armazens para rechear a sua mercearia. Ela pretende devolver este emprestimo em 6 meses.Porque o negocio esta a correr bem ela melhorou a sua dieta alimentar principalmente a de seu filho. que e um rapazinho bonito e saudavel, pois que a mae consegue suprir todas as suas necessidades.Planos futuros sao; assegurar uma educacao de qualidade para o seu filho e se tudo correr bem encontrar um homem com que case e constitu familia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Sadriddin

texts.en: Sadriddin H. is 36 years old, and has a secondary education. He is married and has four children. Fifteen years ago, Sadriddin started his own business. In the beginning, he sold food near his home. Later, he rented out a center in his local district, and began selling food from his own market. He currently has women’s clothing, kids’ toys, and office supplies. Sadriddin would like a loan of $1000 to increase his business turnover and the variety of his food products. Locals within the area would have the opportunity to purchase foods from Sadriddin’s market, which would not only increase their convenience, but also save them transport expenses.

loans.use: to increase turnover, trough buying and selling food

loans.name: Ayo

texts.en:
Ayo O. is 45 years old and married with 9 children. She lives in Uromi, Edo State of Nigeria.

Ayo sells food to people living in her community. She learnt her trade when she received 2 months of training, after which she started her own business in 2005.

Ayo has been an LAPO client for 3 years. She wishes to expand her business with the loan of $475.

loans.use: To buy more food items

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mrs. Mabel I. is 35 years old and married with 3 children. She has her own store. Mabel learnt her trade through 2 years of training. She started her own business in 2004. She says her business enabled her to assist her children and husband.

She is requesting a loan of $475 to buy more bags, shoes and clothes to sell in her shop.

loans.use: To buy more shoes, bags and wrappers for sale

loans.name: Pascoa Joao

texts.pt:
Pascoa is married and mother of 5 children. She helps with the household income. Her husband is a works at a shoe repair shop and does not earn a lot. She wants to make sure her children attend school, get medical attention and eat a balanced nutrition. She joined the program in the beginning of this year. Her first loan was of 125$. Now she is requesting a loan of 225$ to buy more inventory for her business and save.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga Kiva Volunteer.

Pascoa e casada e mae de 5 filhos. Ela faz o negocio para poder comparticipar nas despesas da casa. pois o marido nao recebe muito dinheiro, pois que e sapateiro e os 5 filhos precisarem de estudar, ter uma boa alimentacao, ter assistencia medica. Ela entrou para o Programa de Credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher no inicio deste ano. na altura ela tomou um emprestimo de valor igual a $125. Ela agora pretende tomar $225 para poder incrementar o seu pequeno negocio que e feito no quintal de sua residencia e assegurar uma boa poupanca para os momentos mais criticos de sua vida em termos financeiros.

loans.use: Increase Inventory

loans.name: Jerryson

texts.en:
Jerryson is an enterprising man. He started his own business selling maize to poultry farmers, which they use as feed for raising birds. He has been in this business since 1997. Jerryson is 41 years old and he has one child.

To imrpove his business and get more goods to keep his customers satisfied, Jerryson is requesting a loan of $550, which he plans to repay within eight months.

loans.use: To buy more maize for sale

loans.name: Theresa

texts.en: Theresa A. is a businesswoman who sells wrappers and other clothing for women. She is 42 years old and married with five children. Theresa has been a client of LAPO for the past 4 years. She hopes to expand her business with the loan she is requesting for $550.

loans.use: To buy more female wrappers and shoes for sale

loans.name: Matilde Ernesto

texts.pt:
Matilde is a single mother. She lives with her 3 children. She joined the Women's fund development project in 2005 in hopes to be able to support her children since she does not receive assistance form the father. Her first loan was of 35$, which she invested in the used clothes business. Matilde started selling cooking pans as her business grew. Now she is requesting a loan of 225$ to introduce selling corn to her business. She lives in a neighborhood close to the capital city. Matilde has started the construction of a small house for her family. With the income from the selling of clothes, cooking pans and soon corn she wants to guarantee that her children are able to attend school.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Matilde e mae solteira e tem 3 filhos. Ela vive sozinha com os seus filhos. Ela entrou para o programa de Credito do Fundo de desenvolvimento da Mulher em 2005, para poder criar condignamente os seus filhos uma vez que os pais nao se responsabilizam por nenhum deles. O primeiro emprestimo que ela tomou foi de $35 para aplicar no negocio de venda de roupa usada apenas. Mas a medida que o negocio ia prosperando ela foi diversificando as suas vendas,iniciou para alem da venda de roupa usada a venda de panelas que ela comprava em armazens na cidade capita. Agora ela pretende tomar de emprestimo $225.00 para poder introduzir mais um produto no rol das suas vendas que e o milho. Ela vive num dos bairros perifericos da cidade capital. Com os rendimentos ela iniciou a construcao de uma casa melhorada feita com material convencional embora pequena. Principalmente garantir os estudos dos seus filhos.

loans.use: To increase onventory

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en: Shahnoza R. is 22 years old. She is single, and has some professional education. After she graduated, she entered a college. She graduated later after successful completion, and started work in a barbershop. Step by step, she began increasing her hair cutting skills and consequently decided to open her own business. Currently, she rents a room in a district center, and provides her services there. The prices for her service is much lower than the other barbershops in the surrounding area. Her work there serves as her main source of income. Shahnoza would like a loan to increase the number of rooms in her business, and also renew the equipment she has. Shahnoza plans to return her loan within 12 months.

loans.use: for barbershop repair and buying necessary equipment for hair cutting and hair-dye

loans.name: Francisca

texts.en:
Francisca is an industrious woman. She has been in the business of hair-dressing for over 5 years. Francisca's salon business is a source of income for her family.

Francisca has been an LAPO client for 4 years. She hopes to get a loan of $400 to buy more hair equipment and other items such as hair relaxer, cream and weavon for her salon.

loans.use: To buy more hair dressing equipment  & other items such as hair relaxer, cream and weavon

loans.name: Horacio Juliao

texts.pt:
Horacio is married, father of 2 small children. He lives in a neighborhood near the capital city. He learned the craft of repairing shoes, now he is also able to make them. Horacio's first loan was of 125$ which he invested in buying tools for his shop. Now he is requesting another loan to buy materials to assemble shoes. His business is growing because a lot of clients want to have new shoes made. With the income from his business he wants to build a home for his family.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Horacio e casado e tem 2 filhos ainda menores. Ele vive num bairro periferico da cidade capital. Ele aprendeu o oficio de sapateiro. inicialmente apenas arranjava sapatos estragados .Depois passou a fabricar chinelos e sapatos. inicialmente ele tomou $125 para a compra de algumas ferramentas para o seu oficio. Agora ele precisa de tomar este emprestimo para poder comprar materia prima para o fabrico de chinelos e sapatos de acordo com a exigencia dos seus clientes. O seu negocio esta a crescer,pois que e grande o numero de clientes que o procuram para mandar fazer sapatos ou chinelos. Com os rendimentos do seu negocio pretende construir uma casa feita de material convencional onde os seus filhos terao boas condicoes relativamente as que tem agora.

loans.use: To buy material to make and repair shoes

loans.name: Rezent

texts.en:
Rezent U. is 48 years old and married with ten children. He’s one of the very active old farmers in his community. His farm is the main source of income for his family. Rezent started his business in the year 2000. He is from Ubiaja village of Edo State, Nigeria.

Rezent is requesting a loan of $800 for the expansion of his farm.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for planting

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy products for the salon

loans.name: Pabla

texts.es:
Mrs. Pabla G. is 40 years old and is married to Mr.Zacarias Zeballos. They have three children that are excellent students at school.

Pabla is dedicated to dressmaking and tailoring and her husband is a baker. Both of them contribute to the household income and share the expenses. Previously, she used to work as an employee at a dressmaking shop for three years and after saving money, Pabla opened her own dressmaking and tailor shop. Thanks to her hard work she was able to acquire her own house.

The credit that she is asking for will be invested in buying different types of fabrics at wholesale prices like: silk, cotton, lycra, etc. In the future she wishes to expand her shop and be able to offer more products to the market.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Pabla tiene 40 años ella está casada con el señor Zacarías Zeballos y tienen tres hijos todos son excelentes estudiantes. La señora Pabla se dedica a la confección de ropas y el señor se dedica a la panadería, ambos aportan con los ingresos de la casa y comparten los gastos. Anteriormente ella trabajaba como empleada en un taller de costura, hace tres años y luego de juntar unos ahorros, Pabla, abrió su propio taller de costura, y gracias a su trabajo logro obtener su casa propia . El crédito solicitado es para invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de telas de diferentes tipos, seda, algodón, lycra, etc. En el futuro ella desea ampliar su taller de costura y salir con más productos en el mercado.

loans.use: Buying fabrics at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Esther Friday

texts.en:
"I learnt the act of farming from my late father and started mine in the year 1983," says Mrs. Esther Friday I.. She hails from Ubiaja of Edo State, Nigeria.

Esther Friday has a farm where she cultivates yams, cassavas, plantains and fruits. After harvest, she takes her produce to the market to sell. She is 38 years old and a mother, married, with 7 children.

Esther Friday is requesting a loan of $550 to boost her farming business.

loans.use: To buy more seeds for planting

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
"Being a LAPO member is not a mistake for me. I have been with LAPO for 4 years as a member of LAPO union. I hope to improve my business with the $550 loan," says Mr. Rose I.. Rose would use the loan to purchase a machine to help her with the harvest.

Rose is married with 8 children. She is 40 years old and she lives in Ubiaja town in Edo State.

loans.use: To buy a machine to harvest crops

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
Mrs.Jovita C. is 53 years old and is married to Mr. Arnulfo Robles. They have 5 grown children and come from a very humble family. Her mother used to work at the same line of business (butcher shop) and her dad use to work in construction.

Jovita has a small butcher shop where she exclusively sells cow's giblets ( intestines, tongue, liver, heart, etc.). With her work, she has been able to educate her children who actually study and work. The income generated by her business has not been enough to give her the possibility to invest on her home. She has applied for credits of the Fundacion Paraguaya before and was able to buy a truck that helps her sell her products in different cities.

Today, she is eager to acquire a new loan which she will like to invest in repairing her house. That way she can have a better selling location for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Maria Ramirez-Gregg, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Jovita C. tiene 53 años está casada con el señor Arnulfo Robles, tienen cinco hijos mayores, provienen de una familia muy humilde, su madre se dedicaba a la misma actividad y su padre se dedicaba a la construcción de obras. Jovita tiene una pequeña carnicería donde vende exclusivamente menudencia de vaca (tripas, lengua, hígado, corazón, etc.) Con su trabajo logro educar a sus hijos quienes actualmente estudian y trabajan , ya que los ingresos generados con su trabajo no le da la posibilidad de invertir en su vivienda, ella ha solicitado créditos de la Fundación Paraguaya con anterioridad, y con los que pudo comprar una camioneta con la que sale a vender sus productos en diferentes ciudades. Hoy día ella está deseosa de adquirir un nuevo préstamo que desea invertirlos en la refacción de su casa, para así lograr tener un salón de ventas mejor ubicado.

loans.use: Repair the infrastructure of her shop.

loans.name: Adelia Arao

texts.pt:
Adelia is not married. She lives with her 5 children and their father. She sells coconuts in the markets of XaiXai. She buys the coconuts in bulk from Inhambe. This is her first loan, she wants to be able to buy more coconuts in bulk to resell. The coconuts are substitutes to peanuts in her region and are then essential in local cooking.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Adelia e solteira.Vive maritalmente com um homem de quem tem 5 filhos.Ela dedica-se a venda de cocos num dos mercados da cidade de Xai-xai, Esse coco ela adquire na Provincia de Inhambane uma das Provincias que tem um Palmar enorme.E o promeiro emprestimo que ela vai tomar, para poder aumentar as quantidade de coco que ela tem adquirido. O coco substitui o amendoim, dai o facto de ser muito procurado para a confeccao de alimentos.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Naile

texts.en:
The lady in the photo is Allahverediyeva Naile. She is a refugee from the Azerbaijan- Armenian conflict in the Gubadli region, which is situated in the western part of Azerbaijan. Right now she lives in the city of Sumqayit. She is 50 years old and the mother of 4 children. She is a business woman. She sells women's shoes in the market. 

In 2004, Naile borrowed $300 from Normicro and expanded her business by buying more shoes. The next time, she borrowed $600 and repaired her business premises which increased the number of clients and her income. She buys her inventory from the Baku Airport wholesale market, making purchasing trips three times a month.

Currently, she needs a $1000 loan. With this loan Naile will to expand her business premises and buy modern styles of men and women's shoes. She believes that this change will increase her monthly income help her provide for necessary family consumption needs. 
Naile thinks this expansion will improve the living conditions of her family. She will repay the loan within 14 months. Naile will repay her loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: to expand her business of selling modern styles of shoes

payments.comment: scheduled_repayment (late autopay posting for Norwegian Microcredit LLC (Normicro) - Oct 22, 2008)

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
"I acquire[d] the act of farming from my father and started up mine in the year 1968," says Mr. Stephen A.. He is a native of Ewatto, in the Edo State of Nigeria. He is 49 years old and a married man with 8 children.

Stephen has been with LAPO for 1 year. He needs the loan of $550 to expand his farm and thereby improve his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy more seedling and help with the maintenance of the farm

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander is married with a grown daughter. His family lives in Primorsk. Alexander has a small business in the central market selling food items. His business boasts fresh groceries, reasonable prices, flexible and quality client service, and uniqueness and variety of merchandise. Alexander works hard to develop his business and make his business profitable. Currently, he has about $4000 in inventory. His turnover capital is about $3500. Net profit is about $1000.     

Alexander is requesting a loan of $1200 to reconstruct and modernize his vending pavilion, increase turnover capital, and purchase an assortment of goods for retail sale. He knows there are many vegetarians in Primorsk and they are some of his most loyal customers. Alexander has personal goals too. He is planning to use the generated profit to buy a new vehicle and  remodel his private house. Alexander is a conscientious and focused manager of his resources and always plans his time and finances. In all his business dealings, he is guided by a sense of trust and goodwill towards others. We believe these qualities will help him repay his loan without any delinquencies.

loans.use: To reconstruct his vending facility and increase on stock

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a mechanic living in Bourj Barajneh, in the suburbs of Beirut. Ali is 54 years old and married with five children. He relies on the modest income from his garage to cover the basic needs of his family members. Nevertheless, Ali is a hardworking person who has already borrowed four times from Majmoua and always repaid on time. This time, again, Ali needs an amount of USD $1,200 to purchase engine oil and car tires for his business.

loans.use: Buy a stock of new tires and engine oil

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is single with a son. She lives in Izyum and works in the central market. Raisa owns a toy store and a container-store selling children’s footwear. She loves kids and toys. Raisa is the only entrepreneur who has a neat little store selling all different kind of toys and inventory for kids in the local market which attracts many customers to her business. Raisa has been in the business for five years. Her business is characterized by stability and consistency. The client believes her venture has benefited a lot from Nadiya Ukraine loans. Currently, Raisa has about $2000 in inventory. Her monthly income is about $400.     

Raisa would like to get a bigger loan amount for longer term. That is why she is requesting a loan of $1000 to increase her turnover capital, purchase more inventory wholesale and offer a wider variety of merchandise for sale in her stores. Her ultimate goal is to meet every need of her little inventive customers of different age groups. Eventually, Raisa is planning to buy a small van which would make it easier for her to transport merchandise from the wholesalers.

loans.use: Increase turnover capital

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en: Zainab M. has six children with her seventh on the way.  At thirty-seven years of age, Zainab works hard to see that the children have an education and food to eat.  Assisted by her husband, she is engaged in selling plastic sandals in the market town of Makeni in Sierra Leone.  Due to lack of space, Zainab sells her goods on a rented veranda in the open air.    The business is the sole source of income for the family. Zainab plans to expand her business and later make a table for the business items.

loans.use: Expansion of her inventory of shoes for greater profits

loans.name: Alla

texts.en:
Alla is single and lives in Kahovka and has a small business there. She sells footwear in the local market. Alla has been in this trade for four years. Presently, she has about $2000 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1000. Monthly net profit is about 350. 

Alla would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase her turnover capital and her sales. Despite all the major challenges she had faced in her business Alla didn’t give up and is determined to press on with her business and achieve real success as a small entrepreneur. Today her mind is filled with many new ideas of how to make her business bigger and better and is planning for the long-term. Alla is hoping to use the loan to fulfill some of her dreams by promoting growth of her business.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes wholesale

loans.name: Carmelia Mario

texts.pt:
Carmelia is married and mother of a small daughter. Her husband is unemployed and works on small temp jobs. Carmelia needs to work to help support the family, especially her daughter. She joined the credit program this year. This is her second loan. She needs this loan in order to increase her shoe and tableware inventory. If her business continues to do well, Carmelia plans on saving and improving her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Carmelia e casada e tem uma filha menor. O marido e desempregado vive a base de pequenos expedientes aqui e acola. Por isso ela precisa de fazer qualquer coisa para apoiar nas despesas da casa e para poder ter com que comprar alimentos para a sua filha principalmente.Ela entrou para o programa de credito no inicio deste ano. Este emprestimo que ela vai tomar e o segundo. Ela quer aumentar as quantidades de louca e calcado para poder satisfazer a demanda dos seus clientes. Se o negocio continuar a correr-lhe bem ela pensa empregar parte dos rendimentos na melhoria da sua residencia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana P. is married with two teenage kids. She lives in the town of Kahovka. Tatyana owns a vending kiosk selling footwear in the local market. She has been in this trade for two years. Currently, Tatyana has $1500 in inventory. Her turnover capital is about $1000. Monthly net profit is about $250.  

Tatyana’s life motto is simple: “Integrity and treating people exactly as you would like to be treated.” Probably this is why she has succeeded in her business. However, Tatyana doesn’t want to stop at this stage and wants to move on and focus her energy on growing and expanding, either by introducing new products or increasing the sales area. That is why she is requesting this loan of $400 and is hoping to repay it in two months.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes wholesale

loans.name: Muhamed Lamin

texts.en: Muhamed sells adult clothes and shoes in Makeni Town.  He has been running this business for the last six years.  Muhamed is thirty-six years old and married with three children.  He is the sole income earner for the family.  He also assists his brothers and sisters with their education.  Muhamed would like to expand his business by including children’s clothes.  He is requesting a loan of US$ 200 for this purpose.

loans.use: Diversify his clothing shop by adding children's clothing

loans.name: Mustafa

texts.en: Mustafa K. is twenty-seven years old with three children.  He has been running his business for 9 years, even continuing during the civil war.  Married with three children, Mustafa had no opportunity for education.  He is therefore determined to provide a good education for his children.  With his previous loan, he was able to increase his stock and his profit.  He would like to involve his wife in his business and therefore is requesting a loan of US$ 200, to expand the business.

loans.use: Increase his clothing inventory so that he can expand his business

loans.name: Yuliya

texts.en:
Yuliya is married with a 10-year-old daughter. Her family lives in the town of Kahovka. Yuliya runs a small business selling women’s lingerie in the local market. She has been in this business for 10 years. Presently, her turnover capital is about $1000. Her monthly net profit is $350. 

Being a successful entrepreneur, Yuliya focuses on profits. She always has the profit margin in sight and knows that her business success is measured by profits. That is why Yuliya is requesting a loan of $500 to re-stock her inventory, attract more customers, and generate additional profit. She believes financial assistance will not only help her expand her business but also reach personal success and stability.

loans.use: To purchase new inventory

loans.name: Anatolyi

texts.en:
Anatolyi is married with grown children. She lives in Kahovka and sells footwear in the local city market. It has always been difficult for Anatolyi to meet the needs of his family. He has worked hard to provide even for the most basic needs but his salary was not sufficient. That is why Anatolyi decided to try his luck in business. He has been in the trade for five years. Currently, Anatolyi has about $3000 in inventory. His turnover capital is about $1000. Monthly net profit is about $350.    

Anatolyi would like to get a loan of $1200 to increase inventory and boost his sales. We believe his natural ability to think through to what is the most essential and make quick and wise decisions will help him succeed and repay the current loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase new shoes wholesale

loans.name: Bintu

texts.en:
Thirty-year-old Bintu is the mother of two children and has been running her clothing business for the last six years. Bintu is engaged in selling children's clothes and said her business increased tremendously after the previous loan. She sells out of a temporary shelter in the Makeni market.

In the future Bintu would like to repair the shelter she uses to conduct her business in, and right now she is requesting a loan of US$ 200 to increase her stock to have plenty of goods to sell during the Idi, (the Muslim festival that ends the month of Ramadan) next month.

loans.use: Expansion of business inventory to meet impending client demand

loans.name: Martina Ernesto

texts.pt:
Martina is married and mother of 2. Her husband is a miner and works in a neighboring country. Martina cares for her children and home. She joined the credit program in 2006, her first loan was of $125. She invested in her small business of making school lunches. Martina saved the income from the lunches and has decided to begin contruction of her first home. She is requesting a loan of $500 to buy construction mateiral. Martina is determined and hard-working. She continues to work in her school lunch business.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Martina e casda e tem 2 filhos. O seu marido e mineiro e trabalha num Pais vizinho. Martina e que cuida dos filhos e da casa a maior parte do tempo. Ela entrou para o programa em 2006. tendo tomado pela primeira vez, $125 para investir no seu pequeno negoci na altura que era o do fornecimento de lanches numa cantina escolar. Porque o negocio lhe corria bem ela foi subindo gradualmente de valor. Com os lucros do fornecimento de lanches juntando com outras economias ela resolveu iniciar a construcao de sua residencia que era de material precario. Assim ela quer tomar os $500 para a compra do material de construcao para a sua residencia em construcao. Martina e uma mulher determinada e empreendedora. Ela continua fornecendo lanches na escola com a qual assinou um acordo.

loans.use: Martine needs this loan to build her home

loans.name: Onisa

texts.en:
Onisa is thirty-two years old and married with a child. He runs a general merchandise business in the market of Makeni, in Sierra Leone. Onisa says he started the business at the age of twenty-two as he could not continue with his education. The business was small, but with the previous loan from SMT, it has grown to the current level and he is now able to rent a kiosk as business premises.

Onisa would like to increase his inventory to be able to generate more profits. For this purpose, he is requesting a loan of US$ 200.

loans.use: Continued expansion of his general store

loans.name: Salley

texts.en:
Salley is twenty-six years old with four children. With her husband being unemployed, life is not easy for Salley. She has been running her business for the last five years without capital of her own. Her last loan enabled her to diversify her business.

Salley now sells palm oil but with many family expenses to cater for, she has not been able to build up suficient capital. She desperately needs a loan of US$ 200 to purchase seventy gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.use: Purchase palm oil  wholesale for resale

loans.name: Musa

texts.en:
Musa has been in business for more than six years. Married with two children, the twenty-nine-year-old is the only breadwinner for the family. He also cares for his father’s family.

Musa said “The school fees for my children and my brothers are the biggest expense I incur from the income I get from the business.” He went on saying that he doesn't mind spending so much on education because this is an investment for a better life in the future.

Musa is planning to extend his market to a nearby village and therefore is requesting a loan of US$ 200.

loans.use: Expansion of his business to a nearby village to increase profits for his family

loans.name: Ale

texts.en:
"Farming work is something I enjoy doing. I learnt the act from my father and today my father is very proud of me. In 1985 I started my own farming business with a small farm land and now I have a big plot of land for my farm and there are all kinds of crops in my farm," says Mr. Ale O.. Ale is 55 years old and a married man with 5 children.

He is requesting a loan of $550 to buy more seeds for cultivation and to help maintain his farm.

loans.use: To buy more seedling and help with the  maintenance of his farm

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en: Hawa is the mother of two children and a widow. At twenty-eight years of age, she started her business five years ago, after she lost her husband.  She is engaged in the selling of African print materials and plastic sandals.  Her previous loan from SMT increased her stock but, being the sole breadwinner, she needs still more capital to expand her business in order to generate more income from it.  She is requesting a loan of US$ 200.

loans.use: Expand her working capital to get more profits from her business

loans.name: Bilal

texts.en: Bilal is a very ambitious young man with amazing selling skills. He is 27 years old, lives in Bourj Barajneh in the suburbs of Beirut, and has been working in the clothing industry for the past 10 years. He was able  to expand his small business, over the year, into a well-known shop in the neighborhood. Bilal is a fashion addict and he observes carefully the new fabrics, colors, and trends of the year. Bilal needs a loan for an amount of USD $1,200 in order to buy inventory of clothes for the new season.

loans.use: Purchase inventory of new clothes for the winter season

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Mrs. Florence O. is 50 years old and married with 6 children. She sells retail and wholesale garri and beans in the market. She learnt her trade from her friend. She has been in this business since 1996 and has been an LAPO client for 2 years. She hopes to buy more garri and beans for resale with the loan of $625 that she is requesting.

loans.use: To buy garri and beans in wholesale

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María B. is 34 years old, separated, and has an 8-year old daughter. They live in the house of María’s parents with her other siblings. María buys and sells merchandise such as clothing for women, men, and children; sports footwear, cellular phones and domestic electronics. She has a vehicle that she uses to transport and sell her merchandise throughout the neighborhoods and cities. María wishes to acquire more merchandise as she begins to expand and sell in new areas. Also with the new season approaching from spring to summer, she hopes to receive a loan of $1000 in order to purchase more merchandise at the best price.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora María B. tiene 34 años, es separada y tiene una hija de 8 años, ellas viven en la casa paterna con varios otros hermanos. María se dedica a la compra y venta de artículos de mercería tales como ropas para damas, caballeros y niños; calzados deportivos, celulares e inclusive electrodomésticos; ella tiene un vehículo con el que sale a realizar ventas por los barrios y ciudades así como también las cobranzas diariamente. María desea adquirir mayor mercaderías ya que está abriendo nueva zona de ventas y por la nueva temporada primavera-verano, para ello solicita un crédito de $ 1000 con los que podrá comprar más y a mejor precio las mercaderías.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise such as tops, pants, shirts, shoes, sportswear, children clothing, etc.

loans.name: Quiteria Luciano

texts.pt:
Quiteria just joined the credit program. This is her first loan, that is why the amount is small. She is a single mother of 5 children. She works selling clothes to support her children who are all in school. She has been in this business for a long time, but she wants to increase her inventory and try to increase her income.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Quiteria acaba de entrar para o programa de credito. esteb sera o primeiro emprestimo que ela vai tomar. Por isso o valor ainda e relativamente baixo. Ela e mae solteira e tem 5 filhos. Ela se dedica a venda de artigos de vestuario., para poder sustentar os seus filhos pois que todos estao em idade escolar. Seu marido lhe abandonou faz tempo. Por isso ela e chefe do agregado familiar.Ela ja se dedicava a este negocio deste ha muito. Mas agora ela quer reforcalo. Dai o ter recorrido ao emprestimo.

loans.use: Quiteria needs this loan to increase her inventory and keep up with demand from her customers

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23 year old young man living in Bourj Barajneh, in the suburbs of Beirut.
He opened a wholesale charcoal business two years ago and has been constantly expanding his business since then. This is the first time Ahmad approaches Majmoua to request a loan. He needs an amount of USD $1,200 to purchase a new stock of charcoal.

loans.use: Buy charcoal stock

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Mr. Emmanuel O. sells charcoal in Ubiaja, Edo State of Nigeria. He learnt the trade over 2 years after which he started his business in 1997. He is 36 years old and married with four children.

Emmanuel sells charcoal in an open-air market to people in the community. He hopes to get the loan of $400 to buy more trees for the production of charcoal in order to foster his business.

loans.use: To buy more trees for charcoal production

loans.name: Flavia Alexandre

texts.pt:
Flavia is a single mother of 4 children. She joined the credit program in 2006. Her first loan was of $125, which she invested in her business. She added a small restaurant to her store this has generated a lot of goods responses. This loan will be repaid in 4 months. Flavia is determined and very driven as an entrepreneur.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Flavia e mae solteira, vive com os seus 4 filhos.. Ela entrou para o Programa de Credito em 2006 e o primeiro emprestimo que ela tomou foi de $125, para poder investir no negocio da loja. por um periodo de 2 meses. Porque o negocio estava a correr bem decidiu introduzr outra variante no seu negocio que e o do fornecimento de refeicoes a todos que visitem a localidade onde ela vive. Portanto montou um pequeno restaurante onde fornece refeicoes..O emprestimo que ela vai tomar e o sexto. e vai reembolsa-lo em 4 meses. Flavia e uma mulher determinada e empreendedora.. Tem um bom caracter.

loans.use: Flavia requests this loan in order to increase her inventory in her small store in Quissico

loans.name: Jorge Enrique

texts.en:
Jorge Enrique is 24 years old, with lots of energy and a strong desire to prosper not only in his personal life, but his professional one as well. He has just finished his University degree and has dedicated himself to equipping a new space to start his own business and to offer his architectural services to his town, but he has one setback, he cannot properly work effectively nor efficiently because he only has one computer he only acquired very difficultly and through sacrifices during his time at University. In order to equip his space and offer his services, he needs the necessary tools, and is asking for a loan of 425 dollars, with the goal of offering a better service to his customers. He also promises to dedicate himself and work very hard in order to repay the loan in the time of 6 months. In order to see his project completed it rests in the generosity of you and the shared dream to turn his dream into reality.

Translated from Spanish by Kiva Volunteer, Kristin Connor.

Jorge Enrique de 24 años, joven entusiasta y con gran deseo de prosperar en su vida personal y profesional, acaba de terminar su carrera universitaria y ya decidió acondicionar un espacio de su reducida sala para emprender su propia empresa y brindar sus servicios de arquitecto a la población, pero tiene un inconveniente, no puede desenvolverse eficaz y eficientemente porque sólo cuenta con una computadora que adquirió con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio durante su etapa universitaria.Para acondicionar este espacio y brindar sus servicios dotado de todas y cada una de las herramientas necesarias está solicitando un préstamo de 425 dólares, con el deseo de ofrecerles el mejor servicio a sus clientes, además promete dedicarse y esforzarse mucho para devolver el préstamo que le faciliten en un lapso de 6 meses y para llevar a cabo su propósito recurre a cada uno de los corazones generosos con el deseo de convertir su anhelo en realidad

loans.use: To begin his own consulting business.

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
Mr. Lucio P. is 46 years old and lives with his companion María Larrosa. They have three children and even though they are still young and in school, they assist in a public school in the city. Lucio is very proud of his children, who are excellent kids and good students.

Lucio has a small grocery store at his house that María also helps to administer. Lucio provides delivery services and sells around the neighborhood to better accommodate his clients. After saving a little, they have been able to supply and increase their grocery store. They offer all types of consumer items such as pasta, milk, meat, vegetable, etc.

Thanks to the variety of their products and their hard work, they now need to expand the infrastructure of their business. They are seeking a loan of $600.

Translated from Spanish by Gabrielle Sham, Kiva Volunteer.

EL señor Lucio P. tiene 46 años, el vive en pareja con la señora María Larrosa y tienen tres hijos que están aún en edad escolar, asisten a un colegio público de la ciudad; Lucio nos cuenta que está muy orgulloso de sus hijos, ya que son excelentes hijos y buenos estudiantes. Lucio posee una despensa en su casa, que la atiende y administra junto con María. Lucio realiza entregas a domicilio y ventas por el barrio, dando así mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Luego de ahorrar un poco pudieron montar la despensa, y de a poco fue creciendo. En la misma ofrecen todo tipo de artículos de primera necesidad como fideos, leche, carne, verduras, etc. Gracias a la buena atención y la variedad de sus productos, hoy se ven obligados a ampliar la infraestructura del negocio, para ello solicitan un crédito de $ 600.

loans.use: Expand the infrastructure of their business.

loans.name: Emilia Eduardo

texts.pt:
Emilia is a single mother of 4 children. She joined the program in 2000. Her first loan was of 250$ to buy home appliances. She continue to request loans until she was able to open a small grocery store. With this loan she plans on increasing the inventory of her store. With the income from the business, Emilia wants to improve her home.

Translated from Portuguese by Mariana Komatsuzaki Fraga, Kiva Volunteer.

Emilia e solteira, msd tem 4 filhos. Ela entrou para o programa de Credito em 2000. O primeiro emprestimo que ela tomou foi de $250 para a compra de alguns aparelhos electrodomesticos. Foi fazendo outros emprestimos e conseguiu abrir uma pequena loja onde vende produtos de primeira necessidade. Com o valor do emprestimo ela quer investir neste seu negocio que esta a crescer . Com os lucros ela quer melhorar a sua residencia.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.es:
Evelyn C. is 24 years old, single, and living with her parents. She is one of five children, three male and two female. Her father is a constructor and her mother sells fruits and vegetables. Both her parents come from humble families.
