Her husband works as a teacher, earning only a meager income but fortunately, three of her children are employed at a garment factory. The rest attend school. Mrs. Lach S. hopes to use this loan to purchase fertilizer and seeds to expand her cultivation of crops to sell.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds to expand her cultivation of crops

loans.name: Ni Nyoman Dewi

texts.id:
The economic difficulty is affecting Nyoman Dewi and family. Without giving up; having capital, enthusiasm and hard work, with the loan of Rp 1.400.000 (about USD175), purchased 3 piglets using Rp 600.000 (USD75), each at Rp 200.000. The remainder will be use for feed and supplies. Pig usually is ready for slaughter at 6 months, generating gross income of Rp 2.200.000 (USD275) from cost of Rp 1.000.000 (USD125). With the earnings she can save for a plot of land for retirement as all her children are already married. With this loan from DINARI, she hopes to accomplish her goal.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Kesulitan ekonomi sangat dirasakan Nyoman Dewi dan keluarganya. Namun Nyoman Dewi tidak putus asa.Bermodalkan semangat dan kerja keras Ni Nyoman Dewi meminjam uang dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.400.000,-.dan membeli 3 ekor babi penggemukan dengan harga Rp.600.000.Harganya perekor Rp. 200.000, sisa uangnya dipakai untuk modal pakan .Babi bisa dipanen setelah berumur 6 bulan . Pendapatan kotor Rp.2.200.000,- pengeluaran pakannya Rp.1.000.000,-.Jadi penghasilan bersih yang diperoleh oleh Ni Nyoman Dewi Rp 600.000- per 6 bulan. Dari keuntungan yang diperoleh Ni Nyoman Dewi ditabung untuk bisa membeli sepetak tanah untuk hari tuanya karena semua anak-anaknya sudah berumah tangga. Harapan Ni Nyoman Dewi supaya Dinari bisa terus memberikan pinjaman untuk usahanya ini.

loans.use: Purchase feed and piglets (Membeli pakan ternak dan bibit babi untuk penggemukkan)

loans.name: Phat

texts.en: Mrs. Phat B. is a 41-year-old mother of two school-aged children and lives with her husband in Kampong Cham province, Cambodia. She works selling vegetables at an open-air market, while her husband is a farmer growing crops. Together they earn around $6 each day. Mrs. Phat B. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more vegetables to meet her clients’ demands.

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing more vegetables to meet her clients' needs.

loans.name: Chim

texts.en:
Mrs. Chim S. is a 51-year-old widow and lives with her one child in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works selling grocery products to the people in her area, which enables her to generate around $5 profit each day. Her single child works as a teacher, earning $80 each month.

Mrs. Chim S. hopes to use this loan to expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery items to meet her growing customer demand for this coming Pchum Ben festival. (The fifteen day of the tenth month of the Khmer calendar marks the Pchum Ben festival. This is a time when the spirits of the dead ancestors walk the Earth. And the living can ease their suffering by offering them food to eat.)

loans.use: To expand her inventory by purchasing more grocery items to meet her growing customer demand for this coming Pchum Ben festival

loans.name: Desak Putu Pujawati

texts.id:
Desak Putu Pujawati and husband, Komang Merta Jiwa, owned a pig farm. All this effort is to support their 3 children’s education, the eldest in secondary while 2 other in elementary level. The loan form DINARI of Rp 1.400.000 (USD175), will be used to purchase 3 piglets (Rp 750.000) the remainder for feed and supplies. The piglets will be ready sold at 6 months, consuming Rp 1.300.000 of feed and original cost of piglets of Rp 750.000, total cost of Rp 2.050.000 (USD260). Gross income from selling the 3 pigs will be Rp 3.000.000 (USD375), net income of Rp 950.000 (USD120). This will supplement the family finances for the 3 children’s education.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Desak Putu Pujawati dan suaminya Komang Merta Jiwa memiliki kesibukan memelihara babi penggemukan. Semua yang dilakukannya untuk menyekolahkan 3 anaknya yang pertama duduk dibangku SMP dan 2 anaknya lagi duduk dibangku SD. Modal yang dipergunakan Desak Putu Pujawati diberi oleh Dinari sebesar Rp.1.400.000,-.modal yang didapat dipergunakan dengan baik untuk membeli 3 ekor bibit babi dengan harga Rp.750.000.- sisanya untuk pakan seperti membeli dedak padi, dedak gandum dan konsentrat . Babi penggemukan sudah siap untuk dijual setelah berumur 6 bulan biaya pakan yang dihabiskan sampai siap dipanen sebesar Rp. 1.300.000-.ditambah modal bibit Rp.750.000,- menjadi Rp.2.050.000,-. Pendapat kotor yang didapat dari 3 babi penggemukan sebesar Rp.3.000.000,- jadi penghasilan bersih yang didapat oleh Desak Putu Pujawati sebesar Rp.950,000,-. Dengan hasil inilah Desak Putu Pujawati bisa membantu keuangan keluarganya untuk menyekolahkan 3 anaknya yang membutuhkan biaya yang cukup besar .

loans.use: Purchase quality pig feed for maximum growth (Membeli pakan babi yang lebih berkwalitas untuk program penggemukkan sehingga babinya bisa berkembang dengan maksimal)

loans.name: Umi Farida

texts.id:
Umi Farida is an exceptional mother; she operates a motorcycle repair shop assisted by her husband, a member of the professional motorcycle mechanic. Her diligent efforts enable her family to live together including educating her 2 daughters. However her efforts frequently encounter funding problems as the cost of stocking spare parts are not inexpensive. Her family’s daily expenses are Rp 25.000 (USD3), monthly Rp 750.000, before the cost of education and house lease. Umi and her husband did not lose hope and continue to work hard with the funding provided by DINARI.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Umi Farida adalah seorang ibu yang sangat luar biasa, dia membuka usaha bengkel sepeda motor yang dibantu oleh suaminya yang berprofesi sebagai ahli mekanik sepeda motor. Usaha yang ditekuninya ini mampu menghidupi kehidupan mereka sebagai satu keluarga termasuk menyekolahkan kedua putrinya. Namun usaha Umi Farida sering berbenturan dengan masalah permodalan yang membutuhkan biaya yang bukan sedikit, karena Umi harus menyiapkan sparepart motor dibengkelnya. Biaya hidup keluarga adalah 25.000 rupiah/hari yang kalau di total adalah 750.000 rupiah/bulan belum termasuk biaya sekolah kedua anaknya dan kontrak rumah, namun Umi bersama suaminya tidak pernah putus asa mereka terus bekerja dengan tekun, apalagi mereka merasa terbantu dengan pinjaman dana yang diberikan oleh DINARI.

loans.use: Purchase Spare Parts (mebeli Sparepart Sepeda Motor)

loans.name: Siti Yuliani

texts.id:
At 38 years old, Siti Yuliani is still faithfully selling salad and tidbits in front of her house to supplement the family’s finances, as her husband’s income being a chauffeur is inadequate to cover living expenses and the cost of her 4 children’s education. The family’s daily expense is approximately Rp 50.000 (about USD6), while her husband’s daily earnings is the same amount. Thus to improve the family’s financial situation, she sells salad and tidbits and from her effort generate income of between Rp 20.000 to 50.000 (USD3-6) daily.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Diusianya yang ke 38 tahun Siti Yuliani masih setia dengan usahanya menjual rujak dan tipat didepan rumahnya untuk membantu perekonomian keluarganya, maklum pendapatan suami sebagai seorang sopir belum mampu mencukupi biaya hidup dan sekolah keempat anaknya. Dalam sehari mereka mengeluarkan biaya sekitar 50.000 rupiah untuk kebutuhan keluarga, sedangkan penghasilan suaminya adalah 50.000 rupiah/hari. Untuk itulah Siti berjualan rujak dan tipat guna menopang perekonomian keluarganya, dan dari usahanya itu Siti memperoleh keuntungan antara 20.000 – 50.000 rupiah perharinya.

loans.use: Additional funding for her business (Tambah modal untuk usaha dagang)

loans.name: Keo

texts.en:
Mrs. Keo S., 59, lives with her husband and two children in Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She works selling women's clothes to the people in her area, and she can typically earn around $5 profit each day. Her husband works as landlord renting out rooms, earning around $6 each day, while one of her children is employed as a security guard and the other has been working for a private company.

Mrs. Keo S. would like to expand her inventory by purchasing more fashionable clothes to meet her customers’ demands. She plans to use the remainder of the money to repair her house.

loans.use: For purchasing more fashionable clothes to meet her customs’ demands; the remainder of the money will be used to repair her house

loans.name: Siti Aminah

texts.id:
With such tough economy situation, Siti had to ask her mum to her raise one of child, but this doesn't mean Siti is not working, but rather her income from her food stall is not sufficient enough. They need to work hard to finance their child's education and as well pay for their business's expenses. However with the help from DInari, they manage to get a profit of 50.000 rupiah a day with the help of her husband who is also doing batik.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Keadaan ekonomi yang sulit membuat ibu dari dua orang anak ini harus rela menitipkan salah satu anaknya pada neneknya, bukan berarti Siti Aminah tidak bekerja, penghasilan dari usahanya membuka warung nasi belum mampu memenuhi kebutuhan keluarganya. Usaha terus dilakukan dengan bekerja keras bersama sang suami untuk bisa menyekolahkan anaknya dan membayar kontrak rumah yang mereka tempati. Usaha mereka semakin berkembang ketika mereka mendapat pinjaman modal dari yayasan DINARI, keuntungan yang didapat adalah 50.000 rupiah perhari yang didukung oleh suami yang mempunyai usaha batik.

loans.use: Membeli bahan-bahan makanan - Stocking up food

loans.name: Nuryanto

texts.id:
Nuryanto has a Show Room selling second vehicle and spare parts. As a husband he must be able to contribute to his household. He started this business since 1994 started selling spare part sine 1987 and later second hand vehicles later on. Nuryanto has to work hard because his two children are still schooling and he still has to pay in monthly rental for his shop.

Translated from Bahasa by bernard, Kiva volunteer.

Nuryanto mempunyai usaha Show Room sepeda motor dan mobil bekas, sebagai seorang suami dia harus mampu menghidupi istri dan anak-anaknya. Usaha ini sudah ditekuninya sejak tahun 1994, “awalnya sih sepeda motor pada tahun 1987”, katanya, kemudian berkembang sampai kepada mobil bekas. Usaha Nuryanto tersebut harus bias memenuhi kebutuhan pendidikan kedua anaknya, kontrak tanah dan tempat usaha serta biaya hidup setiap hari. Untuk itu Nuryanto bekerja ekstra keras untuk memenuhi semua kebutuhan itu.

loans.use: Modal untuk membeli sepeda motor dan mobil bekas - Buying spare parts and second hand vehicle.

loans.name: Khiem

texts.en:
Khiem and his family live in Lập Phuớc hamlet, in the Tân Lập commune of Hàm Thuận Nam district.

Khiem works as a motorbike driver and his wife purchases wasted materials to sell. They plant some vegetables and raise several chickens to eat. Their daughter is in the 7th grade class.

Their average income is $12.50 USD per month/person. They wish to borrow $75 USD to raise a cow so that they can save funds for their children’s schooling. They plan to pay back the loan during the course of seven months.

loans.use: To raise a cow

loans.name: Cuong

texts.en:
Cuong and his family live in Lap Phuoc hamlet in the T. lap commune of Ham Thuan Nam district.

Cuong's household has a total of four members: Cuong and his his wife and their two children who are very young (three and four years old, respectively). Cuong works as a day laborer. His wife plants maize and raises several chickens.

Together, their average income is $10 USD per month/person. They wish to borrow $75 USD to buy a cow so that it can reproduce. They will pay back the loan over the course of seven months.

loans.use: To raise a cow
